… [the four owls]249-the four owls looked below and saw [the past sea]250-the past sea glinting with silver spangles from the moon ’s light and then , directly ahead , spreading into the night , were the twisting branches of the largest tree [they]249-the four owls had ever seen , [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree .

CHAPTER ONE

A Mobbing of Crows

[Soren]122-soren felt the blind snake shift in the deep feathers between [his]122-soren shoulders as [he]122-soren and [the three other owls]251-the three other owls flew through the buffeting winds . [They]249-the four owls had been flying for hours now and it seemed as if in the last minutes the darkness had begun to dissolve drop by drop , and [they]249-the four owls were now passing from the full black of the night into the first light of the morning . Beneath [them]249-the four owls [a river]252-a river slid like a dark ribbon over [the earth]253-the earth .

“ Let ’s keep flying even though it ’s getting light , ”[123-twilight] said [Twilight]123-twilight , the immense Great Gray Owl that flew downwind of [Soren]122-soren . “ [We]249-the four owls ’re getting nearer . [I]123-twilight just feel it . ”[123-twilight]

It was to [the Sea of [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere]254-the sea of hoolemere [they]249-the four owls flew , and in [the middle of [that sea]256-that sea]255-the middle of that sea was [an island]257-an island and on [that island]258-that island there was a tree called [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree and in this tree there was an order of owls . It was said that these owls would rise each night into the blackness and perform noble deeds . [The universe of owls]260-the universe of owls was desperately in need of such deeds . For with [[its]260-the universe of owls many kingdoms]261-its many kingdoms [it]260-the universe of owls was about to be destroyed by a terrible evil .

Hidden away in a maze of stone canyons and ravines there was indeed [a violent nation of deadly owls known as [St. Aegolius]24-st. aegolius]262-a violent nation of deadly owls known as st. aegolius . The evil of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s , as it was often called , had touched almost every owl kingdom in some way or another . [Soren]122-soren and [[his]122-soren best friend]263-his best friend , [Gylfie]125-gylfie , [the tiny Elf Owl]264-the tiny elf owl , had both been captured by [[St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s patrols]265-st. aggie ’s patrols when [they]249-the four owls were young nestlings unable to fly . [Twilight]123-twilight , too , had been snatched but , unlike [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie , [he]123-twilight had managed to escape before being imprisoned . [[Digger]126-digger ’s youngest brother]266-digger ’s youngest brother had been eaten by [a St. [Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s patrol]267-a st. aggie ’s patrol and [[his]266-digger ’s youngest brother parents]268-his parents later killed . [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie had met [Twilight]123-twilight and [Digger]126-digger , [a Burrowing Owl]127-the burrowing owl , shortly after [their]249-the four owls own daring escape from [the stone canyons of [St. Aggie ’s]124-st. aggie]269-the stone canyons of st. aggie ’s .

Although [the four owls]249-the four owls had met as [orphans]271-orphans , [they]249-the four owls had become so much more . In [a desert]272-a desert still stained with the blood of [two of [the fiercest of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s elite warrior owls]274-the fiercest of st. aggie ’s elite warrior owls , whom [they]249-the four owls had defeated]273-two of the fiercest of st. aggie ’s elite warrior owls , whom they had defeated , [they]249-the four owls had discovered a knowledge , along with a feeling deep in [their]249-the four owls gizzards , where all owls felt [their]249-the four owls strongest emotions . And this knowledge was that [they]249-the four owls were a band forevermore , one for all and all for one , bound by the deepest loyalty and dedicated to the survival of [the kingdoms of all owls]275-the kingdoms of all owls . [They]249-the four owls had sworn an oath in [that desert]276-that desert drenched with blood and tinged with the silver light of the moon . [They]249-the four owls would go to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere . It was as [a band]277-a band that [they]249-the four owls knew [they]249-the four owls must go and find its great tree , which loomed now as the heart of wisdom and nobility in [a world that was becoming insane and ignoble]278-a world that was becoming insane and ignoble . [They]249-the four owls must warn of the evil that threatened . [They]249-the four owls must become part of [this ancient kingdom of [guardian knights on silent wings]280-guardian knights on silent wings]279-this ancient kingdom of guardian knights on silent wings .

[They]249-the four owls hoped [they]249-the four owls were drawing near even though [the river]281-the river [they]249-the four owls now followed was not [the River Hoole]26-the river hoole , the one that led to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere . Still , [Twilight]123-twilight said [he]123-twilight was sure that [this river]282-this river would lead to [the Hoole]53-hoole and on to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere , and the very thought of [this legendary island]283-this legendary island in [the sea]284-the sea made [the four owls]249-the four owls stroke even harder against the confusing winds . But [Soren]122-soren felt [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver stir again in [his]122-soren feathers . [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , as [he]122-soren called [her]128-mrs. p. , had been the old nest - maid in [the hollow where [[Soren]122-soren ’s parents]287-soren ’s parents had made [[their]287-soren ’s parents home]288-their home]286-the hollow where soren ’s parents had made their home . These blind snakes had been born without eyes , and where [their]289-their eyes should have been there were only two slight indentations . The rosy - scaled reptiles were kept by many owls to tend [the nests]290-the nests and make sure [they]290-the nests were clean and free of maggots and various vermin that found [their]287-soren ’s parents way into the hollows . [Soren]122-soren had thought that [he]122-soren would never see [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. again , and yet [they]287-soren ’s parents had found [each other]291-each other just days after [his]122-soren escape from [St. Aggie ’s]124-st. aggie . [She]128-mrs. p. had told [him]122-soren what [Soren]122-soren had long suspected — that it was [[his]122-soren older brother]292-his older brother , [Kludd]129-kludd , who had pushed [him]122-soren from the nest when [[his]122-soren parents]268-his parents were out hunting . Although [he]122-soren had survived the fall , still being flightless [he]122-soren was prey to any ground animal . Ground animal ! Who would have ever thought another owl would be the greatest danger ? Until that moment when [he]122-soren was snatched and felt [himself]122-soren being carried into the night sky by a pair of talons , [Soren]122-soren had thought that the worst predator in [the forest]294-the forest , from [an owl]295-an owl ’s point of view , was [a raccoon]296-a raccoon . And then [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. told [him]122-soren that [she]128-mrs. p. had suspected that [Kludd]129-kludd had done the same thing to [Eglantine]130-eglantine , [[his]122-soren baby sister]297-his baby sister . When [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. had protested , [Kludd]129-kludd had threatened to eat [her]130-eglantine . So the poor old snake had no choice but to leave — very quickly .

Now [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. slithered toward [Soren]122-soren ’s left ear , the higher ear and the easiest for [her]128-mrs. p. to reach . “ [Soren]122-soren , ”[128-mrs. p.] [she]128-mrs. p. whispered , “ [I]128-mrs. p. ’m not sure if it is a good idea to keep flying with all this light . [We]1340-we do n’t want to get mobbed . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ Mobbed ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked .

“ [You]120-mrs. plithiver know , crows . ”[128-mrs. p.]

[Soren]122-soren felt a chill run through [his]122-soren gizzard .

Perhaps if [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver had not been whispering [her]128-mrs. p. warning in [his]122-soren ear [he]122-soren might have heard the chuffing sound of wings , and not owl wings , overhead .

“ Crow to windward ! ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie cried . And then suddenly the rosy dawn sky turned black .

“ [We]1340-we ’re being mobbed ! ”[123-twilight] shrieked [Twilight]123-twilight .

Oh , [Glaux]131-glaux ! thought [Soren]122-soren . This was the worst thing that could befall any owl flying in the daytime . But it was still very early . Crows at night were fine . [Owls]132-owls were crows ’ worst enemies at night . [They]132-owls could attack [them]132-owls as [they]132-owls slept , but crows during the day were something else . Crows in daylight were terrible . If [a crow]298-a crow discovered [an owl]295-an owl during the daytime , even if it was just one crow , that bird had a way of signaling others and soon an entire flock would arrive and mob the owls , diving at [their]132-owls heads with [their]132-owls sharp beaks , trying to tear out [their]132-owls eyes .

“ Scatter ! ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie cried out . “ Scatter and loop . ”[125-gylfie]

Suddenly , [Gylfie]125-gylfie seemed to be everywhere at once . [She]125-gylfie was like a crazed insect , zipping through the air . [Soren]122-soren , [Digger]126-digger , and [Twilight]123-twilight began to follow [her]125-gylfie lead . [Soren]122-soren quickly noticed that [Gylfie]125-gylfie would swoop up from [her]125-gylfie loops and spiraling dives to just beneath the crows , stabbing them on the underside of [their]132-owls wings . This made the crows drop [their]132-owls wings down close to [their]132-owls bodies and lose altitude .

“ [I]128-mrs. p. feel one coming up behind , ”[128-mrs. p.] hissed [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. “ Off [your]122-soren windward tail feathers . ”[128-mrs. p.]

[Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. carefully began to crawl backward on [Soren]122-soren . [He]122-soren adjusted [his]122-soren wings . For even with [her]128-mrs. p. light weight , as [she]128-mrs. p. moved [he]122-soren could feel [his]122-soren balance shift . [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. could smell the crow ’s stinky breath as it closed in . [Soren]122-soren began to dive . [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. continued to make [her]128-mrs. p. way toward the tail feathers that were stiffer and coarser . A great whiff of crow stench engulfed [her]128-mrs. p. . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver raised [her]120-mrs. plithiver head in the direction of the foul odor and began screaming , “ Scum of the sky , curse of [the earth]253-the earth , riffraff of [the Yonder]17-the yonder . Scurrilous crowilous , ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [she]120-mrs. plithiver ranted .

[The Yonder]17-the yonder was what all blind snakes called the sky because [it]17-the yonder was so far away , about as far away as anything could be for a snake . But [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. saved [her]128-mrs. p. most poisonous insult for last—“Wet pooper ! ”[128-mrs. p.] Blind snakes were especially impressed by owls ’ digestive systems , which allowed [them]300-they to compress certain parts of waste into neat pellets that [they]300-they yarped up through [their]300-they mouths , as opposed to other disgusting birds whom [they]300-they referred to as “ wet poopers . ”[300-they] The crow seemed to brake mid - flight . [His]122-soren beak fell open , [his]122-soren wings folded .

[Crows]133-crows are simple birds . And what [this crow had just seen and heard — a snake hissing curses and rising from the back feathers of an owl]301-this crow had just seen and heard — a snake hissing curses and rising from the back feathers of an owl — stunned [him]122-soren . [He]122-soren went “ yeep , ”[122-soren] which meant that [he]122-soren simply froze in flight and began to plummet to earth .

The crows by this time had begun to disappear . [Twilight]123-twilight flew up to [Soren]122-soren ’s windward side . “ [Digger]126-digger ’s hurt . ”[123-twilight]

Indeed , when [Soren]122-soren looked in the direction of [Digger]126-digger , [he]122-soren saw [the Burrowing Owl]302-the burrowing owl tipping dangerously to one side . “ [We]1342-we ’ve got to find [a place to land]1343-a place to land . ”[302-the burrowing owl]

[Gylfie]125-gylfie flew up breathlessly . “ [I]125-gylfie do n’t know how much longer [Digger]126-digger can last . [He]126-digger ’s not flying straight at all . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Which way is [he]126-digger tipping ? ”[128-mrs. p.] [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. asked .

“ Downwind , ”[123-twilight] said [Twilight]123-twilight .

“ Quick ! ”[128-mrs. p.] [she]128-mrs. p. ordered . “ Let ’s get over there . [I]128-mrs. p. might be able to help . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ [You]128-mrs. p. ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight asked somewhat incredulously .

“ Remember , [dear]1344-dear , how [Digger]126-digger had been asking [me]123-twilight to ride on [his]126-digger back in [the desert]1345-the desert ? This might just be the time . ”[123-twilight]

A few seconds later [they]303-they were coming in on [Digger]126-digger ’s upwind wing .

“ [Digger]126-digger , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said , “ [we]303-they know [you]126-digger ’re hurt . ”[122-soren]

“ [I]127-the burrowing owl do n’t know if [I]127-the burrowing owl can make it , ”[127-the burrowing owl] [the Burrowing Owl]127-the burrowing owl groaned . “ Oh , if [I]127-the burrowing owl could only walk . ”[127-the burrowing owl]

“ There ’s a stand of trees really close , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said . “ [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. has an idea that might help [you]126-digger . ”[122-soren]

“ What ’s that ? ”[127-the burrowing owl]

“ [She]128-mrs. p. ’s going to get on [your]126-digger good wing . That will tip [your]126-digger injured wing up again , lighten the drag on it . Gylfie meanwhile will fly under [your]126-digger bad wing and create a little updraft for it . It might work . ”[122-soren]

“ [I]126-digger do n’t know , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger moaned miserably .

“ Faith , [boy]1346-boy ! Faith ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] exhorted [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver . “ Now let [’s]303-they get on with it . ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

“ [I]126-digger really do n’t think [I]126-digger can make it , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger gasped .

“ [You]1346-boy can , [boy]1346-boy ! [You]1346-boy can ! ”[128-mrs. p.] said [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. [Her]128-mrs. p. voice grew amazingly strong . “ [You]1346-boy shall go on to the finish . [You]1346-boy shall fly to [the forests]1348-the forests , to the trees , to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere . [You]1346-boy have defended [yourself]1346-boy against these crows . [You]1346-boy have strode across [deserts]1349-deserts . [You]1346-boy shall defend [yourself]1346-boy now by flying . [You]1346-boy shall fly into the wind , into the light , into this new day . Whatever the cost , [you]1346-boy shall fly on . [You]1346-boy shall not fail or falter . [You]1346-boy shall not weaken . [You]1346-boy shall finish the flight . ”[128-mrs. p.] [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ’s voice swelled in the growing light of the morning and somehow it filled [them]304-them all with new courage .

Now [Soren]122-soren flew in so close to [Digger]126-digger that [his]122-soren wing was touching the tip of [Digger]126-digger ’s good wing . [They]305-they were ready for the transfer . “ Now , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ! Go ! ”[305-they]

The old nest snake began to slither out onto [Soren]122-soren ’s wing . [Soren]122-soren felt the pressure of air around [his]122-soren body and the cushions of wind under [his]122-soren wings shift . The air surrounding [him]122-soren seemed to fray . [He]122-soren had to concentrate hard not to go into a roll . But if [he]122-soren was frightened , [he]122-soren could not imagine what [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. was feeling as [she]128-mrs. p. blindly slithered out to the tip of [his]122-soren wing and began the precarious transfer to [Digger]126-digger .

“ Almost there , [dear]1344-dear , almost there . Steady now . Steady . ”[128-mrs. p.]

Suddenly , [she]128-mrs. p. was gone . [His]122-soren wing felt light . [Soren]122-soren turned [his]122-soren head . [She]128-mrs. p. had made it . [She]128-mrs. p. was now crawling up toward the base of [Digger]126-digger ’s wing . It was working . [Digger]126-digger ’s flight grew even .

“ [We]306-we ’re bringin ’ [him]126-digger in ! [We]306-we ’re bringing [him]126-digger in ! ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight shouted triumphantly . Creating direct updrafts that supported [Digger]126-digger ’s flight , [Twilight]123-twilight flew below , along with [Gylfie]125-gylfie who , under the injured wing , was doing the same .

Finally , [they]306-we landed in a large spruce tree . There was [a perfect hollow for [them]306-we to spend the day in]307-a perfect hollow for them to spend the day in , and [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver immediately launched into a frenzy of action . “ [I]120-mrs. plithiver need worms ! [Big fat ones]1351-big fat ones , and leeches . Quick — all of [you]306-we ! Go out and get [me]120-mrs. plithiver what [I]120-mrs. plithiver need . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver crawled onto [Digger]126-digger ’s back . “ Now , this wo n’t hurt , [dear]1344-dear , but [I]120-mrs. plithiver just want to feel what those awful crows did to [you]1344-dear . ”[120-mrs. plithiver] Gently , [she]120-mrs. plithiver began flicking [her]120-mrs. plithiver forked tongue over [his]126-digger wound . “ It ’s not deep . Soon the owls were back with the worms and leeches that [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. had ordered . [She]120-mrs. plithiver directed [Soren]122-soren to place two leeches on the wound . “ That will cleanse it . [I]120-mrs. plithiver ca n’t tell [you]1344-dear how filthy crows are ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

[Digger]126-digger sighed . “ That feels so good . ”[126-digger]

[They]340-the four young owls were now skirting the edges of [the Kingdom of Tyto]341-the kingdom of tyto , [the kingdom from which [[Soren]122-soren ’s family]318-soren ’s family came]342-the kingdom from which soren ’s family came . [She]120-mrs. plithiver knew [he]122-soren must have been thinking of [[his]122-soren parents]268-his parents , [[his]122-soren lost family]346-his lost family , and , in particular , [[his]122-soren sister]347-his sister , [Eglantine]130-eglantine , whom [he]122-soren loved most dearly . The chances of finding any of them were almost zero , and [she]120-mrs. plithiver knew that [Soren]122-soren knew this , but still [she]120-mrs. plithiver could feel [his]122-soren pain . [He]122-soren had once said to [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. shortly after [they]348-they had been reunited that [he]122-soren had felt as if there were a hole in [his]122-soren gizzard , and that when [he]122-soren and [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. had found [each other]291-each other again , it was as if a little bit of the hole had been mended . But [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. knew that despite the patch [she]128-mrs. p. had provided there was still a hole .

When the first stars began to fade , [they]348-they looked for [a place to land and settle in before morning]350-a place to land and settle in before morning . It was [Gylfie]125-gylfie who spotted an old sycamore , silvery in this moonless night . The full moon had begun its dwenking many nights before , growing slimmer and slimmer until it dwenked and disappeared entirely , and there would not be a trace of it for another night or so until the newing began .

CHAPTER TWO

In the Company of [Sooty Owls]139-sooty owls

Oh , yes , [dear]1344-dear . [I]0-i ’ve heard of it , but [you]1344-dear know [they]352-they say it ’s just a story , a legend . ”[352-they]

“ Well , it ’s not exactly that , [Sweetums]140-sweetums , ”[141-the sooty owl] said [[the Sooty Owl]141-the sooty owl ’s mate]353-the sooty owl ’s mate .

The four owls had been warmly welcomed into [the large and spacious hollow in the sycamore]354-the large and spacious hollow in the sycamore by [a family of Sooty Owls]355-a family of sooty owls . [These two owls]356-these two owls were much nicer than the Masked Owls . Indeed very , very nice and , [Soren]122-soren thought , very , very boring . [They]356-these two owls called [each other]291-each other by nicknames — [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [Swatums]142-swatums . [They]356-these two owls never said a cross word . Everything was just perfect . [The children]358-the children had all grown up .

“ Left [the nest]1380-the nest a year ago . Still nearby , ”[326-the male] said [Swatums]142-swatums , [the male]326-the male . “ But who knows , [Sweetums]140-sweetums might come up with another clutch of eggs in the new breeding season . And if [she]140-sweetums does n’t , well , [we]356-these two owls two are enough company for [each other]291-each other . ”[326-the male] Then [they]356-these two owls began preening [each other]291-each other .

It seemed to [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie that [they]356-these two owls preened incessantly . [They]356-these two owls always had [their]356-these two owls beaks in each other ’s feathers , except , of course , when [they]356-these two owls were hunting . And when [they]356-these two owls were hunting [they]356-these two owls were [exceptional killers]361-exceptional killers . It was as predators that [these Sooty Owls]362-these sooty owls became the most interesting . [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [Swatums]142-swatums were simply deadly , and [Soren]122-soren had to admit [he]122-soren had never eaten so well . [Twilight]123-twilight had told [them]356-these two owls to watch carefully , for [Sooty Owls]139-sooty owls were among the rare owls that went after [tree prey and not just ground prey]363-tree prey and not just ground prey .

So tonight [they]356-these two owls were all feasting on three of a type of opossum that [they]356-these two owls called sugar gliders . [They]364-they were the sweetest things that any of [the young band of owls]365-the young band of owls had ever tasted . Maybe that was why [the two Sooties]366-the two sooties called each other [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [Swatums]142-swatums . [They]366-the two sooties had simply eaten too many sweet things . Perhaps eating a steady diet of sugar gliders made an owl ooze with gooiness . [Soren]122-soren thought [he]122-soren was going to go stark raving yoicks if [he]122-soren had to listen to [their]366-the two sooties gooey talk a moment longer , but luckily [they]366-the two sooties were now , in [their]366-the two sooties own boring way , discussing the Great Ga’Hoole Tree .

[Sweetums]140-sweetums was questioning [[her]140-sweetums mate]338-her mate . “ Well , what do [you]338-her mate mean , [Swatums]142-swatums , by ‘ not exactly . ’ Is n’t it either a legend or not ? [I]140-sweetums mean , it ’s not really real . ”[140-sweetums]

“ Well , [Sweetums]140-sweetums , [some]1382-some say it ’s simply invisible . ”[125-gylfie]

“ What ’s simple about being invisible ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie asked .

“ Ohh , hooo - hooo . ”[368-the two sooty owls] [The two Sooty Owls]368-the two sooty owls were convulsed in laughter . “ Does n’t [she]140-sweetums remind [you]338-her mate of Tibby , Swa - tums ? ”[125-gylfie] Then there was more cooing and giggling and disgusting preening . [Soren]122-soren felt that [Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s question was a perfectly sensible one . What , indeed , was simple about in - visibleness ?

“ Well , [young’uns]1365-young’uns , ”[142-swatums] [Swatums]142-swatums answered , “ there is nothing simple . It ’s just that it has been said that the Great Ga’Hoole Tree is invisible . That it grows on [the island]1384-the island in [the middle of [a vast sea]1386-a vast sea]1385-the middle of a vast sea , [a sea called [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere that is nearly as wide as [an ocean]1388-an ocean]1387-a sea called hoolemere that is nearly as wide as an ocean . [A sea that is always wrapped in fog]1389-a sea that is always wrapped in fog , [an island feathered in blizzards]1390-an island feathered in blizzards , and a tree veiled in mist . ”[142-swatums]

“ So , ”[123-twilight] said [Twilight]123-twilight , “ it ’s not really invisible , it ’s just bad weather . ”[123-twilight]

“ Not exactly , ”[142-swatums] replied [Swatums]142-swatums . [Twilight]123-twilight cocked [his]123-twilight head . “ It seems that for some the fog lifts , the blizzards stop , and the mist blows away . ”[123-twilight]

“ For some ? ”[125-gylfie] asked [Gylfie]125-gylfie .

“ For [those who believe]1391-those who believe . ”[142-swatums] [Swatums]142-swatums paused and then sniffed in disdain . “ But do [they]1391-those who believe say what ? Believe in what ? No . [You]1392-you see , that is the problem . Owls with fancy ideas — ridiculous ! That ’s how [you]1392-you get into trouble . [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [I]142-swatums do n’t believe in fancy ideas . Fancy ideas do n’t keep the belly full and the gizzard grinding . Sugar gliders , plump rats , voles — that ’s what counts . ”[142-swatums] [Sweetums]140-sweetums nodded and [Swatums]142-swatums went over and began preening [her]140-sweetums for the millionth time that day .

[Soren]122-soren knew in that moment that even if [he]122-soren were starving to death , [he]122-soren would still find [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [Swatums]142-swatums [the most boring owls on [Earth]370-earth]369-the most boring owls on earth .

That late afternoon as [they]371-they nestled in [the hollow]372-the hollow , waiting for [First Black]138-first black , [Gylfie]125-gylfie stirred sleepily . “ [You]122-soren awake , [Soren]122-soren ? ”[125-gylfie]

“ Yeah . [I]125-gylfie ca n’t wait to get to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere . ”[125-gylfie]

“ [Me]125-gylfie , neither . But [I]125-gylfie was wondering , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ Wondering what ? ”[125-gylfie]

“ Do [you]125-gylfie think that [Streak]143-streak and [Zan]144-zan love each other as much as [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [Swatums]142-swatums ? ”[143-streak] [Streak]143-streak and [Zan]144-zan were [two Bald Eagles who had helped [them]371-they in [the desert]1345-the desert when [Digger]126-digger had been attacked by [the lieutenants from [St. Aggie’s]148-st. aggie’s]375-the lieutenants from st. aggie’s]373-two bald eagles who had helped them in the desert when digger had been attacked by the lieutenants from st. aggie’s — [the very ones who had earlier eaten [[Digger]126-digger ’s brother]377-digger ’s brother]376-the very ones who had earlier eaten digger ’s brother , [Flick]145-flick . [The two eagles]378-the two eagles had seemed deeply devoted to [each other]291-each other . Yet [Zan]144-zan could not utter a sound . [Her]380-her tongue had been torn out in battle .

What an interesting question , [Soren]122-soren thought . [[His]122-soren own parents]381-his own parents never preened [each other]291-each other as constantly as [Sweetums]140-sweetums and [Swatums]142-swatums , and [they]381-his own parents had n’t called [each other]291-each other gooey names , but [he]122-soren had never doubted [their]381-his own parents love for each other . “ [I]122-soren do n’t know , ”[122-soren] [he]122-soren replied . “ It ’s hard thinking about [mates]1393-mates . [I]122-soren mean , can [you]1394-you imagine ever having [a mate]1395-a mate or what [he]1395-a mate might be like ? ”[122-soren]

There was a long pause . “ Honestly , no , ”[125-gylfie] replied [Gylfie]125-gylfie .

[They]381-his own parents heard [Twilight]123-twilight stir in [his]123-twilight sleep .

“ If [I]126-digger never taste another sugar glider it will be too soon . ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger belched softly . “ [They]146-the sooties keep repeating on [me]126-digger . ”[126-digger]

[The four owls]249-the four owls had left at [First Black]138-first black and bid [their]249-the four owls farewells to [the Sooties]146-the sooties . [They]249-the four owls had now alighted on a tree limb with a good view down [the valley]385-the valley . [They]249-the four owls were looking for [a creek]386-a creek — any creek that could feed into [a river that hopefully would be [the River Hoole]26-the river hoole , which [they]249-the four owls could follow to [the Sea of Hoolemere]33-the sea of hoolemere]387-a river that hopefully would be the river hoole , which they could follow to the sea of hoolemere .

“ What do [you]126-digger mean ‘ keep repeating on [you]126-digger ’ ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said , imagining little possums gliding in and out of [Digger]126-digger ’s beak .

“ Just an expression . [[My]126-digger dad]1396-my dad used to say that after [he]1396-my dad ate centipedes . ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger sighed . “ And then [Ma]147-ma would say , ‘ Well , of course [they]1397-they keep repeating on [you]126-digger , [dear]1344-dear . [You]126-digger eat something that has all those legs , [they]1397-they ’re probably still running around inside [you]126-digger . ’ ”[126-digger]

[Gylfie]125-gylfie , [Twilight]123-twilight , and [Soren]122-soren burst out laughing .

[Digger]126-digger sighed again . “ [[My]126-digger mom]1399-my mom was really funny . [I]126-digger miss [her]1399-my mom jokes . ”[126-digger]

“ Come on , ”[125-gylfie] said [Gylfie]125-gylfie . “ [You]126-digger ’ll be okay . ”[125-gylfie]

“ But everything is so different here . [I]126-digger do n’t live in trees . Never have in [my]126-digger life . [I]126-digger ’m [a Burrowing Owl]1400-a burrowing owl . [I]126-digger lived in [desert burrows]1401-desert burrows . [I]126-digger do n’t hunt these silly creatures that glide and fly about through the limbs . [I]126-digger miss the taste of snake and crawly things that pick up the dirt . Whoops , sorry , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ”[126-digger]

“ Do n’t apologize , [Digger]126-digger . Most owls do eat snakes , not usually blind snakes , since [we]1402-we tend [[their]1403-their nests]1404-their nests , but other snakes . [[Soren]122-soren ’s parents]287-soren ’s parents were particularly sensitive and , out of respect for [me]125-gylfie , would not eat any snake . ”[125-gylfie]

[Twilight]123-twilight had hopped to a higher limb to see if [he]123-twilight could see any trace of [a creek]386-a creek that might lead to [a river]252-a river .

“ [He]123-twilight ’s not going to be able to see anything in this light . [I]125-gylfie do n’t care how good [his]123-twilight eyes are . A black trickle of [a creek in a dark forest]1406-a creek in a dark forest — forget it , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

Suddenly , [Soren]122-soren cocked [his]122-soren head , first one way , then the other .

“ What is it , [Soren]122-soren ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger asked .

“ [You]122-soren hear something ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight flew down and landed on a thin branch that creaked under [his]123-twilight weight .

“ Hush ! ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said .

[They]390-they all fell silent and watched as [the Barn Owl]391-the barn owl tipped , cocked , and pivoted [his]391-the barn owl head in a series of small movements . And , finally , [Soren]122-soren heard something . “ There is a trickle . [I]122-soren hear it . It ’s not a lot of water , but [I]122-soren can hear that it begins in reeds and then it starts to slide over stones . ”[122-soren]

[Barn Owls]139-sooty owls were known for [their]139-sooty owls extremely sensitive hearing . [They]139-sooty owls could contract and expand the muscles of [their]139-sooty owls facial disks to funnel the sound source to [their]139-sooty owls unevenly placed earholes . [The other owls]392-the other owls were in awe of [[their]392-the other owls friend]393-their friend ’s abilities .

“ Let ’s go . [I]122-soren ’ll lead , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said .

It was one of the few times [anyone]394-anyone except [Twilight]123-twilight had flown in the point position .

As [Soren]122-soren flew , [he]122-soren kept angling [his]122-soren head so that [his]122-soren two ears , one lower and one higher , could precisely locate the source of the water . Within a few minutes , [they]395-we had found a trickle and that trickle turned into [a stream]396-a stream , a stream full of the music of gently tumbling water . Then by dawn [that stream]397-that stream had become [a river]252-a river — [the River Hoole]26-the river hoole .

“ A masterful job of triangulation , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie cried . “ Simply masterful , [Soren]122-soren . [You]122-soren are [a premiere navigator]1407-a premiere navigator . ”[125-gylfie]

“ What ’s [she]125-gylfie saying ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger asked .

“ [She]125-gylfie ’s saying that [Soren]122-soren got [us]395-we here . Big words , [little owl]1408-little owl . ”[126-digger] But it was evident that [Twilight]123-twilight was clearly impressed .

“ So now what do [we]395-we do ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger asked .

“ Follow [the river]281-the river to [the Sea of Hoolemere]33-the sea of hoolemere , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said . “ Come on . [We]395-we still have a few hours until First Light . ”[123-twilight]

“ More flying ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger asked .

“ What ? [You]126-digger want to walk ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight replied .

“ [I]123-twilight would n’t mind . [My]123-twilight wings are tired . And it ’s not just [my]123-twilight wound . It ’s healed . ”[123-twilight]

[The three other owls]251-the three other owls stared at [Digger]126-digger in dismay . [Gylfie]125-gylfie hopped out on the tree branch [they]251-the three other owls had landed on and peered intently at [Digger]126-digger . “ Wings do n’t get tired . That ’s impossible . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Well , [mine]126-digger do . Ca n’t [we]395-we rest up a bit ? ”[251-the three other owls] Burrowing Owls , like [Digger]126-digger , were in fact known for [their]400-their running abilities . “ [I]122-soren ’m hungry , anyhow , ”[122-soren] said [Soren]122-soren . “ Let [me]122-soren see if [I]122-soren can catch [us]395-we something . ”[122-soren]

“ Please , no sugar gliders , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger added .

CHAPTER THREE

[Twilight]123-twilight Shows Off

[They]251-the three other owls had settled into the hollow of a fir tree and were eating some voles that [Soren]122-soren had brought back from [his]122-soren hunting expedition .

“ Refreshing , is n’t it , after sugar gliders ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ Hmmm ! ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger smacked [his]126-digger beak and made a satisfied sound .

“ What do [you]126-digger think the Great Ga’Hoole Tree will be like ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said dreamily , as a little bit of vole tail hung from [his]122-soren beak .

“ Different from [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s , that ’s for sure , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie offered .

“ Do [you]126-digger think [they]251-the three other owls know about [St. Aggie’s]148-st. aggie’s — the raids , the egg snatching , the … the … ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren hesitated .

“ The cannibalism , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ [You]122-soren might as well say it , [Soren]122-soren . Do n’t try to protect [me]126-digger . [I]126-digger ’ve seen the worst and [I]126-digger know it . ”[126-digger]

[They]402-they had all seen the worst .

[Twilight]123-twilight , who was huge to start with , was beginning to swell up in fury . [Soren]122-soren knew what was coming . [Twilight]123-twilight was not thinking about the owls of [Ga’Hoole]21-ga’hoole , [those noble guardian knights of the sky]403-those noble guardian knights of the sky . [He]123-twilight was thinking about [those ignoble , contemptible , basest of the base]404-those ignoble , contemptible , basest of the base , monstrous owls of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s . [Twilight]123-twilight had been orphaned so young that [he]123-twilight had not the slightest scrap of memory of [[his]123-twilight parents]268-his parents . For a long time , [he]123-twilight had led a kind of vagabond , orphan life . Indeed , [Twilight]123-twilight had lived with all sorts of odd animals , even a fox at one point , which was why [he]123-twilight never hunted fox . Like [all Great Grays]406-all great grays , [he]123-twilight was considered a powerful and ruthless predator , but [Twilight]123-twilight prided [himself]123-twilight on being , as [he]123-twilight called it , [an owl from [the Orphan School of Tough Learning]408-the orphan school of tough learning]407-an owl from the orphan school of tough learning . [He]123-twilight was completely self - taught . [He]123-twilight had lived in [burrows]409-burrows with foxes , flown with eagles . [He]123-twilight was strong and [a real fighter]410-a real fighter . And there was not a modest hollow bone in [Twilight]123-twilight ’s body . [He]123-twilight was powerful , a brilliant flier , and [he]123-twilight was fast . As fast with [his]123-twilight talons as with [his]123-twilight beak . In a minute [they]411-they all knew that the air would become shrill as [he]123-twilight sung [himself]123-twilight praises and jabbed and stabbed at an imaginary foe . [Twilight]123-twilight ’s shadow began to flicker in the dim light of [the hollow of the fir tree]412-the hollow of the fir tree , as [his]123-twilight voice , deep and thrumming , started to chant .

[We]411-they ’re going to bash them birds ,

Them rat - feathered birds .

[Them]413-them bad - butt owls ai n’t never heard

’ Bout Gylfie , [Soren]122-soren , [Dig]149-dig , and [Twilight]123-twilight .

Just let [them]411-they get to feel [my]0-i bite

[Their]411-they li’l ole gizzards gon na turn to pus

And [our]411-they feathers hardly mussed .

Oh , [me]0-i . Oh , [my]0-i . [They]411-they gon na cry .

One look at [Twilight]123-twilight ,

[They]411-they know [they]411-they ’re gon na die .

[I]0-i see fear in [their]411-they eyes

And that ai n’t all .

[They]411-they know that [Twilight]123-twilight ’s got the gall .

[Gizzard]150-gizzard with gall that makes [him]123-twilight great

And every bad owl gon na turn to bait .

Jab , jab — then a swipe and hook with the right talon . [Twilight]123-twilight danced around [the hollow]372-the hollow . The air churned with [his]123-twilight shadow fight , and [Gylfie]125-gylfie , the tiniest of [them all]415-them all , had to hang on tight . It was like a small hurricane in [the hollow]372-the hollow . Then , finally , [his]123-twilight movements slowed and [he]123-twilight pranced off into a corner .

“ Got that out of [your]123-twilight system , [Twilight]123-twilight ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie asked .

“ What do [you]125-gylfie mean ‘ out of [my]123-twilight system ’ ? ”[123-twilight]

“ [Your]125-gylfie aggression . ”[123-twilight]

[Twilight]123-twilight made a slightly contemptuous sound that came from the back of [his]123-twilight throat . “ Big words , [little owl]1408-little owl . ”[123-twilight] This was something [Twilight]123-twilight often said to [Gylfie]125-gylfie . [Gylfie]125-gylfie did have a tendency to use big words .

“ Well now , [young’uns]1365-young’uns , ”[128-mrs. p.] [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. was speaking up . “ Let ’s not get into it . [I]128-mrs. p. think , [Gylfie]125-gylfie , that in the face of cannibalism , aggression or going stark raving yoicks and absolutely annihilating [the cannibals]1412-the cannibals is appropriate . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ More big words but [I]123-twilight like them . [I]123-twilight like them , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight hooted [his]123-twilight delight .

[Soren]122-soren , however , remained quiet . [He]122-soren was thinking . [He]122-soren was still wondering what the Great Ga’Hoole Tree would be like . What would [those noble owls]417-those noble owls think of an owl like [Twilight]123-twilight — so unrefined , yet powerful . So sassy , but loyal — so angry , but true ?

CHAPTER FOUR

Get Out ! Get Out !

[They]417-those noble owls had left [the hollow of the fir tree]412-the hollow of the fir tree at First Black . The night was racing with ragged clouds . [The forest]294-the forest covering was thick beneath [them]417-those noble owls so [they]417-those noble owls flew low to keep [the River Hoole]26-the river hoole in sight , which sometimes narrowed and only appeared as the smallest glimmer of [a thread of water]420-a thread of water . The trees thinned and [Twilight]123-twilight said that [he]123-twilight thought [the region below was known as [The Beaks]36-the beaks]421-the region below was known as the beaks . For a while , [they]417-those noble owls seemed to lose the strand of [the river]281-the river , and there appeared to be [many other smaller threadlike creeks]423-many other smaller threadlike creeks or [tributaries]424-tributaries . [They]417-those noble owls were , of course , worried [they]417-those noble owls might have lost [the Hoole]53-hoole , but if [they]417-those noble owls had [their]417-those noble owls doubts [they]417-those noble owls dared not even think about them for a sliver of a second . For doubts , [each one]425-each one feared in the deepest parts of [their]425-each one quivering gizzards , might be like an owl sickness — like grayscale or beak rot — contagious and able to spread from owl to owl .

How many false creeks , [streams]426-streams , and even [rivers]427-rivers had [they]417-those noble owls followed so far , only to be disappointed ? But now [Digger]126-digger called out , “ [I]126-digger see something ! ”[126-digger] All of [their]417-those noble owls gizzards quickened . “ It ’s , it’s … whitish … Well , grayish . ”[126-digger]

“ Ish ? What in [Glaux]131-glaux ’s name is ‘ ish ’ ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight hooted .

“ It means , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said in [her]125-gylfie clear voice , “ that it ’s not exactly white , and it ’s not exactly gray . ”[125-gylfie]

“ [I]125-gylfie ’ll have a look . Hold [your]125-gylfie flight pattern until [I]125-gylfie get back . ”[125-gylfie]

[The huge Great Gray Owl]151-the great gray began a power dive . [He]151-the great gray was not gone long before [he]151-the great gray returned . “ And [you]125-gylfie know why it ’s not exactly gray and not exactly white ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight did not wait for an answer . “ Because it ’s smoke . ”[123-twilight]

“ Smoke ? ”[428-the other three] [The other three]428-the other three seemed dumbfounded .

“ [You]125-gylfie do know what smoke is ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight asked . [He]123-twilight tried to remember to be patient with these owls who had seen and experienced so much less than [he]123-twilight had .

“ Sort of , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren replied . “ [You]125-gylfie mean there ’s a forest fire down there ? [I]122-soren ’ve heard of those . ”[122-soren]

“ Oh , no . Nothing that big . Maybe once it was . But , really , [the forests of [The Beaks]36-the beaks]1413-the forests of the beaks are minor ones . Second - rate . Few and far between and not much to catch fire . ”[122-soren]

“ Spontaneous combustion — no doubt , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said . [Twilight]123-twilight gave [the little Elf Owl]429-the little elf owl a withering look . Always trying to steal [his]123-twilight show with the big words . [He]123-twilight had no idea what spontaneous combustion was and [he]123-twilight doubted if [Gylfie]125-gylfie did , either . But [he]123-twilight let it go for the moment . “ Come on , let ’s go explore . ”[123-twilight]

[They]430-we alighted on [the forest floor at the edge of where the smoke was the thickest]431-the forest floor at the edge of where the smoke was the thickest . It seemed to be coming out of a cave that was beneath a stone outcropping . There was a scattering of a few glowing coals on the ground and charred pieces of wood . “ Digger , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said . “ Can [you]125-gylfie dig as well as [you]125-gylfie can walk with those naked legs of yours ? ”[123-twilight]

“ [You]125-gylfie bet . How do [you]125-gylfie think [we]430-we fix up [[our]430-we burrows]1414-our burrows or make them bigger ? [We]430-we just do n’t settle for what [we]430-we happen upon . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Well , start digging and show [the rest of [us]430-we]1415-the rest of us how . [We]430-we ’ve got to bury these coals before a wind comes up and carries them off and really gets a fire going . ”[123-twilight]

It was hard work burying the coals , especially for [Gylfie]125-gylfie , who was the tiniest and had the shortest legs of all . “ [I]125-gylfie wonder what happened here ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said as [she]125-gylfie paused to look around . [Her]125-gylfie eyes settled on what [she]125-gylfie thought was a charred piece of wood , but something glinted through the blackness of the moonless night . [Gylfie]125-gylfie blinked . Glinted and curved into a familiar shape . [Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s gizzard gave a little twitch and as if in a trance [she]125-gylfie walked over toward the object .

“ Battle claws ! ”[125-gylfie] [she]125-gylfie gasped . From inside [the cave]432-the cave came a terrible moan . “ Get out ! Get out ! ”[125-gylfie]

But [they]433-they could n’t get out ! [They]433-they could n’t move . Between [them]433-they and [the mouth of [the cave]432-the cave]434-the mouth of the cave , gleaming eyes , redder than any of the live coals , glowered and there was a horrible rank smell . Two curved white fangs sliced the darkness .

“ [Bobcat]152-bobcat ! ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight roared .

The four owls simultaneously lifted [their]433-they eight wings in powerful upstrokes . The bobcat shrieked below , a terrible sky - shattering shriek . [Soren]122-soren had never heard anything like it . It had all happened so suddenly that [Soren]122-soren had even forgotten to drop the coal that [he]122-soren had in [his]122-soren beak .

“ [Good Glaux]153-glaux , [Soren]122-soren ! ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said as [she]125-gylfie saw [[her]125-gylfie dear friend]436-her dear friend ’s face bathed in the red light of the radiant coal .

[Soren]122-soren dropped it immediately .

There was another shriek . A shadow blacker than the night seemed to leap into the air , then plummet to the ground , writhing and yowling in pain .

“ Well , bust [[my]123-twilight gizzard]1416-my gizzard ! ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight shouted . “ [Soren]122-soren , [you]122-soren dropped that coal right on the cat ! What a shot ! ”[123-twilight]

“ [I]123-twilight — what ? ”[123-twilight]

“ Come on , [we]1417-we ’re going in for [him]436-her dear friend — for the kill . ”[123-twilight]

“ The kill ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said blankly .

“ Follow [me]122-soren . Aim for [his]436-her dear friend eyes . [Gylfie]125-gylfie , stay clear of [his]436-her dear friend tail . [I]122-soren ’ll go for the throat . [Digger]126-digger , take a flank . ”[122-soren]

The four owls flew down in a deadly wedge . [Soren]122-soren aimed for the eyes , but one was already useless , as the coal had done its work and a still sizzling socket wept small embers . [Digger]126-digger sunk [his]126-digger talons into an exposed flank as the bobcat writhed on the ground , and [Gylfie]125-gylfie stuck one of [her]125-gylfie talons down the largest nostril that [Soren]122-soren had ever seen . [Twilight]123-twilight made a quick slice at the throat and blood spattered the night . The cat was no longer howling . It lay in a heap on [the forest floor]437-the forest floor , its face smoldering from the coal . The smell of singed fur filled the night as the bobcat ’s pulse grew weaker and the blood poured out from the deep gash in its throat .

“ Was [he]436-her dear friend after the battle claws — [a bobcat]1418-a bobcat ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren turned to [Gylfie]125-gylfie .

When the two owls had been at [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s , [Grimble]154-grimble , [the old Boreal Owl who had died helping [them]439-them escape]438-the old boreal owl who had died helping them escape , had told [them]439-them how [the warriors of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s]440-the warriors of st. aggie ’s could not make [their]440-the warriors of st. aggie ’s own battle claws so [they]440-the warriors of st. aggie ’s scavenged [them]441-them from battlefields . But a bobcat ? Why would [a bobcat]1418-a bobcat need battle claws ? [They]439-them stared at the long sharp claws that extended from the paws of the cat and looked deadlier than any battle claws .

“ No , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said quietly . [He]123-twilight had flown over to [the cave]432-the cave and now stood in its opening . “ The cat was after what was in here . ”[123-twilight]

“ What ’s that ? ”[251-the three other owls] [the three other owls]251-the three other owls asked at once .

“ A dying owl , ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver said as [she]120-mrs. plithiver slithered out from [the cave where [she]120-mrs. plithiver had taken refuge]445-the cave where she had taken refuge . “ Come in . [I]120-mrs. plithiver think [he]151-the great gray wants to speak , if [he]151-the great gray has any more breath in [him]151-the great gray . ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

The owls moved into [the cave]432-the cave opening . There was a mass of brown feathers collapsed by a shallow pit that still glowed with embers . It was a Barred [Owl]151-the great gray . Although that was hard to tell , for the white bars of [his]151-the great gray plumage were bloodstained and [his]151-the great gray beak seemed to jut out at a peculiar angle . “ Do n’t blame the cat . ”[155-owl] [The Barred Owl]155-owl moaned . “ Only [here]1419-here after … after … [they]1420-they — ”[155-owl]

“ After [they]1420-they what , [sir]1421-sir ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie stepped closer to the skewed beak and bent [her]125-gylfie head to better hear the weak voice .

“ [They]1420-they wanted the battle claws , did n’t [they]1420-they ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren bobbed [his]122-soren head down toward [the dying owl]447-the dying owl . [The four owls]249-the four owls blinked at one another and were silent for several moments . “ [You]122-soren only wish ! ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger repeated . “ Does [he]447-the dying owl mean there ’s something worse than [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s ? ”[126-digger]

“ How could there be ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said .

[They]249-the four owls turned toward [the Great Gray]151-the great gray . “ [Twilight]123-twilight ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked .

[They]450-we looked down at [the dead Barred Owl]155-owl .

[Soren]122-soren was looking around . “ [This owl]332-this owl lived in [this cave]1444-this cave . Look , [you]123-twilight can tell . “ But [Soren]122-soren is right , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ [His]332-this owl spirit is here . ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger was [a very odd owl]451-a very odd owl . Whereas most owls were consumed with the practical world of hunting , flying , and nesting , [Digger]126-digger — with [his]126-digger legs better for running than [his]126-digger wings were for flying , with [his]126-digger inclination for [burrows]409-burrows rather than hollows — was undeniably an impractical owl . But perhaps because [he]126-digger was not focused on the commonplace , the ordinary drudgeries and small joys of owl life , [his]126-digger mind was freer to range . And range it did into the sphere of the spiritual , of the meaning of life , of the possibilities of an afterlife . And it was the afterlife of the brave Barred Owl that seemed to concern [him]126-digger now . “ [His]332-this owl spirit is in [this cave]1444-this cave . [I]122-soren feel it . ”[122-soren]

“ So what do [we]1450-we do ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight asked .

[Soren]122-soren looked around at [the cave]432-the cave slowly . [I]122-soren think … ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren spoke very slowly . “ [I]122-soren think [we]1450-we should burn [him]332-this owl . ”[122-soren]

“ Burn [him]332-this owl ? ”[454-the other three owls] [the other three owls]454-the other three owls repeated quietly .

“ Yes . Right here in [this pit]1452-this pit . The embers are still burning . It will be enough . ”[455-the owls] [The owls]455-the owls nodded to [one another]456-one another in silent agreement . It seemed right .

So the four owls , as gently as [they]455-the owls could , rolled the dead Barred Owl onto the coals with [their]455-the owls talons .

“ Do [we]1450-we have to stay and watch ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie asked as the first feathers began to ignite .

“ No ! ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said , and [they]455-the owls all followed [him]122-soren out [the cave]432-the cave entrance and flew into the night .

[They]455-the owls rose on a series of updrafts and then circled [the clearing where [the cave]432-the cave had been]458-the clearing where the cave had been . Three times [they]455-the owls circled as [they]455-the owls watched the smoke curl out from [the mouth of [the cave]432-the cave]434-the mouth of the cave . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver moved forward through the thick feathers of [Soren]122-soren ’s shoulders and leaned out toward one of [his]122-soren ears . “ [I]120-mrs. plithiver am proud of [you]122-soren , [Soren]122-soren . But would [they]455-the owls ever find [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree , where other noble owls lived]462-the great ga’hoole tree , where other noble owls lived ? And now it was not doubt that began to prick at [his]122-soren gizzard , but the ominous words of [the Barred Owl]463-the barred owl — [You]464-you only wish !

CHAPTER FIVE

The Mirror Lakes

[Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver was worried . Yes , it was understandable that the owls had been unnerved by the Barred [Owl]155-owl ’s ominous words . The very notion of something worse than [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s was indeed a horrifying thought . [They]455-the owls needed some time to rest , unwind . [Twilight]123-twilight said that [he]123-twilight had heard about this place that was so lovely , endless plump voles scampering about , no crows at all , [tree hollows in which moss as soft as down grew]465-tree hollows in which moss as soft as down grew . Why , it sounded irresistible . And it was ! And now [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver was nearly frantic in [this resplendent place]466-this resplendent place . It was perfectly clear to [her]120-mrs. plithiver that the owls would be content to stay here forever .

But life was too easy in [this region on the edge of [The Beaks]36-the beaks , which was called [the Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes]467-this region on the edge of the beaks , which was called the mirror lakes . [She]120-mrs. plithiver knew it was n’t good for [them]455-the owls and beneath the gleaming surfaces of [the lakes]468-the lakes , within the quiet verdant beauty of [this crow - less place]469-this crow - less place , [she]120-mrs. plithiver sensed something dangerous . [She]120-mrs. plithiver could have just swatted [Twilight]123-twilight and [his]123-twilight darned big mouth . The four owls seemed to have forgotten [their]455-the owls ordeal in [the forest]294-the forest with the bobcat and the dying Barred Owl entirely . Shortly after [they]455-the owls had turned to fly in the direction of [the Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes , [they]455-the owls began to encounter the wonderful rolling drafts of air that curled up from the rippled landscape below and provided [them]455-the owls with matchless flying . The sensation was sublime as [they]455-the owls gently floated over the sculpted air currents without having to waggle a wing . The rhythm was mesmerizing and then , shortly before dawn , sparkling below between the ripples of [the land]471-the land , were [several still lakes]472-several still lakes , so clear , so glistening that they reflected every single star and cloud in the sky .

[The Mirror Lakes]473-the mirror lakes were like an oasis in [the otherwise barren landscape of [The Beaks]36-the beaks]474-the otherwise barren landscape of the beaks . [The owls]455-the owls had chosen trees near [the lake]476-the lake that had perfect - sized hollows , all cushioned with the loveliest of mosses .

“ It ’s simply dreamy here , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said for perhaps the hundredth time . And that , precisely , was the problem . It was dreamy . Not just dreamy — but a dream . It did n’t seem real with its plentiful game so easy to hunt , and the rolling drafts of warm air so tempting that , against [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ’s orders , the owls had begun to take playful flights in broad daylight . But perhaps worst of all were [the tranquil gleaming lakes]477-the tranquil gleaming lakes [themselves]477-the tranquil gleaming lakes . These owls had never been around [such clear water]478-such clear water . There was no silt , no mud , no muck and bits swirling about in it . So [they]455-the owls could see [their]455-the owls reflections perfectly . Not one of these owls , except for [Twilight]123-twilight , had ever seen its reflection . And even [Twilight]123-twilight had never seen [his]123-twilight so clearly .

It had all started with [Soren]122-soren , actually , when [Gylfie]125-gylfie pointed out to [him]122-soren that [he]122-soren had a smudge on [his]122-soren beak from the coal that [he]122-soren had picked up and dropped on the bobcat . [Soren]122-soren had flown a short distance from the tree where [they]455-the owls had found [a hollow , to the edge of [the lake , to clean up]480-the lake , to clean up]479-a hollow , to the edge of the lake , to clean up . Until that time , [Soren]122-soren had thought that water was only for drinking and occasionally — very occasionally — for washing . But when [he]122-soren peered into [the lake]476-the lake [he]122-soren nearly fainted .

“ [Da]158-da ! ”[122-soren] [he]122-soren gasped .

“ It ’s not [[your]122-soren da]1455-your da . It ’s [you]122-soren , [dear]1344-dear , ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver said . For although [she]120-mrs. plithiver was blind , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. knew about reflections in much the same way [she]120-mrs. plithiver knew so many other things that [she]120-mrs. plithiver could not see . “ [You]122-soren ’ve probably never seen [your]122-soren face fully fledged . ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

“ It ’s all white , just like [Da]158-da ’s . [I]120-mrs. plithiver ’m so , so — ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

“ Handsome ? ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver said .

“ Well , yeah . ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren muffled a nervous churr , slightly embarrassed to admit it .

Slightly it had been , but no more ! That was , indeed , the end of [Soren]122-soren ’s embarrassment as well as [his]122-soren modesty , and the end of the other owls ’ as well . [They]482-they were soon all nodding over the mirror of [the lake]476-the lake , admiring [themselves]482-they . And when [they]482-they were n’t gazing at [their]482-they reflections from the edge , [they]482-they were flying above [the lakes]468-the lakes , marveling at [their]482-they fabulous flight maneuvers and pitching “ wingies , ”[482-they] as [they]482-they called it when [they]482-they rolled off rising drafts of air . [Twilight]123-twilight was , of course , the worst of all because [he]123-twilight was so boastful to begin with . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver could hear [him]123-twilight out there now , hooting about [his]123-twilight beauty , [his]123-twilight muscular physique , the fluffiness of [his]123-twilight feathers , while [he]123-twilight tumbled over and under a roll of air .

“ Look at [me]0-i bounce off this cloud ! ”[0-i] And then for the tenth time that day , [Twilight]123-twilight sang [his]123-twilight “ [I]123-twilight Am More Beautiful Than a Cloud ”[123-twilight] song .

What is as fleecy as a cloud ,

As majestic and shimmering as the breaking dawn ,

As gorgeous as the sun is strong ?

Why , it ’s [ME]0-i !

[Twilight]123-twilight , the Great Gray ,

Tiger of the sky —

Light of the Night ,

Most beautiful ,

An avian delight .

[I]0-i beam —

[I]0-i gleam —

[I]0-i ’m a livin ’ flying dream .

Watch [me]0-i roll off this cloud and pop on back .

This is flying ,

[I]0-i ai n’t no hack .

“ But , ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver said with a hiss that sizzled , “ [you]123-twilight ai n’t , as [you]123-twilight say , ‘ rolling off clouds ’ ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] Because , as [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver could sense , the clouds were too high that day , and [Twilight]123-twilight was flying too low to reach [them]485-them as [he]123-twilight admired [himself]123-twilight in [the Mirror Lakes]473-the mirror lakes . In actuality , [Twilight]123-twilight was flying off the reflections of clouds that quivered on the glasslike surface of [the lake]476-the lake . And that , [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver concluded , was the heart of the problem with [all the owls]488-all the owls . [They]488-all the owls were mistaking [the world of image]489-the world of image and reflection for [the real world]490-the real world . [The Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes had transfixed [them]488-all the owls . And in [their]488-all the owls transfixed state [they]488-all the owls had forgotten all [they]488-all the owls had fought for and fought against . Had [they]488-all the owls once spoken of the Great Ga’Hoole Tree or its noble owls since [they]488-all the owls had arrived at [this cursed place]491-this cursed place ? Had [they]488-all the owls ever mentioned [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s and its terrors ? Had [Soren]122-soren even once thought of [[his]122-soren dear family]492-his dear family except the first time [he]122-soren caught [his]122-soren reflection in [the lake]476-the lake ? And what about [Eglantine]130-eglantine ? Did [he]122-soren ever think of [her]130-eglantine and what might have happened to [[his]122-soren poor sister]494-his poor sister ?

This was a very strange place . [It]495-it was not just [the Mirror Lakes]473-the mirror lakes and the thick soft moss and the perfect tree hollows and the plentiful game . Suddenly , [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver realized that in [the rest of the kingdoms [they]488-all the owls had flown through]497-the rest of the kingdoms they had flown through it was becoming early winter , but here it was still summer , full summer . [She]120-mrs. plithiver could smell it . The leaves were still green , the grasses supple , [the earth]253-the earth warm . But it was poisonous ! [They]488-all the owls had to get out of [here]1419-here . [This place]1422-this place was as dangerous as [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s .

“ Come here this instant ! All of [you]488-all the owls ! ”[125-gylfie] It was the closest a hissing snake ever got to a snarl .

[Soren]122-soren jerked [his]122-soren head up from admiring [his]122-soren beak in the surface of [the pond]501-the pond . [He]122-soren rather liked the smudge on it . [He]122-soren thought it added “ character ”[122-soren] to [his]122-soren face , as [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , what in [Glaux]153-glaux ’s name ? ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ [I]120-mrs. plithiver ’ll Glaux [you]122-soren ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [she]120-mrs. plithiver hissed .

[Soren]122-soren nearly fainted . [He]122-soren never had heard [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. swear , and at [him]122-soren , no less . It was like venom curling out into the air . The other owls alighted next to [Soren]122-soren .

“ Racdrops on [your]122-soren curled wingie . ”[128-mrs. p.]

Now a deep hush fell upon the owls . Had [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver lost [her]120-mrs. plithiver mind ? Racdrops . [She]120-mrs. plithiver had actually said racdrops !

“ What ’s wrong , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked in a trembling voice .

“ [I]123-twilight have [no family]1460-no family if [you]128-mrs. p. ’ll recall , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight yawned .

“ Worse then ! [You]122-soren are a disgrace to [your]122-soren species . [The Great Gray Owls]159-the great gray owls . ”[123-twilight]

This really took [Twilight]123-twilight aback . “ [My]123-twilight species ? ”[123-twilight]

[Soren]122-soren felt something really bad was coming .

“ [You]122-soren ’re no better than a bunch of wet poopers ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] With that , there was a raucous outburst from a branch overhanging where [they]502-they stood at [the lake]476-the lake ’s edge , on which a dozen or more seagulls had alighted . The harsh gull laughter ricocheted off [the lake]476-the lake and the reflections of the owls on [its]476-the lake surface quivered and then seemed to shatter .

“ [We]502-they ’re getting out of here NOW ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver said in a near roar for a snake .

“ What about crows ? It ’s not dark yet . ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

“ Tough ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [she]120-mrs. plithiver spat .

“ Are [you]122-soren going to sacrifice [us]502-they to crows ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said in a very small voice .

“ [You]122-soren ’re sacrificing [yourself]122-soren right here on [the shores of [this lake]1463-this lake]1462-the shores of this lake . ”[125-gylfie] And something sharper than the fiercest gaze of eyes bore into [Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s gizzard . Indeed , all the owls felt [their]502-they gizzards twist and lurch .

“ Get ready to fly ! And [Twilight]123-twilight — ”[125-gylfie]

“ Yes , [ma’am]1364-ma’am . ”[125-gylfie]

“ [I]125-gylfie ’ll fly point with [you]1364-ma’am . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Yes , [ma’am]1364-ma’am . ”[125-gylfie] [The Great Gray]159-the great gray owls stooped down so that [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver could slither onto [his]159-the great gray owls broad shoulders .

Of [all the owls]488-all the owls , [Twilight]123-twilight had been the most transfixed by [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ’s outburst . And if [Twilight]123-twilight was to fly point , as [he]123-twilight usually did , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. felt [she]128-mrs. p. was going to have to be there to keep [him]123-twilight on course . [He]123-twilight was a “ special needs ”[128-mrs. p.] case if there ever was one . What , indeed , had [the world]1373-the world come to if [an old blind nest - maid snake]507-an old blind nest - maid snake had to navigate for a Great Gray Owl ? Some sky tiger !

But [she]128-mrs. p. had to navigate as [Twilight]123-twilight began to circle [the lake]476-the lake a second time and dip [his]123-twilight downwind wing , no doubt for a better look at [himself]123-twilight , and , yes , singing under [his]123-twilight breath [his]123-twilight next favorite tune —

Oh , wings of silver spread on high ,

Fierce eyes of golden light ,

Across the clouds of purple hue

In sheer majestic flight —

Oh , [Twilight]123-twilight !

Oh , [Twilight]123-twilight , most beautiful of owls ,

[Who sculpts the air

Beyond compare]509-who sculpts the air beyond compare .

With feathers so sublime ,

An owl for now —

An owl for then —

An owl for all of time .

[Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver had coiled up and was waving [her]120-mrs. plithiver head as a signal to a gull [she]120-mrs. plithiver sensed overhead . Suddenly , there was a big white splat that landed on the silver wings sublime .

“ What in [Glaux]153-glaux ’s name ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said .

“ [They]511-them like [you]123-twilight , [Twilight]123-twilight . Blessed , [I]120-mrs. plithiver dare say ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

[Twilight]123-twilight flew straight out across [the lake]476-the lake and never looked back .

CHAPTER SIX

The Ice Narrows

It seemed as if winter had been waiting for [them]511-them as soon as the Mirror Lakes dropped behind [them]511-them . Blasts of frigid air , swirling with ice , sleet , and often hail , smacked into [them]511-them . [The rolling ridges of [The Beaks]36-the beaks]512-the rolling ridges of the beaks had become sharper and steeper , sending up confusing currents . Ice began to form on [their]511-them own beaks and , in a few minutes , [Soren]122-soren saw [Gylfie]125-gylfie spin out of control . Luckily , [Twilight]123-twilight accelerated and managed to help [her]125-gylfie .

“ Fly in [my]123-twilight wake , [Gylfie]125-gylfie , ”[123-twilight] [he]123-twilight shouted over the roar of the wind . And then [he]123-twilight swiveled [his]123-twilight head back to [the others]344-the others . “ [Her]125-gylfie wings have started to ice . [Ours]511-them will , too — soon . It ’s too dangerous to continue . [We]511-them have to look for [a place to land]1343-a place to land . ”[123-twilight]

Almost as soon as [Twilight]123-twilight had spoken of iced wings , [Soren]122-soren felt [his]122-soren own suddenly grow heavy . [He]123-twilight turned [his]123-twilight head and nearly gasped when [he]123-twilight saw [his]123-twilight plummels , the silkiest of all [his]123-twilight feathers , that fringed the outer edges of [his]123-twilight primaries . They were stiff with frost and the wind was whistling through [them]514-them . Great Glaux , [I]0-i ’m flying like a gull !

It was not long before [they]515-we found a tree . [The hollow]372-the hollow was [a rather miserable little one]517-a rather miserable little one . [They]515-we could barely cram into [it]372-the hollow , and it was crawling with vermin .

“ This is appalling ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver said . “ [I]120-mrs. plithiver ’ve never seen such an infestation . ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

“ Is n’t there some moss someplace ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight asked , remembering the extraordinarily soft , thick moss of [the Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes .

“ Well , if [someone]1467-someone wants to go out and look , [they]1467-someone can , ”[128-mrs. p.] [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. said . “ In the meantime , [I]128-mrs. p. ’ll try and eat as many of these maggotty little critters as possible . ”[128-mrs. p.]

[Soren]122-soren peeked out [the hollow]372-the hollow . “ The wind ’s picked up . [You]122-soren ca n’t even see out there . Snow ’s so thick on the ground , [I]122-soren doubt if [we]515-we could find any moss if [we]515-we did look . ”[122-soren]

“ [We]515-we can always pulp some of the pine needles , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said . “ First , [you]122-soren beak them hard enough , then let them slide down to [your]122-soren first stomach — the one before the gizzard . Hold it there for just a while , and then yarp it all back up . The pine needles come out all mushy and when they dry they ’re almost as soft as moss . Actually , technically speaking , it is not called yarping . It ’s burping when its wet and not a pellet . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Who cares — as long as it ’s soft ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight muttered .

“ [I]126-digger suppose it ’s worth a try , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ The thought of going out there into that blizzard is not appealing in the least . ”[126-digger]

So the owls leaned out from the protection of [the hollow]372-the hollow only far enough to snatch a beakful of pine needles . [They]520-they all began beaking , then swallowing the wads down to [their]520-they first stomachs and then burping . All the while , [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver busied [herself]120-mrs. plithiver with sucking up maggots and pinch beetles , and one or two small worms known as feather raiders — all of which were most unhygienic to the health of owls .

“ [I]128-mrs. p. do n’t think [I]128-mrs. p. could eat another pinch beetle if [my]128-mrs. p. life depended on it , ”[128-mrs. p.] [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. groaned after more than an hour .

There was a huge watery gurgle that rippled through [the hollow]372-the hollow .

“ What was that ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said .

“ [Yours]249-the four owls truly , burping here , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said and opened [his]123-twilight beak and let go with another hollow - shaking burp .

“ Oh , [I]126-digger ’ve got to try that ! ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . In no time [the four owls]249-the four owls were having a burping contest . [They]249-the four owls were laughing and hooting and having a grand old time as the blizzard outside raged . [They]249-the four owls had figured out prizes as well . There was a prize , of course , for the loudest , but then one for the most watery sound , and the one for the most disgusting , and one for the prettiest and most refined . Although [everyone]311-everyone expected [Gylfie]125-gylfie to win with the prettiest , [Soren]122-soren did , and [Gylfie]125-gylfie won for the most disgusting .

“ Absolutely vulgar , ”[128-mrs. p.] muttered [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p.

But soon [they]249-the four owls became bored with that and [they]249-the four owls began to wonder when the blizzard would let up . And although [not one of [them]249-the four owls]524-not one of them would admit it , secretly [their]249-the four owls thoughts turned to [the Mirror Lakes]473-the mirror lakes and [they]249-the four owls grew quieter and quieter as [they]249-the four owls tried to remember [their]249-the four owls lazy beautiful days , flying in spectacular arcs over [the lakes]468-the lakes ’ gleaming surface . And the food , the food was so good !

“ Oh , what [I]122-soren would n’t give for a nice vole . ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren sighed .

“ [You]120-mrs. plithiver know , [young’un]160-young’un , [I]120-mrs. plithiver think the wind is lessening . [She]120-mrs. plithiver simply could n’t allow that . “ [You]120-mrs. plithiver call this less ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger hooted from [his]126-digger downwind position .

“ A bit , and believe [me]126-digger , [dear]1344-dear , sitting there burping pine needles is n’t going to get [you]1344-dear any closer to [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree . ”[126-digger]

But what would ? thought [Soren]122-soren . [They]249-the four owls could barely see ahead , behind was thick with swirling snow , below was dense fog that not even a treetop could poke through , and , off to windward , sheets of frigid air seemed to tumble from somewhere .

“ Sounds like it ’s worth a try . [We]249-the four owls ’d better get Gylfie between [us]249-the four owls , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said .

[The owls]455-the owls had become adept at creating a still place for Gylfie in [the center of [their]455-the owls flying wedge formation]528-the center of their flying wedge formation when the winds became too tumultuous for [the Elf Owl]529-the elf owl . [Gylfie]125-gylfie moved into [that spot]530-that spot now . “ All right , let ’s crab upwind , ”[125-gylfie] [Twilight]123-twilight hooted over the fury of the blizzard .

Crabbing was a flight maneuver in which the owls flew slightly sideways into the wind at an oblique angle so as not to hit it head - on . The owls scuttled across the wind in much the same way a crab moves — not directly forward but in this case taking the best advantage of a wind that was determined to smack [them]455-the owls back . But now , by stealing a bit off the wind ’s edges , the owls could move forward , although slowly . [They]455-the owls had been doing a lot of crabbing since [they]455-the owls had left [the last hollow]531-the last hollow and something [they]455-the owls thought never could happen had . [Their]455-the owls windward wings had actually grown tired and even sore . But at least [their]455-the owls wings were n’t icing up .

Suddenly , there was a terrible roar . [The owls]455-the owls felt [themselves]455-the owls sucked sideways as if an icy claw had reached out to drag [them]455-the owls . There was another roar and [they]455-the owls felt [themselves]455-the owls smash into a wall of ice . [Soren]122-soren began sliding down a cold , slick surface . “ Hang on , [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver , ”[122-soren] [he]122-soren called , but [he]122-soren had no sense of [her]533-her nestling in [her]533-her usual place . It was impossible to grab anything with [his]122-soren talons . [His]122-soren wings simply would not work . [He]122-soren felt [himself]122-soren going faster than [he]122-soren had ever flown . And that was something to behold . [She]325-the female suddenly grew sleek . But , in fact , [the puffins]540-the puffins knew more and were not that dumb at all . “ Just low self - esteem , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said . “ [You]1344-dear see , [young’uns]167-young’uns , ”[565-the male puffin] said [the male puffin]565-the male puffin , “ nine days out often , the wind slams full force up [these Ice Narrows]1504-these ice narrows .
