[The Beaks]36-the beaks sounded lovely . [This place]1422-this place was so harsh and cold and there was the terrible stench of the fish and the awful oiliness that seemed to make [their]540-the puffins gizzards greasy . How could [they]540-the puffins help but think of [the Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes , where it was always summer and the voles were fat and the flying spectacular ? [They]540-the puffins would be [liars]569-liars if [they]540-the puffins said [they]540-the puffins were n’t tempted .

“ So when should [we]540-the puffins leave ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked .

“ [I]122-soren think since [you]1344-dear owls like night flying [you]1344-dear should go tonight . Just when it ’s getting dark is when the wind will begin to turn . It ’ll be easy flying out of here , and then when the wind finally gets behind [your]1344-dear tail feathers , [you]1344-dear ’ll really go , straight out to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere . ”[122-soren]

“ But the blizzard ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said . “ When will that start up again ? ”[125-gylfie]

“ Not before tomorrow , [I]570-the female puffin think , at the earliest . ”[570-the female puffin]

“ [We]540-the puffins should all get some rest now , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said . “ If [we]540-the puffins ’re going to fly tonight . ”[122-soren]

“ Good idea , ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver nodded .

“ Better go to [the back of [the hollow]372-the hollow]1506-the back of the hollow , ”[570-the female puffin] [the female puffin]570-the female puffin called . “ Sun ’s coming out and it reflects so brightly off the ice [you]1344-dear wo n’t be able to shut [your]1344-dear eyes against it . ”[570-the female puffin] It was dimmer in the back , but still rather bright as streams of sunlight bouncing off the ice - sheathed rocks pried into the shadows of [the hollow]372-the hollow .

[Soren]122-soren could hear the steady drip as some of the ice began to melt . But finally [he]122-soren fell asleep . Perhaps it was the melting ice that made [him]122-soren think of that warmer place with [the pools of crystal - clear water]572-the pools of crystal - clear water , [his]122-soren lovely white face shimmering on the surface . Why could n’t [they]573-they go back there ? Where were [they]573-they supposed to be going instead ? [Soren]122-soren kept forgetting . All [he]122-soren could remember were the rolls of warm wind to play on , [the still , glasslike lake]574-the still , glasslike lake , the everlasting summer . No ice , no blizzard . Why not live there happily ever after ? The dream tugged on [him]122-soren . In [his]122-soren sleep , [he]122-soren felt [his]122-soren gizzard turn and something begin to dim , while the longing for [The Beaks]36-the beaks and [the Mirror Lakes]473-the mirror lakes grew stronger and stronger .

“ Time to get up , [young’uns]1365-young’uns . ”[565-the male puffin] It was [the male puffin]565-the male puffin , nudging [Soren]122-soren with one of [his]565-the male puffin large , orange , webbed feet . “ Wind died down . [You]122-soren can fly out of [here]1419-here now . The wall ’s weeping . ”[565-the male puffin]

“ Huh ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked . “ What do [you]565-the male puffin mean the wall ’s weeping ? ”[122-soren]

“ The ice is melting . Means warm air , the thermals have come . Easy flying . ”[565-the male puffin]

[The other owls]392-the other owls were already up and standing at [the rim of [the hollow]372-the hollow]578-the rim of the hollow . The wall certainly was weeping . Glistening with wetness , it appeared shimmering , almost fiery as the setting sun turned its ice into liquid flames of pink , then orange and red .

“ [Dumpy]165-dumpy , ”[580-his father] [[his]122-soren father]580-his father called . “ Come over here , [son]1510-son . [I]580-his father want [you]1510-son to step up here and watch [the young’uns]1511-the young’uns fly . [They]1511-the young’uns are [the masters of silent flight]1512-the masters of silent flight . Never going to hear a wing flap with these owls ! ”[580-his father]

Just before [they]392-the other owls took off , [Soren]122-soren looked at each of the owls . [He]122-soren was n’t [the only one who had dreamed of [the Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes]581-the only one who had dreamed of the mirror lakes . [They]392-the other owls all wanted to go back . Could it be that wrong if [they]392-the other owls all wanted to do it ? [Twilight]123-twilight slid in close to [him]122-soren . “ [Soren]122-soren , [the three of [us]1513-the three of us]1513-the three of us have been thinking . ”[123-twilight]

“ Yes ? ”[123-twilight]

“ Thinking about [The Beaks]36-the beaks and [the Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes . [We]1513-the three of us ’ve been thinking , why not go back there for just a little while ? Eat [us]1513-the three of us some nice fat voles , then go on to [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree . ”[123-twilight]

It was so tempting , so tempting . [Soren]122-soren felt [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver shift in the feathers between [his]122-soren shoulders .

“ [I]122-soren … [I]122-soren … ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren stammered . “ [I]122-soren think there ’s a problem . ”[122-soren]

After [they]582-they took off , [Soren]122-soren could feel [Gylfie]125-gylfie flying nervously beside [him]122-soren . [He]122-soren turned and looked directly at [Gylfie]125-gylfie . Together , [they]582-they had survived moon blinking and moon scalding . Together , [they]582-they had escaped [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s . [He]122-soren spun [his]122-soren head toward [Twilight]123-twilight and [Digger]126-digger . [They]582-they had fought with [him]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie in [the desert]1345-the desert and , together , killed [the murderers of [[Digger]126-digger ’s brother]377-digger ’s brother and [parents]586-parents]584-the murderers of digger ’s brother and parents . And it was as [a band [they]582-they had sworn to go to [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere]590-a band they had sworn to go to hoolemere and find [[its]23-hoolemere Great Ga’Hoole Tree]591-its great ga’hoole tree . That was no dream . That was real . [Twilight]123-twilight continued , “ [I]123-twilight mean , [Soren]122-soren , as [I]123-twilight said , [you]122-soren could go on if [you]122-soren wanted . What would be wrong with each of [us]582-they doing what [we]582-they want to do ? ”[123-twilight]

[Soren]122-soren looked hard at [Twilight]123-twilight . “ Because [we]582-they are [a band]277-a band , ”[122-soren] [he]122-soren said simply . CHAPTER SEVEN

[This Side of [Yonder]17-the yonder

[The puffins]540-the puffins]593-this side of yonder the puffins had told [them]540-the puffins that there was a current of darker green water that swirled out from [the Ice Narrows]12-the ice narrows , then curved into [the Sea of Hoolemere]33-the sea of hoolemere and , if [they]540-the puffins followed it , it would lead to [the island]1384-the island . [Soren]122-soren was very thankful that [they]540-the puffins had found the current quickly . For , although [the other three owls]454-the other three owls seemed to understand what [he]122-soren had said about being [a band]277-a band , [he]122-soren did not know what [he]122-soren would have done if [they]540-the puffins had n’t found the current . At least for now [he]122-soren could assure [them]540-the puffins that [they]540-the puffins were on course . One more navigational error , one more time getting blown off in some wild direction — well , [Soren]122-soren was n’t sure if [he]122-soren could hold [the band]598-the band together . The draw of [The Mirror Lakes]42-the mirror lakes was powerful . It was odd , but [he]122-soren often thought of the night that [he]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie escaped from [St. Aggie ’s]124-st. aggie . When [Skench]169-skench , in [her]169-skench full battle regalia with claws and helmet , had burst in on [them]540-the puffins in [the library]599-the library , something had drawn [her]169-skench into the wall where the flecks were stored . [She]169-skench had actually slammed into the wall and become completely immobilized for a few brief seconds . But it had provided [them]540-the puffins with the time to escape . Somehow The Beaks and [the Mirror Lakes]473-the mirror lakes had a similarly powerful draw for [them]540-the puffins . But it was just a dream and that is what [Soren]122-soren did n’t understand . How could a dream do this ? However , this current of dark green water beneath [them]540-the puffins was real . All [they]540-the puffins had to do was follow it .

[They]540-the puffins had been flying hard and fast for a while now . With each stroke of [their]540-the puffins wings , [they]540-the puffins felt surer of [their]540-the puffins course , and [their]540-the puffins gizzards began to tremble with excitement . And with each stroke that drew [Soren]122-soren closer to [the island]1384-the island with [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree , [he]122-soren knew [he]122-soren was flying somehow farther away from [St. Aegolius Academy]47-st. aegolius academy for [Orphaned Owls]48-orphaned owls . How dare [they]603-they call [that place]604-that place [an academy]605-an academy ? For nothing was learned there . Indeed , one of the worst rules that [an owl]295-an owl could break was that of asking a question . The most severe and the bloodiest punishments were reserved for [questioners]607-questioners . The foulest words [one]608-one could utter at [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s were the cursed wh words : what , when , why . [Soren]122-soren at one point had all of [his]122-soren just - budging flight feathers ripped out and [his]122-soren wings left with a slick of blood because [he]122-soren had asked a question . Knowledge was forbidden .

Soon it began to snow , rubbing the pinpoints of starlight into smears , feathering the edges of the moon into a blurry softness , and smudging the dark green line of the current . [I]0-i ca n’t lose the current ! [Soren]122-soren thought .

“ [I]126-digger do n’t know how [we]1518-we ’ll ever see [this Island of Hoole]1519-this island of hoole , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ Look down . Everything is turning white . ”[126-digger]

“ Where ’s the current ? ”[125-gylfie] asked [Gylfie]125-gylfie anxiously .

[Soren]122-soren felt [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver shift nervously in [his]122-soren neck feathers . So near but so far ! [They]609-they could n’t lose the current now . [Soren]122-soren thought that [the Island of Hoole]49-the island of hoole and [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree seemed almost like the sky did to [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver , [the Yonder]17-the yonder . And right now it felt as if [they]609-they were just [this side of [the Yonder]17-the yonder]610-this side of the yonder .

The conditions became increasingly confusing for the owls to fly in . Accustomed in night flying to opening up [their]609-they pupils so wide that they nearly filled the entire size of [their]609-they eyes , on this snowy night the owls had to do the reverse and yet it was not like day flying . There was too much light and it was all the same color , a shadowy gray . [Water]51-water would appear no different from [the surrounding land]611-the surrounding land . Were [they]609-they still over [water]612-water ? Or could [they]609-they be over [the Island of Hoole]49-the island of hoole ? Or maybe [they]609-they had been blown off course again ! [Soren]122-soren remembered what [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver had said , that [one]613-one had to see with one ’s entire body . [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ’s words came back to [him]122-soren . The four owls were bunched together in a tight V – shaped formation with Twilight at the point . [Soren]122-soren realized that flying on one side of [the V]52-the v or the other was not the best place to take advantage of the uneven placement of [his]122-soren ears and [his]122-soren good hearing .

“ Let [me]123-twilight fly point , [Twilight]123-twilight . [I]123-twilight ’ll be able to hear better . ”[123-twilight]

[Twilight]123-twilight slowed [his]123-twilight speed and [Soren]122-soren stroked past [him]123-twilight . “ Hang on , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , [I]123-twilight ’m going to have to do some head rolls . ”[123-twilight]

An owl ’s neck is a strange thing . Unlike most birds , owls have extra bones in [their]614-its necks that allow [them]614-its to swivel [their]614-its heads far to each side , in an arc much wider than any other living creature . Indeed , an owl can flip [its]614-its head back so that its crown touches [its]614-its shoulders , or turn [its]614-its face almost upside down as [Soren]122-soren was doing just now . “ Hello ! ”[122-soren] said [Soren]122-soren to [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , who nestled now directly beneath [his]122-soren beak as [he]122-soren flipped [his]122-soren face about . “ Just scanning . ”[128-mrs. p.]

After several minutes of this , [Soren]122-soren noticed a change in the night . [He]122-soren was not sure exactly what it was but something seemed different . “ [Digger]126-digger , remember that coyote song [you]126-digger were singing ? ”[122-soren]

“ Yes . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ Sing it again and tip [your]126-digger head down . ”[122-soren]

“ Hard to tell which way is down tonight . ”[128-mrs. p.]

Indeed it was , for [the entire world]615-the entire world , thick with snow , had suddenly turned completely white . But [Digger]126-digger began to sing in the thin grainy voice of a desert owl . [Soren]122-soren meanwhile was moving [his]122-soren head in small , minute movements . Finally , [he]122-soren said , “ [I]122-soren think [we]616-we ’re still over [water]612-water . ”[122-soren] The sound of [Digger]126-digger ’s song that was reflected back was different from when [he]126-digger had sung it when [they]616-we were over [land]617-land and [his]126-digger sound had disappeared into the softness of [an earth clad with trees]618-an earth clad with trees . Now the song came back sharp and crisp .

And then there came a moment when the wind died and the snowflakes seemed to stand still . [Twilight]123-twilight spoke . “ It ’s time for [me]123-twilight to fly point again , [Soren]122-soren . ”[123-twilight]

[Soren]122-soren knew [he]123-twilight was right . The snowflakes had evaporated into a thick dense fog . [The world]1373-the world , [the water below]620-the water below , was shrouded in mist . It was time for the vision of [Twilight]123-twilight — that time that [Twilight]123-twilight had spoken about when [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie had first met [him]122-soren , that time that had given [Twilight]123-twilight [his]123-twilight name , when boundaries become dim and shapes begin to melt away . It was the time for the Great Gray Owl , who lived on the edges and saw invisible connections , the joinings in a world that had turned foggy and confusing . Maybe [Twilight]123-twilight could find the current again .

[Soren]122-soren drifted back as the big owl stroked by [him]122-soren to the point position .

It seemed as if [they]621-they had flown for hours since [they]621-they had last seen the current . [Gylfie]125-gylfie was getting very tired and [Digger]126-digger ’s wing , the one injured by the crows , had begun to hurt . The wind was kicking up again and not in a favorable direction .

“ [I]122-soren ca n’t believe that a current can just disappear . [The puffins]540-the puffins said it would lead [us]621-they right to [the island]1384-the island , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren muttered .

“ What do [they]540-the puffins know ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight hooted . “ [They]540-the puffins even admit [they]540-the puffins ’re dumb . ”[123-twilight]

“ [I]122-soren do n’t think [they]540-the puffins ’re all that dumb , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said . “ [We]621-they ’ve got to be able to find it . ”[122-soren]

“ And there ’s [no place to even fetch up]1523-no place to even fetch up out here and rest , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie sighed .

“ [We]621-they got to go back , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said .

“ Go back where ? Not to [The Beaks]36-the beaks , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren spoke sharply .

“ To [any dry land]1524-any dry land . If [The Beaks]36-the beaks is the closest , then [The Beaks]36-the beaks it is , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight replied .

“ No ! ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said more fiercely . “ Look , [I]122-soren ’m going to fly down close to the water . ”[122-soren]

“ That could be dangerous , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ [Soren]122-soren , that wind is kicking up big waves . “ [I]122-soren ’ll be careful . [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , if [you]122-soren want to slither onto [Twilight]123-twilight , [you]122-soren can . ”[122-soren]

“ No , [dear]1344-dear , [I]126-digger ’ll stick with [you]122-soren . [I]126-digger ’m not frightened . ”[126-digger]

“ Good . ”[122-soren]

[Soren]122-soren began a banking turn down toward [the water]622-the water . Now , amid the blizzarding snow , the spume from the crests of waves spun up . How would [he]122-soren ever see a current in this mess ? [He]122-soren flew lower . Still nothing . What if [the others]344-the others had flown off ? Just given up . Could [he]122-soren truly blame [them]344-the others ? [He]122-soren had the most dreadful feeling in [his]122-soren gizzard . What if [he]122-soren was left alone out here — just [him]122-soren and [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. ?

Suddenly , [Soren]122-soren felt something stir in [his]122-soren gizzard . [He]122-soren said nothing but contracted and expanded [his]122-soren pupils . [The world]1373-the world was absolutely white now . Oh , this was when [he]122-soren needed [Twilight]123-twilight !

“ Right here , [Soren]122-soren . ”[122-soren]

“ [Twilight]123-twilight ! [You]123-twilight followed [me]122-soren down . ”[122-soren]

“ Call [me]123-twilight [a fool]1374-a fool . ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight peered into the whiteness , stretched , then shortened [his]123-twilight actual eye tubes so that one second [he]123-twilight was focusing near and the next far . Within the depths of the impenetrable white , [Twilight]123-twilight saw two even whiter patches .

“ Come , [young’uns]167-young’uns . [You]167-young’uns ’re right over the current . Ca n’t tell it on a night like this , though . So , welcome to [the Island of [Hoole]53-hoole]1528-the island of hoole . ”[122-soren]

[Two giant Snowy Owls]170-two giant snowy owls had melted out from the night and they were so white that by comparison the mist seemed gray .

“ [I]170-two giant snowy owls am [Boron]171-boron and this is [[my]170-two giant snowy owls mate]1529-my mate , [Barran]172-barran . ”[170-two giant snowy owls]

“ [You]170-two giant snowy owls are [the king]1530-the king and [the queen of [Hoole]53-hoole]1531-the queen of hoole . ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight whispered .

[Digger]126-digger and [Gylfie]125-gylfie , exhausted , plummeted down near [them]625-them .

“ Yes , [[my]172-barran dears]1532-my dears . But [we]1533-you prefer to be called [teachers]1534-teachers , or rybs . The word ryb means [teacher]1535-teacher and deep knowledge , ”[172-barran] said [Barran]172-barran .

“ [We]1533-you ’re not keen on titles , ”[171-boron] chuckled [Boron]171-boron .

“ But [you]1533-you came out to meet [us]1533-you ? ”[122-soren] said [Soren]122-soren .

“ Of course , ”[171-boron] replied [Boron]171-boron . “ [You]1533-you ’ve done the hard part . Now let [us]1533-you guide [you]1533-you the rest of the way . It ’s not far . ”[171-boron]

The blizzard had been swallowed by the mist and the mist now seemed to melt away against the whiteness of [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran . The night turned black again and the stars broke out . As a half moon rose , [the four young owls]340-the four young owls looked below and saw [the vast sea]627-the vast sea glinting with silver spangles from the moonlight and then , directly ahead , spreading into the night , were the twisting branches of the largest tree [they]340-the four young owls had ever seen , [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree .

“ [We]340-the four young owls are here , [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver . [We]340-the four young owls are here ! ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren whispered .

“ [I]122-soren know , [dear]1344-dear . [I]122-soren feel it . [I]122-soren feel it ! ”[122-soren]

[The four young owls]340-the four young owls , led by [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran , threaded [their]340-the four young owls way through the branches toward the center of the tree where the opening of a hollow was revealed . [Two Great Horned Owls]630-two great horned owls held the moss curtains apart using [their]630-two great horned owls beaks as [the young ones]631-the young ones flew through . [They]631-the young ones alighted down inside . [Soren]122-soren thought that [this hollow]632-this hollow was not only huge but different from [any other tree hollow [he]122-soren had ever seen]633-any other tree hollow he had ever seen , for it was light even though it was night . On the inside were strange flickering things .

[Boron]171-boron came up to [Soren]122-soren and [the other three owls]454-the other three owls . “ [I]171-boron see [you]122-soren have noticed [our]340-the four young owls candles . [You]122-soren see , here in [Hoole]53-hoole [we]340-the four young owls have discovered how to capture fire and tame it for [our]340-the four young owls own uses . [You]122-soren shall learn all about this , [young ones]1537-young ones . And who knows ? One of [you]122-soren might even become [a collier]1538-a collier . ”[171-boron]

“ A what ? ”[122-soren] asked [Soren]122-soren .

“ [A collier]1538-a collier — a carrier of coals . It is a very special skill . But there are many skills [you]122-soren shall be able to learn here in [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree , and [we]340-the four young owls are all here to teach [you]122-soren . These shall be [your]122-soren rybs . ”[171-boron]

With those words , [Boron]171-boron swept [his]635-his wings toward the walls of [the hollow]372-the hollow . There were ledges that hung like galleries above . [Soren]122-soren , [Twilight]123-twilight , Gylfie , and [Digger]126-digger gasped as [they]637-they saw a great gathering of owls — all kinds of owls from Burrowing ones to [Barn Owls]135-barn owls , from Pygmy Owls to Elf Owls , from Screech Owls to [Sooty Owls]139-sooty owls , from Great Horned Owls to Snowy Owls . Every kind of owl imaginable was here within [the hollow of the great tree]638-the hollow of the great tree , [their]637-they yellow , black , and amber eyes blinking and winking in the most friendly and inquisitive manner at [the five new arrivals]639-the five new arrivals .

[Barran]172-barran continued , “ Welcome , [young ones]1537-young ones . Welcome to [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree . One journey has ended … ”[172-barran]

Just one ? thought [Soren]122-soren .

But just then a series of deep , rolling gongs began to shake the entire tree . [Barran]172-barran stopped mid - speech .

“ Chaws — back up to [[your]1537-young ones positions]1541-your positions ! ”[172-barran] This hoot came from a Great Gray Owl in [the gallery]640-the gallery . Then , it seemed as if [the entire hollow]641-the entire hollow suddenly brightened as owls began donning battle claws and helmets , and the flames of the candles flickered off the bright polished surfaces of the armored owls .

“ Great Glaux — a battle ! Quick , let ’s get [our]637-they claws ! ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight began to hop up and down , pumping [his]123-twilight wings .

“ Not so fast , [young’un]160-young’un . ”[642-a plump , short - eared owl] [A plump , Short - eared Owl]642-a plump , short - eared owl waddled up to [them]637-they .

“ But where ’s the battle ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said .

CHAPTER EIGHT

First Night to First Light

[They]645-we had begun by following [the Short - eared Owl]173-the short - eared owl , known as [Matron]175-matron , through the enormous trunk of [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree , which was honeycombed with passages of varying widths , all quite twisty and none that seemed to go in a straight line . Off the passageways there were hollows of different sizes . Some , it seemed , were for sleeping , others for study of some sort , some for stores and supplies . [Soren]122-soren peeked into one and saw stacks and stacks of the strange flickering things that [Boron]171-boron said were called candles . Sometimes [Matron]175-matron led [them]645-we through a passage to the very end , where there might be a hole from which [they]645-we would fly to [another level of the tree]647-another level of the tree , then reenter through another opening and resume [their]645-we interior trail through [the trunk of the tree]648-the trunk of the tree . As best as [Soren]122-soren could figure out , [the sleeping quarters]649-the sleeping quarters were closer to the top of the tree , meeting hollows for large and smaller congregations of owls seemed to be below , along with a hollow that was called [a kitchen , from which very good smells issued]650-a kitchen , from which very good smells issued . There were places along the way where small groups of owls gathered to socialize . These seemed to be near the points where some of the larger branches of the tree joined the trunk . There were good - sized openings at these points so that owls could either sit inside on specially constructed perches or outside on the branches [themselves]645-we .

“ Now , [I]645-we want [you young’uns]1544-you young’uns to stay out of the way . [Everyone]311-everyone seemed quite content except for [Twilight]123-twilight . “ [I]123-twilight did n’t kill [those two fiends of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s]1586-those two fiends of st. aggie ’s , [I]123-twilight did n’t battle crows and tear out the throat of a bobcat to sit on [my]123-twilight tail feathers and be served tea . ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight seemed to swell to twice [his]123-twilight size .

[They]698-we had never really spoken about the meaning of those words , but [they]698-we knew that [the Barred Owl]463-the barred owl had meant , in no uncertain terms , that there was something out there that was far worse than [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s .

“ Yes , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said hesitantly . “ Maybe [we]698-we should go talk to [the king]1530-the king and [queen]1591-queen . But not now . It ’s daylight . Time to sleep . ”[122-soren]

[The hollow]372-the hollow was lined with the finest mosses and the fluffiest down . [Soren]122-soren made [his]122-soren way to a corner near the opening to watch the breaking dawn . The very last of the evening stars was just winking out and a lovely pink - ness began to spread in the sky . The immense gnarled limbs of the Great Ga’Hoole Tree stretched out and seemed to embrace the new day .

“ This down , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren whispered to [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver , “ reminds [me]122-soren of [Mum]179-mum . ”[122-soren]

“ Oh , does n’t it , [dear]1344-dear ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] said [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver , arranging [herself]120-mrs. plithiver into a neat coil in the same corner . Then , as the owls nestled down , the loveliest , most unearthly sounds began to pling softly through the Great Ga’Hoole Tree , and a voice began to sing .

Night is done , gone the moon , gone the stars

From the skies .

Fades the black of the night

Comes the morn with rosy light .

Fold [your]701-your wings , go to sleep ,

Rest [your]701-your gizzards ,

Safe [you]701-your ’ll be for the day .

Glaux is nigh .

Far away is First Black ,

But it shall seep back

Over field

Over flower

In the twilight hour .

[We]702-we are home in [[our]702-we tree]1572-our tree .

[We]702-we are owls , [we]702-we are free .

As [we]702-we go , this [we]702-we know

[Glaux]153-glaux is nigh .

[Soren]122-soren never remembered feeling so peaceful .

“ [Digger]126-digger , [Soren]122-soren , [Gylf]184-gylf , [you]122-soren asleep ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight called .

“ Almost , [Twi]185-twi , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger and [Soren]122-soren replied .

“ How soon do [you]185-twi think until [we]702-we get [our]702-we battle claws ? ”[126-digger]

“ [I]122-soren have no idea , [Twilight]123-twilight . But do n’t worry , good light , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren replied sleepily .

“ Good light , [Twi]185-twi , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said .

“ Good light , [Soren]122-soren , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ Good light , [Gylf]184-gylf , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren replied . And then added . “ Good light , [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver . ”[122-soren]

But [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver was already sound asleep .

CHAPTER NINE

A Parliament of [Owls

The four owls]704-owls the four owls were in the antechamber of [another hollow called [the parliament]706-the parliament]705-another hollow called the parliament . [They]704-owls the four owls were waiting to be admitted for [their]704-owls the four owls meeting with [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran .

“ Very important business inside , [young’uns]167-young’uns , ”[707-an owl on guard] [an owl on guard]707-an owl on guard spoke in the soft tings of [a Boreal Owl]186-a boreal owl .

“ [We]704-owls the four owls wo n’t take long , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

[I]0-i hope not , thought [Soren]122-soren . [He]122-soren was frightened . [The other three]428-the other three had decided that [he]122-soren should be [the one to speak]709-the one to speak .

[Another owl]710-another owl stuck [her]710-another owl head out . “ [You]122-soren can come in now . But be quiet and wait [your]122-soren turn . ”[710-another owl]

[She]710-another owl indicated a branch where [they]704-owls the four owls should perch . [Soren]122-soren looked about . [It]711-it was not an especially large hollow , not nearly as big as [the one in which [they]704-owls the four owls had first been welcomed by [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran]712-the one in which they had first been welcomed by boron and barran . There were candles , of course , and there was one long white branch from a tree that [Soren]122-soren thought was called a birch that had been bent into a half circle . It was on this white branch that [the owls of the parliament , no more than a dozen]713-the owls of the parliament , no more than a dozen , perched . [He]122-soren recognized [the elderly Strix Struma]187-strix struma , the Spotted Owl [he]122-soren had met the night before . [She]187-strix struma perched next to a Great Horned Owl of an unusual ruddy color with even more unusual very black talons . Then there was an ancient and decrepit Whiskered Screech , who appeared to have the worst case of feather fletch [Soren]122-soren had ever seen . Not that [he]122-soren had seen all that many . [The Whiskered Screech]188-the whiskered screech had a long bristly beard . One of [his]188-the whiskered screech eyes seemed stuck in a perpetual squint , and [his]188-the whiskered screech beak had a notch in it .

“ [I]189-gyl - fie ’ve never seen [a more disreputable - looking owl]1593-a more disreputable - looking owl , ”[189-gyl - fie] [Gyl - fie]189-gyl - fie whispered . “ [Great Glaux]131-glaux , look at [his]188-the whiskered screech foot ! [His]188-the whiskered screech talons ! ”[187-strix struma] [She]187-strix struma paused . “ Or lack of ! ”[187-strix struma] [The Whiskered Screech]188-the whiskered screech , indeed , had only three talons on one foot . And just as [Soren]122-soren was blinking in a mixture of astonishment and horror , [the old owl]714-the old owl swung [his]714-the old owl head about and fixed [Soren]122-soren in [his]122-soren squinted gaze . [Soren]122-soren thought [his]122-soren gizzard was going to drop right out of [him]122-soren .

“ So , [Elvanryb]190-elvanryb , ”[171-boron] [Boron]171-boron turned and addressed [another owl]710-another owl , [a Great Gray]159-the great gray owls . “ It is [your]190-elvanryb notion that [we]1594-we need to have a search - and - rescue attachment chaw on the colliering missions ? ”[159-the great gray owls]

“ Not all , [Boron]171-boron . [I]188-the whiskered screech think they are only necessary when [we]1594-we are in areas near [battle zones]1595-battle zones . So often [the parents]1596-the parents are off fighting . [We]1594-we got [them]1596-the parents back , but it taxed [our]1594-we chaw , believe [me]188-the whiskered screech — carrying coals and injured owlets . Ca n’t exactly drop them in the coal bucket . And [I]188-the whiskered screech do n’t even like to think of the ones [we]1594-we might have missed and left behind . ”[188-the whiskered screech]

[The old Whiskered Screech]188-the whiskered screech raised [his]188-the whiskered screech deformed foot .

“ Yes , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb ? ”[171-boron] [Boron]171-boron nodded to [the owl]319-the owl .

“ Question for [Bubo]197-bubo . ”[188-the whiskered screech] [the Whiskered Screech]188-the whiskered screech ’s voice was a low growl . “ [You]171-boron think this fire was natural or more trouble with the rogue raids ? ”[188-the whiskered screech]

“ No telling , [sir]1421-sir . [The rogues]1599-the rogues make good targets , and it would n’t be the first time [raiding one]1600-raiding one caused a fire . ”[188-the whiskered screech]

“ Hmmm , ”[717-the whiskered screech] [the Whiskered Screech]717-the whiskered screech replied , and then scratched [his]188-the whiskered screech head with the second of the three remaining talons of one foot .

“ Next order of business , ”[171-boron] [Boron]171-boron said . “ Something about starvation in [Ambala]41-ambala ? ”[171-boron]

[Ambala]41-ambala ! [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie looked at [each other]291-each other . [Ambala]41-ambala was where [[their]719-they friend]393-their friend [the great Hortense]192-hortense came from . When [they]719-they first had met [Hortense]192-hortense at [St. Aggie ’s]124-st. aggie , [they]719-they thought [she]192-hortense was [the most perfectly moon - blinked creature ever]721-the most perfectly moon - blinked creature ever . Moon blinking was perhaps the cruelest thing that St. [Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s did to [young owls]722-young owls . By forcing [them]722-young owls to sleep during the full shines of the moon , directly exposing [their]722-young owls heads to the moon ’s light , [they]719-they destroyed the will , the very personalities of [individual owls]723-individual owls and made [them]723-individual owls perfectly obedient with no thoughts of [their]723-individual owls own . [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie had devised a plan for fooling [the sleep monitors]724-the sleep monitors and escaping the full shine . It turned out so had [Hortense]192-hortense . [She]192-hortense , in fact , was [an infiltrator]725-an infiltrator and had been sneaking out the eggs that [[St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s patrols]265-st. aggie ’s patrols had been snatching . Still , [they]719-they had heard that [Hortense]192-hortense had become a legend in [Ambala]41-ambala because of [her]192-hortense heroic deeds .

“ Yes , ”[710-another owl] [another owl]710-another owl was speaking now . “ The egg production is down , and it is thought to be caused by a blight on the rodent population . “ [We]719-they ’ll look into it , ”[171-boron] [Boron]171-boron said . “ And now , [I]122-soren believe [some of [[our]719-they new arrivals]1602-our new arrivals]1601-some of our new arrivals have requested to speak with [us]719-they . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren turned and blinked at [the four young owls]340-the four young owls .

Speak with [us]732-us ! What was [he]122-soren talking about ? [Soren]122-soren was not prepared to talk in front of all these owls .

“ Now who wants to go first ? ”[122-soren]

[Twilight]123-twilight , [Digger]126-digger , and [Gylfie]125-gylfie all looked at [Soren]122-soren .

“ Up here , [young’un]1367-young’un . ”[123-twilight] There was a perch in the middle of the half circle to which [Boron]171-boron nodded .

Oh , [my]0-i Glaux . [I]0-i have to fly up and stand there all by [myself]0-i . [Soren]122-soren was so much more comfortable sharing this lower perch with [[his]122-soren friends]661-his friends . [Great Glaux]131-glaux , [he]122-soren would be close enough to that weird owl [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb to reach out and touch [his]191-ezylryb three - taloned foot . “ Uh … [my]122-soren name is [Soren]122-soren . [I]122-soren am from [the Forest of [Tyto]226-tyto]1604-the forest of tyto . [I]122-soren er … ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie had discussed how [he]122-soren should explain the events leading up to [his]122-soren snatching by [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s . [Gylfie]125-gylfie felt it was not good to go into too much detail about [Kludd]129-kludd actually shoving [him]122-soren from the nest . “ Tales of attempted fratricide might not be the right way to start , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie had said .

Of course , [Soren]122-soren had n’t known what fratricide was until [Gylfie]125-gylfie explained it meant killing [[your]122-soren brother]734-your brother . Then [he]122-soren agreed with [her]125-gylfie . [Kludd]129-kludd was [the only one]736-the only one , after all . “ [I]129-kludd was snatched by [a St. [Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s patrol]267-a st. aggie ’s patrol . It was at St. [Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s that [I]129-kludd met [Gylfie]125-gylfie . ”[129-kludd]

It was difficult at first to speak and not look at [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb ’s mangled foot , but as [he]122-soren spoke , [Soren]122-soren became more relaxed . [The owls]455-the owls seemed attentive but not particularly impressed , not even when [he]122-soren told [them]455-the owls about [Hortense]192-hortense and that it was not simply starvation that was accounting for the low egg counts in [Ambala]41-ambala .

“ And so ? ”[172-barran] [Barran]172-barran said when [Soren]122-soren appeared to have concluded .

“ And so what ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked .

“ What is it [you]125-gylfie want , [dear]1344-dear ? ”[172-barran]

“ [The four of [us]1607-the four of us]1607-the four of us are [a band]277-a band . [We]1607-the four of us have flown together , fought together , and escaped many dangers — as [a band]277-a band . [We]1607-the four of us know from [our]1607-the four of us experience that there is great evil that threatens every owl in [every owl kingdom on [earth]370-earth]1610-every owl kingdom on earth . [We]1607-the four of us want only to fight this evil , to become [guardian knights of this order]1612-guardian knights of this order . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren saw [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb stifle a yawn and pick up what appeared to be a dried caterpillar to munch . “ [We]1607-the four of us feel that [we]1607-the four of us have special knowledge . [We]1607-the four of us have much to offer , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren concluded .

“ [I]171-boron am sure [you]122-soren do , ”[171-boron] said [Boron]171-boron . “ [Every owl here]1613-every owl here has special knowledge and , during [your]122-soren training , [you]122-soren will find out what [your]122-soren talents are . [You]122-soren will , after proper instruction , be chosen for a chaw and then [your]122-soren learning will , indeed , advance to a higher level , become more specialized . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren explained why [they]738-they probably would not be put into the same chaws , even though [they]738-they were [a band]277-a band . “ [We]738-they do not all need to learn the same things . Each of [you]122-soren will make [[your]122-soren band]1614-your band better in the end if [you]122-soren learn different skills . And this all takes time . ”[122-soren]

[Soren]122-soren felt [Twilight]123-twilight rustle behind [him]122-soren . [He]122-soren knew it was [Twilight]123-twilight without even flipping [his]122-soren head for a look . [He]122-soren also felt that [the old owl]714-the old owl , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , despite [his]191-ezylryb yawning and munching , was looking at [him]122-soren sharply . Indeed , [he]122-soren felt locked in [that old owl]741-that old owl ’s sights . [He]122-soren might as well be a mouse scuttling across a forest floor about to be pounced on by a bird of prey . It was as if that little scrap of amber that glimmered through the squinty eye had trapped [him]122-soren . [He]122-soren had never felt such a penetrating , piercing look and yet to [the other owls of [the parliament]706-the parliament]742-the other owls of the parliament it did not appear as if [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb was regarding [him]122-soren at all . Rather , it seemed as if [he]122-soren was bored silly with [the young Barn Owl]129-kludd .

[Boron]171-boron continued to speak , “ It takes time , of which [I]171-boron think [you]122-soren have an abundance . It takes patience — and that , [I]171-boron am not sure how much [you]122-soren have and , most important , it takes dedication and that , [young’un]1367-young’un , is found both in the heart and the gizzard . The nobility of the owls [you]122-soren see here in the parliament has not simply been given , nor has it been earned through courageous acts . Indeed , nobility is not always found in the flash of battle claws or flying through the embered wakes of firestorms , or even in making strong the weak , mending the broken , vanquishing the proud , or making powerless [those who abuse the frail]1616-those who abuse the frail . ”[171-boron]

[Soren]122-soren ’s gizzard grew quiet as [Boron]171-boron spoke . “ It is also found in the resolute heart , the gizzard that can withstand the temptations of false dreams , the mind that has the imagination to comprehend another ’s pain , as [I]171-boron think [one young owl]1617-one young owl did tonight when [he]1617-one young owl sat by the little Pygmy Owl with quiet understanding of [her]1618-her loss of tree , nest , [family]1619-family , and egg . It is all of this that ultimately confers nobility and makes [the Guardians of Ga’Hoole]1620-the guardians of ga’hoole rise in the night with hearts sublime . ”[171-boron] [Boron]171-boron paused and looked at [the other three owls]454-the other three owls . “ And so as [I]171-boron said when [you]454-the other three owls arrived , one journey has ended and now another starts . On the night of the morrow [your]454-the other three owls training shall begin . ”[171-boron]

CHAPTER TEN

Twilight on [the Brink

Dawn]63-the brink dawn is the thief of night , and the night is when owls stir and become alive , when [they]745-they fly . So the day that follows that dawn is only for sleeping , to prepare for the night . For some , however , the day feels like an eternity . And for the four young owls the night to come , the morrow night of [their]454-the other three owls training , was still hours away .

Perhaps it had been a mild twinge in [Soren]122-soren ’s gizzard or a faint stirring in [his]122-soren heart , but sometime near midday , while [the hollow]372-the hollow was thick with sleep , [the young Barn Owl]129-kludd sensed that something was slightly amiss , perhaps incomplete . It was not the feeling of dreadful cold fear that could steal into one ’s gizzard and make one ’s wings go yeep . No , not that at all , but something was not right . [Soren]122-soren ’s eyes blinked open , and in the dim milky light of the day that filtered into [the hollow]372-the hollow [he]122-soren saw only two other owls . [Twilight]123-twilight was gone !

[Soren]122-soren blinked again . Was [he]122-soren really gone ? In the flick of a wing , [Soren]122-soren had lofted onto [the rim of [the hollow]372-the hollow]578-the rim of the hollow . Every limb of [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree stood out keen and black against the dull winter sky . Shadows were cast with sharp edges . There was , however , one long shadow stretched between the thick , gnarled branches of the tree , swelling like a dark cloud dropped down from above . That shadow was [Twilight]123-twilight ’s . The Great Gray was perched on one of the less public takeoff branches . [Soren]122-soren flew up .

“ What are [you]123-twilight doing , [Twilight]123-twilight ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren spoke softly .

“ Thinking . ”[122-soren]

That was a good sign . [Twilight]123-twilight was a creature of action , of instinct . Not to say that [the Great Gray Owl]151-the great gray was stupid . [He]151-the great gray just acted out of an incredibly honed instinct and rarely meditated . “ Thinking of leaving , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight added in a flat , dull voice .

“ Leaving ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren was stunned . “ But [we]1621-we ’re a band , [Twilight]123-twilight . ”[122-soren]

“ [We]1621-we ’re not a band , [Soren]122-soren . [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran said as much . ”[122-soren]

“ [They]1622-they did n’t exactly say [we]1621-we ’re not a band , [Twilight]123-twilight . ”[122-soren]

“ [I]122-soren think that is exactly what [they]1622-they meant . [They]1622-they said it was highly unlikely that any of [us]1621-we would be chosen for the same chaw . [They]1622-they said it was not the Ga’Hoolian way . In other words , [they]1622-they are separating [us]1621-we . ”[122-soren]

“ [They]1622-they are separating [us]1621-we only for the chaws and that ’s because [they]1622-they want [us]1621-we all to learn different things . That does n’t mean [we]1621-we ’re not [a band]277-a band . A band is n’t just perching side by side , or even flying side by side all the time . ”[122-soren]

[Twilight]123-twilight blinked . “ Well , what is it , then ? ”[123-twilight]

[Soren]122-soren paused . This was hard . Maybe [he]122-soren was n’t quite sure what [a band]277-a band was . But no , that was n’t right . In [his]122-soren gizzard [he]122-soren knew [they]277-a band were [a band]277-a band . “ [We]1621-we are [a band]277-a band despite what [any owl]1625-any owl says or does . In [[our]1621-we gizzards]1626-our gizzards , [we]1621-we are [a band]277-a band and [we]1621-we feel that . It can not be undone . [We]1621-we are what [we]1621-we are and [I]122-soren know it and [you]1628-you know it and [we]1621-we all know it — even [they]1629-they know it . ”[122-soren]

[Twilight]123-twilight dropped [his]123-twilight eyelids so that they were only glinting slits of gold .

[He]123-twilight ’s going to tell [me]0-i about [the Orphan School of Tough Learning]408-the orphan school of tough learning . [I]0-i just know it , [Soren]122-soren thought .

But [Twilight]123-twilight did n’t . “ [I]123-twilight am [an owl of low birth in the eyes of [the world]1373-the world]1630-an owl of low birth in the eyes of the world because [I]123-twilight have had no proper upbringing . ”[123-twilight] All the bluster was gone from [Twilight]123-twilight ’s voice ; even [his]123-twilight feathers seemed to sag a bit and [he]123-twilight appeared slightly smaller . “ [I]123-twilight have had no First Ceremonies , [no First Insect]1632-no first insect , no First Fur - on - Meat ceremony . There is much [I]123-twilight do n’t know . ”[123-twilight]

[Soren]122-soren was stunned . [Twilight]123-twilight never admitted to not knowing anything .

“ But there is much [I]123-twilight do know . [I]123-twilight know light and shadow and everything in between . [I]123-twilight know the life pulse in the throat of a bobcat and where to slash to break the blood pump that is the cat ’s heart . [I]123-twilight know mountains and [deserts]1349-deserts and the creatures who fly and [those who do n’t , but slither or crawl or leap]1634-those who do n’t , but slither or crawl or leap . [I]123-twilight know of all sorts of claws , as well as fangs and poisons that lock the talons and freeze the wings . [I]123-twilight know the false horizon that comes in the heat of the summer when the air is thick with dew and confuses old owls so that [they]1635-they go yeep and fall . And [I]123-twilight know all this , not because [I]123-twilight was reared in a hollow lined with the down of [[my]123-twilight mother]1636-my mother ’s breast , but because [I]123-twilight was not . [I]123-twilight was alone within minutes of [my]123-twilight hatching . [I]123-twilight can be alone . It is a special talent . And [I]123-twilight can be alone again . ”[123-twilight]

[Soren]122-soren ’s gizzard twisted in slow dread . [Twilight]123-twilight turned [his]123-twilight head slowly and blinked . “ But [I]123-twilight also know that [I]123-twilight am a better owl with [you]122-soren and with Gylfie and [Digger]126-digger . [I]123-twilight know now that [I]123-twilight am part of a band . And [I]123-twilight know this because of [you]122-soren , [Soren]122-soren — [you]122-soren alone . ”[123-twilight] [The Great Gray]151-the great gray paused and mused . The gold in [his]151-the great gray eyes seemed to grow softer , like that pale haze of yellow just above the horizon as the sun begins to set .

“ Perhaps , [Soren]122-soren , [you]122-soren are [the blood pump of [the band]598-the band]1637-the blood pump of the band , and [I]122-soren would not want to slash such a life pulse . ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren blinked . “ [You]122-soren are right , [Soren]122-soren . [We]598-the band are [a band]277-a band . And nothing can or will undo it . [We]598-the band are [[our]598-the band own guardians]1640-our own guardians . ”[122-soren]

“ And maybe someday [we]598-the band shall become [the Guardians of [Ga’Hoole]21-ga’hoole]1620-the guardians of ga’hoole , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said quietly .

So [the two owls]754-the two owls returned to [the hollow]372-the hollow for sleep and the day grew brighter and brighter . And finally , the light began to seep away as the dull blue of the winter sky darkened . The clouds became tinged with purple and the last blaze of the sinking sun turned the horizon as red as the bobcat ’s blood . Then , at last , the stars broke out and it was time for [the owls of [Ga’Hoole]21-ga’hoole]756-the owls of ga’hoole to rise .

CHAPTER ELEVEN

The Golden Talons

It was the deep , black part of the night . The moon had passed through its last moment of the dwenking and now it was gone completely . Gone for two nights at least , until its first silvery thread would reappear at the newing . [Soren]122-soren had been at [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree for almost a month , which meant thirty nights and one complete moon cycle from dwenking to [newing]64-newing . Yes , [Soren]122-soren knew how to count now . To count and much more , really . But counting was special . [He]122-soren remembered thinking that [[his]122-soren father]580-his father had said that the fir tree in which [[[his]122-soren family]758-his family had [[their]758-his family hollow]655-their hollow]759-his family had their hollow was nearly ninety feet tall . But [Soren]122-soren had no idea what the number meant , just as [he]122-soren had no idea how long sixty - six days were , which was the length of time it took [a Barn Owl , such as [himself]122-soren]761-a barn owl , such as himself , to fledge flight feathers . Numbers had been meaningless and [he]122-soren had promised [himself]122-soren , once [he]122-soren had escaped from the awful St. Aggie ’s , that [he]122-soren would learn how to count .

But there was so much more to learn than simply counting . For a month now , [he]122-soren had had many lessons — flying lessons , even work with battle claws . [They]762-they had practiced with almost every chaw except for the navigation chaw and [the colliering and weather interpretation chaws]763-the colliering and weather interpretation chaws . For the last chaw , weather , [Soren]122-soren had felt spared because it was led by the grizzled old Screech , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . [The members]764-the members were considered among [the fiercest and the bravest of [the entire Great Ga’Hoole Tree]766-the entire great ga’hoole tree]765-the fiercest and the bravest of the entire great ga’hoole tree , for [they]764-the members had to fly through all sorts of storms , blizzards , and even hurricanes to gather important information for [troops going into battle]767-troops going into battle or on missions of search - and - rescue . And [they]764-the members brought back coals from burning forest fires , which fed the forge that made so many vital things for [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree , from battle claws to pots and pans , and , of course , gave light to the candles .

And now on this blackest of nights , [he]122-soren was learning to navigate from [Strix Struma]187-strix struma .

“ [We]769-we shall begin with a few simple tracing exercises , ”[187-strix struma] [Strix Struma]187-strix struma had announced when [they]769-we were poised on [the main takeoff branch of [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree]770-the main takeoff branch of the great ga’hoole tree . “ The Great Glaux will soon rise , ”[187-strix struma] [she]187-strix struma continued . “ The time of the Little Raccoon has , of course , passed by this season but a new beauty shall appear for the first time tonight . The Golden Talons . It is an unusual constellation , for in [this part of [the world]1373-the world]1642-this part of the world it shall be with [us]769-we through summer . ”[187-strix struma] [She]187-strix struma raised [her]187-strix struma foot from the branch . “ And just like [our]769-we talons , there are four — long , curved , and sharp ones formed by the stars . ”[187-strix struma]

“ But not gold , ”[181-primrose] piped up [Primrose]181-primrose , [the Pygmy Owl that [Soren]122-soren had befriended on the night [she]187-strix struma had been brought in from [the borderlands]1550-the borderlands]771-the pygmy owl that soren had befriended on the night she had been brought in from the borderlands , singed and orphaned .

“ The gold is an illusion , [[my]187-strix struma dear]1644-my dear , ”[187-strix struma] [Strix Struma]187-strix struma said . “ It is caused by atmospheric wobble that [you]122-soren shall learn more about . ”[187-strix struma]

With a sudden blur and a slicing sound through the air , [Strix Struma]187-strix struma ’s talons shot out and caught a fruit bat on the wing . “ A little snack before [we]769-we fly , ”[187-strix struma] [she]187-strix struma said and quickly de - winged it , then served up tasty morsels to [the class]773-the class . “ [We]769-we do n’t want to overeat before [our]769-we lesson . That is never good , but a bit of bat gives a boost , [I]187-strix struma always find . Now , ready ! ”[187-strix struma]

“ Yes , [Strix Struma]187-strix struma , ”[774-they] [they]774-they all replied .

[Strix Struma]187-strix struma preferred to dispense with the title of ryb and instead be called by [her]187-strix struma family name . [She]187-strix struma was [a Spotted Owl]775-a spotted owl who came from a very ancient ancestry of which [she]187-strix struma was intensely proud . “ Good , then . [Primrose]181-primrose , [I]187-strix struma would like [you]181-primrose flying directly behind [me]187-strix struma . Gylfie , [you]181-primrose shall fly in the downwind flanking position . And [Soren]122-soren , [you]181-primrose fly tail . Any questions ? ”[187-strix struma]

[Soren]122-soren blinked in amazement . Although [he]122-soren had been at the Tree a month , those two simple words “ Any questions ”[187-strix struma] were still like magic to [him]122-soren after [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s .

[Strix Struma]187-strix struma always used the battle terminology , such as “ flanks . ”[187-strix struma] For not only did [Strix Struma]187-strix struma have a proud and ancient lineage , but [she]187-strix struma had been trained for combat as [a windward flanking sub - commander]776-a windward flanking sub - commander and had seen action at the Battle of [Little Hoole]66-little hoole . “ Off [we]1646-we go , then ! ”[777-the large spotted owl] And [the large Spotted Owl]777-the large spotted owl rose in flight with the four young owls quickly maneuvering into [their]778-their positions .

[Soren]122-soren flew several lengths behind [Strix Struma]187-strix struma so as not to be affected by the eddies curling off [her]187-strix struma very broad tail . [He]122-soren wished [Twilight]123-twilight and [Digger]126-digger were flying with [them]778-their but [Twilight]123-twilight was in [a more advanced navigation class]779-a more advanced navigation class . [Twilight]123-twilight ’s orphan school of tough learning had apparently taught [him]126-digger a lot because [he]126-digger had been placed in many advanced classes .

“ All right , [class]1647-class . ”[187-strix struma] [Strix Struma]187-strix struma spoke in the broad hooting tones that were indeed the voice of a mature Spotted Owl . “ Ooooh , this is sooooo exciting . ”[176-otulissa] It was [Otulissa]176-otulissa trying [her]176-otulissa best to sound exactly like [Strix Struma]187-strix struma , which [she]176-otulissa would someday , for [she]176-otulissa , too , was [a Spotted Owl]775-a spotted owl . [Soren]122-soren blinked and winced . If [Twilight]123-twilight had been [here]1419-here [he]122-soren would have yarped a pellet mid - flight right in [her]176-otulissa face . [Soren]122-soren saw [Glyfie]156-glyfie spin [her]156-glyfie head back and blink as [she]156-glyfie moved [her]156-glyfie beak silently . But [Soren]122-soren could understand perfectly what [she]156-glyfie was saying : “ Do [you]122-soren believe [her]156-glyfie ? ”[156-glyfie]

[Primrose]181-primrose spoke up . “ Do [you]122-soren have a cold , [Otulissa]176-otulissa ? [You]122-soren sound clogged up . ”[181-primrose]

Oh , great Glaux . [Soren]122-soren thought [he]122-soren might die laughing . Leave it to [Primrose]181-primrose ! And the best part of it was that [she]181-primrose was sincere . [Primrose]181-primrose never suspected [anyone]394-anyone of anything . “ [Guileless]194-guileless , ”[181-primrose] [Gylfie]125-gylfie called [her]125-gylfie . “ Charmingly guileless . ”[125-gylfie] Often [Soren]122-soren did n’t understand the words that Gylfie used , but in this case [he]122-soren began to . [He]122-soren knew what [Gylfie]125-gylfie meant . [Primrose]181-primrose did n’t have a fake hollow bone in [her]181-primrose body . [She]181-primrose was utterly truthful and always believed that owls were motivated by the best of reasons . [She]181-primrose had , needless to say , never spent any time at [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s .

[The navigation class]784-the navigation class flew on . It was not long after the first star in the Talons rose that several more broke out of the blackness , and it did seem as if four great golden talons clawed at the night .

“ [We]1649-we shall trace each talon from its toe base to its sharp tip , ”[187-strix struma] hooted [Strix Struma]187-strix struma .

[Soren]122-soren was now flying directly behind [Primrose]181-primrose , and [he]122-soren was becoming slightly confused as [she]181-primrose constantly swiveled [her]181-primrose head . “ Confusing , is n’t it , [dear]1344-dear ? ”[187-strix struma] [Strix Struma]187-strix struma had dropped back . “ [You]122-soren ’re in a difficult position behind [Primrose]181-primrose , but it ’s good training . ”[187-strix struma]

“ Oh , [Soren]122-soren . ”[181-primrose] [Primrose]181-primrose swiveled [her]181-primrose head . “ It ’s [[my]181-primrose darned spots]1651-my darned spots , is n’t it ? [I]181-primrose ’m so embarrassed . ”[181-primrose]

“ [I]181-primrose had to fly behind a Pygmy for years . Made [me]181-primrose [a terrific navigator]1654-a terrific navigator . Now , what [you]122-soren do , [Soren]122-soren , is [you]122-soren focus just below the spots . That will help [you]122-soren . ”[181-primrose]

And it did . In no time the spots seemed to entirely vanish .

[They]785-they flew on through the night , practicing mostly by tracing the Golden Talons . CHAPTER TWELVE

[Hukla]16-hukla , [Hukla]16-hukla and Hope

There was the noisy chattering of young owls , which was known as gazooling . [Soren]122-soren remembered it from [his]122-soren brief few weeks with [[his]122-soren own family]791-his own family in [the old fir tree]792-the old fir tree . [[His]122-soren sister]347-his sister , [Eglantine]130-eglantine , [[his]122-soren brother]794-his brother , [Kludd]129-kludd , and [he]122-soren all would try out [their]795-their unformed voices in a range of hoots and shreeings . [Barn Owls]195-barn owls were more screamers than [hooters]796-hooters . It was a raucous time of the day before getting ready to rest . Here at [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree it was even rowdier . But for [Soren]122-soren , as the black of night thinned to gray and the gray became a cool purple that eventually warmed to rose , it could be a melancholy time .

[Soren]122-soren could not figure out why [he]122-soren felt so sad . [He]122-soren had a lot to gazool about , as much as [anyone else]797-anyone else . Of course , [Twilight]123-twilight came up to [him]122-soren first , and [Soren]122-soren could barely squeeze in a word . “ [I]123-twilight did a fantastic power dive tonight . A tight spiral and [I]123-twilight was down on the ground before [you]123-twilight could flick a blink . [Soren]122-soren , [I]123-twilight think [Barran]172-barran was really impressed . “ But , [Twilight]123-twilight , if [you]122-soren were in the advanced navigation class with [Barran]172-barran why were [you]122-soren practicing search - and - rescue moves ? ”[123-twilight]

“ Because [Barran]172-barran also teaches search - and - rescue . [She]172-barran is [the one who taps for the search - and - rescue chaw]1655-the one who taps for the search - and - rescue chaw . ”[123-twilight]

“ Oh , racdrops ! ”[197-bubo] boomed [Bubo]197-bubo . “ Make way ! Make way ! Let the nest snakes serve tea . [We]1658-we all be starving and do n’t need to listen to none of this nonsense about old family lines . [Bubo]197-bubo was the ruddy - colored owl with the very black talons whom [Soren]122-soren had first seen in [the parliament]706-the parliament . [A high - shouldered , enormous Great Horned Owl]800-a high - shouldered , enormous great horned owl , [his]800-a high - shouldered , enormous great horned owl ear tufts alone stood as tall as [Gylfie]125-gylfie . “ Line up ! Line up ! Now , please do n’t rush [the dear snakes]1660-the dear snakes . Do n’t crowd the snakes by cramming in too many of [you]1660-the dear snakes around one snake . But it was too late . [Digger]126-digger had already launched into [his]126-digger story , and [Primrose]181-primrose was spellbound . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver dozed off as the owls continued to talk and sip [their]818-their cups of tea .

“ So here ’s how the joke goes . [You]1679-you got a bunch of crows and other wet poopers like hummingbirds and seagulls . ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight had begun telling a joke .

Suddenly , [their]819-them little nut cups of tea trembled . “ Enough is enough ! ”[120-mrs. plithiver] [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver screeched a hiss that curled through the air . “ [I]120-mrs. plithiver shall not have this talk at the table . This is inappropriate on every level . ”[120-mrs. plithiver] Then [her]120-mrs. plithiver rosy scalesseemed to shimmer with a new radiance and with one quick writhing motion all the teacups clattered off [her]120-mrs. plithiver back .

This was not the first time a nest - maid snake had shaken off teacups . There were not many rules at [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree but , as [Matron]175-matron instructed [the young owls]821-the young owls , there were to be no wet poop jokes anywhere , and especially not in [the dining hollow]810-the dining hollow . Therefore , the nest snakes were under orders , if it was teatime and [they]821-the young owls were serving , to immediately dismiss [the culprits]823-the culprits , and this was accomplished in just the manner [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. had done when [she]128-mrs. p. shook [herself]128-mrs. p. .

[They]819-them were ordered to go see [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran . “ [Boron]171-boron , [I]172-barran would like to point out that [Primrose]181-primrose and Gylfie are not [males]1683-males . ”[172-barran]

“ Oh , but [I]181-primrose still know a lot of wet poop jokes , ”[181-primrose] [Primrose]181-primrose tooted up .

The air was laced with the soft churr sounds that owls make when [they]824-they laugh . [They]824-they were all churring except for [Barran]172-barran . [Boron]171-boron was churring the hardest . [His]825-his big white fluffy body was shaking so hard that [he]825-his shook loose a few wisps of down .

“ Really ! [Boron]171-boron ! It ’s not a laughing matter , ”[323-his mate] [[his]825-his mate]323-his mate said in dismay .

“ But it is , [[my]825-his dear]1644-my dear . That ’s the point . ”[825-his] And [he]825-his began to laugh even harder .

The owls had already settled down for the day . It had been several hours since [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk had sung [her]183-madame plonk lovely “ Night Is Done ”[183-madame plonk] song and [all]827-all had wished one another good light until the next night . But [Soren]122-soren had trouble falling asleep , and then [he]122-soren woke up in that slow time of the day for owls , when silence seems to press down over everything and the air is thick with sunlight and the minutes drag by . Time seemed to crawl and [one]613-one wondered if there would ever be blackness again . Once more , [Soren]122-soren felt that melancholy feeling . [He]122-soren was not sure exactly what was causing it . [He]122-soren should be so happy here . [He]122-soren did feel bad about [their]829-their misbehavior at tea . Good manners meant a lot to [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. [He]122-soren hated disappointing [her]128-mrs. p. . Maybe , [he]122-soren thought , [I]0-i should go and apologize . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver was often up at this time of the day . Perhaps [he]122-soren would make [his]122-soren way down to [[her]120-mrs. plithiver hollow]830-her hollow . [She]120-mrs. plithiver lived there with [two other nest - maids]831-two other nest - maids .

The three snakes shared a mossy pocket in [the tree nearly one hundred feet below where [Soren]122-soren slept]832-the tree nearly one hundred feet below where soren slept . [It]833-it smelled of damp shredded bark , moss , and warm stones . The nest - maid snakes enjoyed sleeping with warm stones . So , these stones were part of the furnishings of [any hollow in which [they]831-two other nest - maids slept]834-any hollow in which they slept . [Bubo]197-bubo always heated up several so [they]831-two other nest - maids could have [them]835-them in [[their]831-two other nest - maids quarters]836-their quarters . [Soren]122-soren rather liked the smell . The heat from the stones released the fragrance of the moss , and the moss that grew on [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree was especially sweet . It was used in a soup that was made by [Cook]177-cook . There was barely a part of [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree that was not used for something . It was for this reason that the owls so carefully nurtured and cared for [[their]831-two other nest - maids home]288-their home — never overpicking the milkberries , and burying [their]831-two other nest - maids pellets around the roots of the tree where their rich , nourishing contents would be most directly absorbed .

The fragrance of the moss and warm stones drifted up to [Soren]122-soren as [he]122-soren made [his]122-soren way down . [He]122-soren stopped at the opening of the pocket and peered in . But before [he]122-soren could even speak , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. must have sensed [his]122-soren presence .

“ [Soren]122-soren , [dear boy]1685-dear boy , what are [you]122-soren doing up this time of day ? Come on in , [young one]1686-young one . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ Are n’t [the other nest - maids]1687-the other nest - maids asleep ? ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ Oh , no . [They]1687-the other nest - maids ’re all out doing guild business . ”[128-mrs. p.]

There were several guilds : [the harp guild]839-the harp guild , [the lacemakers]840-the lacemakers ’ , [weavers]841-weavers ’ , and others to which the nest snakes belonged . One had to be chosen . It was rather like the tapping ceremony for the chaws . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver had not been chosen yet for any guild .

“ [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , [I]120-mrs. plithiver came to apologize for [my]120-mrs. plithiver disgusting behavior at tea . [I]120-mrs. plithiver am truly sorry . [I]120-mrs. plithiver know that … ”[120-mrs. plithiver]

[Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. coiled up and cocked [her]128-mrs. p. head in that particularly sympathetic way [she]128-mrs. p. had . “ [Soren]122-soren , ”[128-mrs. p.] [she]128-mrs. p. spoke softly and there was something in the very softness of [her]128-mrs. p. voice that brought tears to [his]842-his eyes . “ [Soren]122-soren , [dear boy]1685-dear boy , [I]128-mrs. p. know [you]122-soren are sorry , but [I]128-mrs. p. do n’t think that is why [you]122-soren are here . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ It ’s not ? ”[128-mrs. p.] [Soren]122-soren was dumbfounded . But [she]128-mrs. p. was right . That really was n’t why [he]122-soren was here . [He]122-soren knew it as soon as [she]128-mrs. p. had said it . Yet [he]122-soren was still confused . “ Why … why , ”[122-soren] [he]122-soren stammered , “ am [I]122-soren here ? ”[122-soren]

“ [I]128-mrs. p. think it has to do with [[your]122-soren sister]1689-your sister , [Eglantine]130-eglantine . ”[128-mrs. p.]

[He]122-soren missed [[his]122-soren parents]268-his parents terribly but [he]122-soren did not worry about [[his]122-soren parents]268-his parents . [Eglantine]130-eglantine , however , was another story . [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. had [her]128-mrs. p. suspicions about [Kludd]129-kludd . “ It ’s the not knowing , is n’t it , that ’s so hard . Not knowing if [Eglantine]130-eglantine is dead or alive … ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ Yes , [dear]1344-dear . [I]128-mrs. p. know . ”[128-mrs. p.]

“ [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. , [I]128-mrs. p. know that [St. Aegolius Academy for Orphan Owls]1692-st. aegolius academy for orphan owls is [the most terrible place]1693-the most terrible place . [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver waved [her]120-mrs. plithiver head about in a small figure eight , which was the manner in which blind snakes often moved when [they]845-they could not quite decide what to say or do . [Soren]122-soren peered at [her]120-mrs. plithiver closely . Was something leaking out of the small dents where [her]120-mrs. plithiver eyes would have been ? “ No , [dear]1344-dear . Come to [me]128-mrs. p. whenever [you]1344-dear want to talk about [Eglantine]130-eglantine . It was always this way when [Soren]122-soren spoke with [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. [She]128-mrs. p. always made [him]122-soren feel so much better . It was just as if a clean rain had washed away all of the worry and the sadness . Yes , [he]122-soren still missed [[his]122-soren parents]268-his parents . [He]122-soren would always miss [[his]122-soren parents]268-his parents , and [he]122-soren would never get used to it , but [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. had given [him]122-soren hope about [Eglantine]130-eglantine , and this alone made [him]122-soren feel so much better . [He]122-soren decided to take the outside route back to [[his]122-soren hollow]694-his hollow . The day guard on this side of the tree was very nice and would n’t mind that [he]122-soren had gone down to see [[his]122-soren old nest - maid]849-his old nest - maid . And there were n’t any real rules at [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree about having to stay in [your]851-your hollow asleep all day until the wake - up calls of good night . So [he]122-soren stepped out on a branch and lifted into flight , swooping through the spreading limbs of the old tree . Yes , [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. was right . [He]122-soren could see the beginnings of the new milkberries forming on the long glistening threads they called silver rain at this time of the year .

These slim vines cascaded down from branches of [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree and swayed like sheer curtains in the afternoon sun . In winter , they were white and then in spring they turned silvery , by summer they would be golden , and by fall they would turn a deep coppery rose . Thus , in [Ga’Hoole]21-ga’hoole , the seasons were not simply called winter , summer , spring , and fall , but the times of the white rain , the silver rain , the golden rain , and the rain of the copper rose . For the young owls , there was nothing more fun than to fly amid the glistening curtains . Therefore [they]852-they had developed all sorts of games to be played . But on this bright afternoon , [everyone]311-everyone was asleep so [Soren]122-soren found [himself]122-soren alone . Rain must have just fallen for the vines sparkled with beads of water and behind one curtain [he]122-soren caught the shimmering colors of a rainbow .

“ Lovely , is n’t it ? ”[183-madame plonk] A voice melted like a chime out of the silver rain . It was [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk , [the harp singer]854-the harp singer , who sang [them]855-them to sleep each morning . [She]183-madame plonk was [a Snowy Owl]856-a snowy owl and , as [she]183-madame plonk sailed through the silver rain , [Soren]122-soren blinked in amazement , for [he]122-soren had never seen such a beautiful sight . [She]183-madame plonk was no longer snowy white but indeed had become a living , flying rainbow . All colors seemed to radiate from [her]183-madame plonk plumage .

[Soren]122-soren wished that [one of [the chaws of [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree]858-the chaws of the great ga’hoole tree]857-one of the chaws of the great ga’hoole tree could be learning the harp and singing from [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk . But [the pluckers of the harp]860-the pluckers of the harp were never owls , only blind snakes . And [the only ones trained to sing]861-the only ones trained to sing were [direct descendants of [the Plonk line of Snowy Owls]863-the plonk line of snowy owls]862-direct descendants of the plonk line of snowy owls .

[They]861-the only ones trained to sing flew , weaving themselves through the vines and the hues of the rainbow for a few more minutes . Then [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk said , “ Time for [me]183-madame plonk to go , [dear]1344-dear . Wake - up time . Evensong must be sung . But [I]183-madame plonk ’ve so enjoyed [our]1702-our afternoon flight . [We]1702-our ’ll do it again sometime . Or drop by for a cup of milkberry tea . ”[183-madame plonk]

[Soren]122-soren wondered if [he]122-soren would ever have the nerve to just”drop by ”[183-madame plonk] [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk ’s for a cup oftea . What would [he]122-soren ever have to say to [such a beautiful and elegant owl]864-such a beautiful and elegant owl ? Flying was one thing , but sitting and talking was another . [Soren]122-soren saw dozens of rosy - scaled blind snakes crawling up to the hollow where the harp was kept . Soon [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree would begin to awake and stir to the lovely harmonies of [Evensong]199-evensong . For twilight was upon [them]861-the only ones trained to sing .

Books of the Yonder

Class finally ended an hour before [First Black]138-first black . There was still time to go to [the library]599-the library . This was [Soren]122-soren and [Gyl - fie]189-gyl - fie ’s favorite place in [the old tree]874-the old tree . [The two young owls]875-the two young owls had a special fondness for libraries that went beyond the wonderful books that [they]875-the two young owls were now learning how to read . At [St. Aegolius Academy]47-st. aegolius academy , [the library]599-the library had been strictly off - limits to [everyone]311-everyone except for [Skench]169-skench and [Spoorn]201-spoorn , [the two brutal owls who ran [the orphanage]879-the orphanage]878-the two brutal owls who ran the orphanage .
