For [the two young owls]875-the two young owls libraries meant freedom in every way . Sometimes , [Soren]122-soren thought that libraries for [him]122-soren were a kind of Yonder , in the sense that [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver and other snakes spoke of the sky . The sky so far away for snakes , as far as anything could be , was a world unseen . But as [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie learned to read [they]875-the two young owls began to get glimmerings of worlds unseen .

The only problem with [the library]599-the library was the old Whiskered Screech , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . [He]191-ezylryb was always there , and [he]191-ezylryb was still as frightening as [he]191-ezylryb had been that day when [Soren]122-soren first saw [him]191-ezylryb in [the parliament]706-the parliament and felt [his]191-ezylryb squinted eye burning into [him]191-ezylryb . [The old bird]886-the old bird rarely spoke and when [he]191-ezylryb did it was in a low , growlish hoot . [He]191-ezylryb had a fondness for caterpillars and kept a store of dried ones for when they were out of season . These [he]191-ezylryb put in a little pile by [his]191-ezylryb desk in [the library]599-the library . It was not what [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb did say that [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie found unnerving , it was what [he]191-ezylryb did n’t . [He]191-ezylryb seemed to quietly observe everything even as [he]191-ezylryb read with [his]191-ezylryb one and a half eyes . Every once in a while [he]191-ezylryb emitted a low growl of what [they]888-they could only feel was disapproval . But worst of all was [his]191-ezylryb deformed foot . And although [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie knew it was impolite to stare , [their]888-they eyes just seemed drawn to that foot . [Soren]122-soren admitted to [Gylfie]125-gylfie that [he]122-soren could n’t help it , and [Gylfie]125-gylfie said that [she]125-gylfie [herself]125-gylfie was fearful of making a terrible slip .

“ Remember when [Matron]175-matron came in the other day to serve tea and [she]125-gylfie asked [me]122-soren to take the cup to [him]191-ezylryb and to ask if [he]191-ezylryb wanted [his]191-ezylryb usual with it — whatever that was . [I]122-soren was so afraid [I]122-soren was going to say something like , ‘ [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , [Matron]175-matron would like to know if [you]122-soren ’d like [your]122-soren tea with [your]122-soren usual fourth talon . ’ ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren laughed but [he]122-soren knew exactly what [Gylfie]125-gylfie meant .

There were , however , too many compelling reasons to go to [the library]599-the library . So [they]890-they went and learned to ignore [his]122-soren occasional growlish hoots , trying not to stare at [his]122-soren foot and trying to avoid the amber squint of [his]122-soren eye . [The library]599-the library was quite high in the great tree in a roomy hollow that was lined with books , and the floor was spread with lovely carpets woven of mosses , grasses , and occasional strands of down . When [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie entered , [they]890-they spotted [Ezyl - ryb]202-ezyl - ryb in [his]202-ezyl - ryb usual spot . There was the pile of caterpillars . Every now and then [he]202-ezyl - ryb would pluck one and munch it . [His]202-ezyl - ryb beak was now poked into a book titled Magnetic Properties as They Occur Naturally and Unnaturally in Nature .

[Soren]122-soren made [his]122-soren way toward a shelf that had books about [barns]892-barns and [churches]893-churches for , indeed , once upon a time [Barn Owls like [himself]122-soren]894-barn owls like himself had actually lived in such places and [Soren]122-soren enjoyed looking at the pictures and reading about them . [Some of [the churches]896-the churches]895-some of the churches were magnificent , with windows stained the colors of rainbows and stone spires that soared high into the sky . But [Soren]122-soren actually preferred [the simpler little wooden churches , neatly painted , with something called steeples for [their]897-the simpler little wooden churches , neatly painted , with something called steeples for their bells bells]897-the simpler little wooden churches , neatly painted , with something called steeples for their bells . [Gylfie]125-gylfie liked books with poems , funny riddles , and jokes . [She]125-gylfie went to see if a book [she]125-gylfie had discovered yesterday was still there , called Hooties , Cooties , and Nooties : A Book of Owl Humor with Recipes , Jokes , and Practical Advice . It was written by [Philom - ena Bagwhistle]203-philom - ena bagwhistle , a well - known nest - maid snake who had spent many years in service .

But just as [Gylfie]125-gylfie was about to pull the book from the shelf there was a low growl . “ [You]122-soren can do better than that , [young one]1686-young one . One day with that [Philomena Bagwhistle]204-philomena bagwhistle slop is quite ’nuff , I’dsay . Whyn’t try something a little weightier ? ”[125-gylfie]

“ Like what ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said in a small voice .

“ Try that one over there . ”[191-ezylryb] [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb raised [his]191-ezylryb foot , the one with three talons , and pointed .

[Soren]122-soren froze . [He]122-soren could not take [his]122-soren eyes off the talons . Was it a deformity that [he]122-soren had been born with , as some said , or had it been snapped off in a mobbing by crows ? The three talons raked the air as [he]122-soren pointed , and [Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s feathers automatically drooped as owl feathers do when they find themselves in conditions of fear . [The old owl]714-the old owl now got up from [his]714-the old owl desk , lurched toward the shelf , and pulled the book off using only one talon . [Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s and [Soren]122-soren ’s eyes were riveted on the talon . “ Look at the book , [idiots]1711-idiots , not [my]122-soren talons . Or , here , take a good look at the talons so [you]1711-idiots can get used to it . ”[122-soren] And [he]122-soren shook the deformed foot in [their]899-their faces . [The two owls]754-the two owls nearly fainted on the spot .

“ [We]754-the two owls ’re used to it , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren gasped .

“ Good . Now read the book , ”[191-ezylryb] [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb said .

[Gylfie]125-gylfie began sounding out the words , “ Tempers of [the Gizzard]150-gizzard : An Interpretative Physiology of This Vital Organ in Strigi - formes . ”[125-gylfie]

“ What are Strigiformes ? ”[122-soren] whispered [Soren]122-soren .

“ [Us]754-the two owls , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said softly . “ That ’s the fancy name for all owls , whether [we]754-the two owls ’re Elf Owls or [Barn Owls]135-barn owls or … ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie hesitated , “ a Whiskered Screech . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Right - o. Now go on , [the both of [you]1712-the both of you]1712-the both of you . Try something harder . Read it together . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren fixed [them]899-their in [his]122-soren amber squint . “ And [you]1712-the both of you can now quit wasting time thinking about [my]122-soren three talons . If [you]1712-the both of you want to see it again [you]1712-the both of you can . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren gave a little wave , and then with [his]122-soren odd gait made [his]122-soren way back to [his]122-soren desk , stopping on the way to poke the small fire in the grate .

[Soren]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie opened the book . Thank goodness there were lots of pictures but [they]899-their had a go at the first paragraph .

The gizzard is a most marvelous organ . Considered the second stomach in owls and often called the muscular stomach , it filters out indigestible items such as bone , fur , hair , feathers , and teeth . The gizzard compresses the indigestible parts into a pellet . The pellets are yarped through the beak . [ See footnote pertaining to identification of owl species through pellet analysis . ]

“ [I]122-soren think [we]901-we can skip the footnotes , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren whispered , hoping that [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb would n’t hear . “ This is boring enough as it is . ”[122-soren]

“ Oh , [I]125-gylfie always skip the footnotes , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ How many books with footnotes have [you]122-soren read , [Gyl]189-gyl - fie - fie ? ”[125-gylfie] [Soren]122-soren blinked in surprise .

“ One . It was about feather maintenance . But look . ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie pointed with [her]125-gylfie talon to the next paragraph .

Volumes have been written about the physical processes of the gizzard . But rarely do [we]901-we find much in the literature concerning the temper of this marvelous organ . This seems like a gross oversight . For do [we]901-we not attribute all of [our]901-we most profound feelings to the sensitivity of this muscular organ ? How many times a day does [an owl]295-an owl think , “ Oh , [I]295-an owl feel it in [my]295-an owl gizzard ? ”[295-an owl] When [we]901-we feel a strong passion , or perhaps trust , or even distrust , this is [our]901-we first reaction .

“ Well , that ’s the truth , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said . “ There ’s not much new in that . Hardly original . ”[122-soren]

“ Hold on , [Soren]122-soren . Look what [he]903-the immature owl says here . ”[122-soren]

[We]901-we do use [our]901-we gizzards as [our]901-we guide . [Our]901-we gizzards , indeed , do often navigate [us]901-we over treacherous emotional terrain . However , it is [my]0-i considered opinion that [the immature owl]903-the immature owl does not always know for certain [his]903-the immature owl gizzardly instincts . Why do so many break the one rule [[their]904-them parents]905-their parents tell [them]904-them never to break and try to fly too young , thus falling out of [nests]1547-nests ? Stubbornness . [They]904-them have blocked out certain subtle signals [their]904-them gizzards might be sending [them]904-them …

[Soren]122-soren looked up and saw [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb staring at [them]904-them . “ Why do [you]125-gylfie suppose [he]191-ezylryb ’s having [us]904-them read this , [Gylfie]125-gylfie ? ”[191-ezylryb]

“ [I]125-gylfie think [he]191-ezylryb ’s trying to send [us]904-them a message , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie replied .

“ What ? Do n’t be stubborn ? Open up [your]125-gylfie gizzard ? ”[191-ezylryb]

“ [I]904-them do n’t know , but it ’s almost time for night flight exercises . ”[904-them]

[They]904-them closed the book and then backed out of [the library]599-the library , making short little bobbing gestures to [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . “ Very interesting , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said . “ Thank [you]122-soren for the suggestion . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Yes , thank [you]122-soren , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said .

[Ezylryb]191-ezylryb said nothing . [He]191-ezylryb only coughed a ragged hoot and plucked another caterpillar from the pile .

“ [Great Glaux]131-glaux , [I]122-soren ’ll just die if [I]122-soren get tapped for the weather interpretation chaw . [I]122-soren mean , can [you]122-soren imagine having [Ezyl - ryb]202-ezyl - ryb as [[your]122-soren chaw leader]1713-your chaw leader ? “ [You]122-soren know if [you]122-soren get tapped for colliering , [you]122-soren automatically have to take weather interpretation and fly with [that chaw]1714-that chaw as well , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ Well , who wants to get tapped for colliering and get [their]1714-that chaw beaked singed , anyway ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren replied dejectedly .

“ [You]122-soren did n’t get it singed when [you]122-soren picked up the coal that [you]122-soren dropped on [that bobcat]1715-that bobcat . ”[122-soren]

“ [We]1716-we were all picking them up when [we]1716-we were burying [them]1714-that chaw . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Yeah , but [you]122-soren flew with [yours]122-soren ! ”[122-soren]

“ That was pure dumb luck . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Maybe , but if [you]122-soren do it properly [you]122-soren never get singed , and that ’s what [Bubo]197-bubo helps teach . It would be great to have [Bubo]197-bubo as [a chaw leader]1717-a chaw leader . ”[122-soren]

“ Yeah , but if [you]122-soren get [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb with [him]191-ezylryb , [I]125-gylfie would hardly call that a bargain . [I]125-gylfie think [Bubo]197-bubo only helps . [I]125-gylfie still do n’t see why [you]122-soren have to do weather with colliering . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Well , [you]122-soren have to fly into forest fires and pick up burning embers . And forest fires , [they]1719-they say , are like a weather system all by [themselves]1719-they . [You]122-soren have to know about the drafts and winds that the heat can cause . [I]122-soren heard [Bubo]197-bubo talking about it the other day . ”[122-soren]

[Soren]122-soren decided not to worry about it .

Just at that moment [Digger]126-digger came up . “ Ready for night flight , [Digger]126-digger ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked .

“ Yes . And [I]125-gylfie ’ve really improved . Much stronger , that ’s what [Boron]171-boron says . Wait until [you]122-soren see [me]125-gylfie . ”[125-gylfie]

CHAPTER FOURTEEN

Night Flight

The night flight was always fun . There was never any special purpose to it . It really was mostly recreational . [Boron]171-boron liked to get [all the newly arrived owls]908-all the newly arrived owls together with some of the other young owls in the blackness of the sky so [they]908-all the newly arrived owls could , as [he]909-he put it , “ Buddy up , tell a few jokes , yarp a few pellets , and hoot at the moon . ”[909-he]

“ So , [Twilight]123-twilight , ”[171-boron] [Boron]171-boron began . “ [I]171-boron ’ve got one that [you]123-twilight ’ll like . Did [you]123-twilight hear the story of [the wet pooper who was flying over [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere and hit a fish]1720-the wet pooper who was flying over hoolemere and hit a fish ? ”[171-boron]

[Otulissa]176-otulissa dropped back to where [Soren]122-soren was flying . “ [He]1720-the wet pooper who was flying over hoolemere and hit a fish ’s just too much , ”[176-otulissa] [she]176-otulissa muttered .

“ Who ’s too much ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren asked .

“ [[Our]1721-our king]1722-our king , [Boron]171-boron . [He]1720-the wet pooper who was flying over hoolemere and hit a fish ’s telling a wet poop joke . [I]122-soren think it ’s undignified for one of [his]1720-the wet pooper who was flying over hoolemere and hit a fish position . ”[122-soren]

[Soren]122-soren sighed . “ Give it a blow , [Otulissa]176-otulissa . ”[122-soren] This was not the most polite way for [an owl]295-an owl to say , “ A little less serious , please . ”[295-an owl]

“ Well , [I]122-soren sure hope [he]1720-the wet pooper who was flying over hoolemere and hit a fish does n’t head a chaw . [I]122-soren would find it most unpleasant . [You]176-otulissa know , tonight the tappings begin ? ”[122-soren]

“ [They]1723-they do ? ”[295-an owl]

“ Yes , and [I]122-soren just have a feeling in [my]122-soren gizzard that [I]122-soren ’m going to find ten nooties in [my]122-soren bedding down . ”[122-soren]

[Each chaw]1561-each chaw had symbolic objects that [the leader]912-the leader left in [a young owl]913-a young owl ’s bedding . Find ten nooties arranged in the pattern of the Great Glaux constellation when [you]914-you went to sleep at First Light , and that meant [you]914-you were in [the navigation chaw of [Strix Struma]187-strix struma]915-the navigation chaw of strix struma . A pellet was for the tracking chaw , a milkberry for the Ga’Hoology chaw . A molted feather was the symbol for the search - and - rescue chaw . A dried caterpillar was naturally for Ezylryb ’s weather chaw . A piece of coal and a caterpillar meant that [you]914-you had been picked for colliering and were by necessity in for double duty and required to fly with [the weather chaw]916-the weather chaw as well .

“ Do n’t [you]912-the leader have any feelings , [Soren]122-soren ? ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa asked .

“ [I]912-the leader prefer not to discuss [my]912-the leader gizzardly feelings , ”[912-the leader] [he]912-the leader replied almost primly .

“ Why not ? ”[181-primrose]

“ [I]176-otulissa do n’t know . [I]176-otulissa ’m just not comfortable doing it . [You]122-soren know [I]176-otulissa do n’t mean to be rude , [Otulissa]176-otulissa , but for someone so well bred [you]122-soren push awfully hard . ”[176-otulissa]

“ Well , honestly . ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa turned to [Primrose]181-primrose , who was flying rather noisily due to [her]181-primrose lack of plummels , the fringes at the edge of the flight feathers that helped owls fly in silence . “ Lucky [you]122-soren , ”[181-primrose] [Primrose]181-primrose sighed .

Great Glaux , [she]918-she ’s obnoxious , [Soren]122-soren thought . Simply to change the subject , [Soren]122-soren decided to ask [Otulissa]176-otulissa how [she]176-otulissa came to [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree .

“ When did [you]176-otulissa come [here]1419-here , [Otulissa]176-otulissa ? ”[176-otulissa]

“ It was during the time of the copper rose rain . [I]122-soren came from [Ambala]41-ambala . [You]1736-you might have heard that [Ambala]41-ambala suffered a great many egg snatchings because of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s patrols . [[My]122-soren mother]1636-my mother and [father]1738-father had lost two eggs this way and had gone out to see if [they]1739-they could find them , somehow . [I]122-soren could n’t fly yet , and do n’t for a minute think [I]122-soren was trying to . [I]122-soren was [a very obedient owlet]1743-a very obedient owlet . [I]122-soren was only looking over the edge for [Auntie]207-auntie , and [I]122-soren just fell . It ’s the honest truth . ”[122-soren]

Racdrops it is , [Soren]122-soren thought . [She]919-she was doing what many other owlets had tried to do , like [Gylfie]125-gylfie and dozens of others , trying to fly . [Soren]122-soren was taken aback . It was perhaps the nicest thing that [Otulissa]176-otulissa had ever said . [Otulissa]176-otulissa seldom thought of [herself]176-otulissa being like [anyone else]797-anyone else or sharing any traits , except with [the most elegant and distinguished of [[her]176-otulissa Strix ancestors]923-her strix ancestors]922-the most elegant and distinguished of her strix ancestors .

[Boron]171-boron had just clacked [his]924-his beak loudly , announcing that night flight was finished , and [he]924-his had spotted [Strix Struma]187-strix struma making [her]187-strix struma way upwind to take over for navigation class .

“ It will be a short class tonight , [young ones]1537-young ones , ”[920-my] [she]920-my announced upon arriving . “ For as [you]1537-young ones know , this is a special night , and [we]925-they want to be sure to get back before First Light . ”[920-my]

So , indeed , [they]925-they returned to [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree at that border of darkness that owls call the Deep Gray , when the black has faded but the sun has not yet spilled even the first sliver of a ray over the horizon . [Nobody]927-nobody really wanted tea . It all took too long and the nest snakes seemed unbearably slow as [they]928-they slithered in with the cups on [their]928-they backs . It was an unusually silent teatime . It was as if [everyone]311-everyone was too worried to speak , and there was absolutely no talk about feelings in [one ’s gizzard]930-one ’s gizzard . Even [Otulissa]176-otulissa had shut up .

“ No seconds , [anyone]394-anyone ? ”[128-mrs. p.] [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. said . “ [I]128-mrs. p. ’d be happy to go back and get some , and there are more nice little nootie cakes . ”[128-mrs. p.]

[Soren]122-soren saw [Otulissa]176-otulissa blink [her]176-otulissa eyes shut for the longest time . [He]122-soren knew exactly what [she]176-otulissa was thinking about : nooties , and not the ones that had been baked in a cake . No , [she]176-otulissa was thinking of ten nooties arranged in the figure of the Great Glaux constellation . [He]122-soren almost felt sorry for [her]176-otulissa .

Finally , the time came for good light . [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk would , of course , sing the beautiful good light song , and then [they]925-they were allowed to look into the down fluff and discover [their]925-they destinies . Usually , after [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk ’s song there was total silence , but there would not be tonight . Instead , there would be raucous shrieks mixed with some groans , and owls saying , “ [I]1697-others told [you]122-soren so . [I]1697-others knew [you]122-soren ’d get into that chaw . ”[1697-others] While [others]1697-others would be quietly thinking , How shall [I]0-i survive Ga’Hoolology with [that old bore of a Burrowing Owl]932-that old bore of a burrowing owl ?

[Soren]122-soren , [Digger]126-digger , [Twilight]123-twilight , and [Gylfie]125-gylfie went to [[their]925-they hollow]655-their hollow .

“ Well , good luck , [everybody]1759-everybody , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ Twilight , [I]126-digger really hope [you]1759-everybody get what [you]1759-everybody want . [I]126-digger know how much it means to [you]1759-everybody . ”[126-digger]

Suddenly , [Soren]122-soren realized that was [his]122-soren problem . [He]122-soren did n’t know what [he]122-soren wanted . [He]122-soren only knew what [he]122-soren did n’t want . [He]122-soren truly was [an immature owl with an immature gizzard]934-an immature owl with an immature gizzard .

[They]935-they each tucked into [their]935-they corners . The first chords from the great harp were plucked and then came the soft plings of [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk ’s eerily beautiful voice . All too quickly , the last verses of the song came up . [Soren]122-soren felt [his]122-soren heart quicken and a stirring in [his]122-soren gizzard .

Far away is First Black ,

But it shall seep back

Over field

Over flower

In the twilight hour .

[We]936-we are [home]1490-home in [[our]936-we tree]1572-our tree .

[We]936-we are owls , [we]936-we are free .

As [we]936-we go , this [we]936-we know

Glaux is nigh .

Then there were the sounds of owls burrowing into the downy fluff of [their]936-we beds and then the first gasps . “ A pellet ! ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger exclaimed . “ [I]126-digger got tracking chaw . [I]126-digger ca n’t believe it ! ”[126-digger]

From other hollows came more cries :

“ This iron tree is beautiful — great Glaux , [I]125-gylfie did get metals ! ”[125-gylfie]

“ A milkberry — oh , no ! ”[125-gylfie]

“ Ten nooties ! ! ! ! ”[125-gylfie] But the voice was not [Otulissa]176-otulissa ’s . It was [Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s . “ [Soren]122-soren , [I]125-gylfie ca n’t believe it . [I]125-gylfie did n’t think [Strix Struma]187-strix struma liked [me]125-gylfie that much , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie whispered as if [she]125-gylfie could n’t believe [her]125-gylfie great luck . And then there was silence as six pairs of yellow eyes turned to [Soren]122-soren . “ [Soren]122-soren , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said , “ what did [you]122-soren get ? ”[126-digger]

“ Not sure ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said . [They]939-they were all puzzled . How could [one]613-one not be sure ?

“ [I]125-gylfie have n’t looked yet . [I]125-gylfie ’m scared . ”[125-gylfie]

“ [Soren]122-soren , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said , “ just look . Get it over with . Come on . [It]1760-it ca n’t be so bad . ”[123-twilight]

Ca n’t be so bad ? [Soren]122-soren thought . No , of course , not for all of [you]941-you who got exactly what [you]941-you wanted .

“ Come on , [Soren]122-soren , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said in a softer voice . [She]125-gylfie had walked over to the pile of down where [Soren]122-soren slept . “ Come on . [Soren]122-soren sighed and , carefully , with one talon , plucked away the down fluff so as not to disturb anything . A dark lump poked through and beside it the shriveled body of a dried caterpillar .

“ Colliering ! ”[122-soren] the wail peeled out into the morning . But the voice was not that of [Soren]122-soren , who simply stared in disbelief at the piece of coal and the caterpillar . “ [I]176-otulissa ca n’t believe it . [I]176-otulissa ’m on colliering and weather chaws . Disaster ! ”[176-otulissa] The voice was that of [Otulissa]176-otulissa . [Great Glaux]131-glaux , [Soren]122-soren thought . As if things were n’t bad enough — [he]122-soren was now double chawed with [Otulissa]176-otulissa !

CHAPTER FIFTEEN

A Visit to [Bubo]197-bubo

One — two — one — two . That ’s it , [Ruby]208-ruby . Tuck the beak … one — two — one — two … ” This was [their]1761-them second chaw practice for colliering and [Soren]122-soren had never been more depressed , not since [his]122-soren horrible time at [St. Aggie ’s]124-st. aggie . [The colliering ryb]1762-the colliering ryb , a Great Gray named [Elvan]205-elvan , stood in the center of a circle that had been inscribed on the ground at the base of the tree . It was near [the forge where [Bubo]197-bubo worked , keeping [them]1761-them supplied with red - hot coals]1763-the forge where bubo worked , keeping them supplied with red - hot coals . [Elvan]205-elvan barked commands at [them]1761-them and insisted that [they]1761-them march in time as [he]122-soren kept count . [Soren]122-soren had a deep aversion to marching . [They]1761-them had been forced to march all the time at [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s . [Elvan]205-elvan said this marching was necessary to establish the proper rhythm that helped in holding a live coal in [their]1761-them beaks . And it seemed as if [his]122-soren previous experience with live coals in [the woods of [The Beaks]36-the beaks]1764-the woods of the beaks had deserted [him]122-soren . [He]122-soren could hardly believe that [he]122-soren had actually picked up live coals , buried them , and flown with [them]1761-them ! [Soren]122-soren had spent the first minutes of class being scared and the remainder being bored . If [anyone]394-anyone had told [him]122-soren that it was possible to be [both in the same practice]1766-both in the same practice , [he]122-soren would have said [they]1766-both in the same practice were yoicks . It was odd that [he]122-soren hardly felt the heat . [He]122-soren remembered thinking this before when [he]122-soren was in [the woods of [The Beaks]36-the beaks]1764-the woods of the beaks . [He]122-soren did notice , however , that [Elvan]205-elvan ’s fringe of light feathers below [his]122-soren beak seemed to be a permanently sooty gray .[208-ruby]

[Soren]122-soren thought of [his]122-soren own face , covered in pure white feathers . This was the most distinctive feature of [Barn Owls]135-barn owls , and [he]122-soren really did not want to think of it growing singed and sooty . Maybe [he]122-soren was vain but [he]122-soren could n’t help it .

“ Pay attention ! [Soren]122-soren ! ”[205-elvan] [Elvan]205-elvan barked . “ [You]122-soren nearly ran into [Otulissa]176-otulissa . ”[205-elvan]

Thank Glaux [she]942-she could n’t speak , thought [Soren]122-soren . That was the only good thing about colliering . It was hard to speak with a live coal in one ’s mouth . So [Otulissa]176-otulissa was effectively shut up for once .

“ All right , rest time . Drop [your]122-soren coals , ”[205-elvan] [Elvan]205-elvan announced .

Rest was n’t really rest , however , as [the ryb]869-the ryb lectured [them]944-we the entire time . “ Tomorrow [you]122-soren shall begin flying with the coals in [your]122-soren beaks . It is not that different , really , from walking . Although [you]122-soren must take care to keep [your]122-soren coal alive and burning . ”[869-the ryb]

“ Yeah ! ”[197-bubo] [Bubo]197-bubo boomed . “ Dead coals ai n’t going to do [me]197-bubo a bit of good , [young’uns]1365-young’uns . No sense flying in here with a great lot of ashes , cold as Glaux knows what . ”[197-bubo]

“ Yes , ”[205-elvan] continued [Elvan]205-elvan . “ [We]944-we do n’t want to disappoint [Bubo]197-bubo . ”[205-elvan]

“ Oh , [Glaux]131-glaux forbid that [we]944-we should disappoint [Bubo]197-bubo , ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa mumbled .

[Soren]122-soren stole a glance at [her]176-otulissa . There was pure venom in [her]176-otulissa eyes . Why could n’t [she]176-otulissa just be angry about being in [this chaw]945-this chaw ? What did [Bubo]197-bubo have to do with it ? [Soren]122-soren thought . [He]122-soren knew why , of course . [Otulissa]176-otulissa thought [she]176-otulissa was too good to have anything to do with [Bubo]197-bubo . Neither [Bubo]197-bubo nor [any of the owls in [this chaw]945-this chaw]946-any of the owls in this chaw had the distinguished background of [Otulissa]176-otulissa . It was an outrage , as [she]176-otulissa told [Soren]122-soren forty times a night , that [she]176-otulissa had not been included in [[Strix Struma]187-strix struma ’s navigation chaw]948-strix struma ’s navigation chaw .

[Elvan]205-elvan continued speaking during [their]949-we break . “ And then , of course , after [you]1769-you have had enough nights of weather training [we]949-we shall find a nice forest fire for [you]1769-you — nothing too big , mind [you]1769-you . Just a nice little beginning fire with a good mix of trees — Ga’Hooles , firs , pine , [some soft and hard woods]1770-some soft and hard woods . Not too many ridges or mountains to complicate wind patterns . ”[205-elvan]

“ Pardon [me]950-the little northern saw - whet owl , ”[950-the little northern saw - whet owl] piped up [the little Northern Saw - whet Owl]950-the little northern saw - whet owl , [Martin]209-martin , who had been rescued the same night as [Primrose]181-primrose .

“ Yes , [Martin]209-martin , ”[205-elvan] [Elvan]205-elvan said .

“ Well , [I]205-elvan do n’t understand why [we]949-we need new coals all the time . Once [you]1769-you start a fire going , would n’t there always be new coals ? ”[205-elvan]

This was [some smart little owl]951-some smart little owl , [Soren]122-soren thought . Why had n’t [the others]344-the others thought of this question ? Why were new coals from a new fire needed ?

[Elvan]205-elvan turned to [Bubo]197-bubo . “ [Bubo]197-bubo , as [chief smith]1771-chief smith , would [you]197-bubo care to answer that ? ”[205-elvan]

“ Sure thing , [mate]1772-mate . ”[197-bubo] Then [he]197-bubo stepped up to [Martin]209-martin and , towering over [him]209-martin , began to speak . “ A very good question . [You]205-elvan are right , it is very possible to keep fires going forever and that is fine for some things — things like cooking and warming up [a hollow]1773-a hollow . But for certain tasks , especially certain metalwork in [the forge]802-the forge , [we]949-we need new fresh coals that have been born of sparking trees full of sap . They become the blood of [our]949-we hottest fires . Then again , [we]949-we need a variety of coals . Certain coals from certain trees last longer . That ’s how a fire gets bonk . ”[197-bubo]

“ What ’s bonk ? ”[209-martin] asked [Martin]209-martin .

“ Ah , it ’s an old smithy term . Hard to explain unless [you]205-elvan ’ve been working with the fires for some time . Then [you]205-elvan know when [you]205-elvan got a bonking good fire going in [[your]205-elvan forge]1775-your forge . [You]205-elvan know [you]205-elvan got to look for the blue in the flame and then , this is the hardest , a tinge of green around the blue . ”[197-bubo]

[Soren]122-soren was impressed . Being [a blacksmith]953-a blacksmith was truly a complicated business . Even though [Bubo]197-bubo did not have the title of ryb , [Soren]122-soren thought [he]197-bubo must be very smart .

Soon , rest time was over , and [they]954-they were told to begin marching without [their]954-they coals to establish the rhythm again .

“ [I]176-otulissa simply ca n’t bear this a minute longer , ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa said .

“ [I]208-ruby think it ’s going to be great fun when [we]954-they can fly , ”[208-ruby] said [Ruby]208-ruby , [a ruddy - colored Short - eared Owl that [Soren]122-soren nearly bumped into]955-a ruddy - colored short - eared owl that soren nearly bumped into .

“ How can [you]208-ruby say that , [Ruby]208-ruby ? This is really not the appropriate chaw for [you]208-ruby , either , no more than for [me]176-otulissa . [You]208-ruby of all owls , with [your]208-ruby family background — [you]208-ruby should be in tracking . ”[176-otulissa]

“ Just because [[my]176-otulissa family]1478-my family nested on the ground does n’t mean [I]176-otulissa ca n’t try something new . ”[176-otulissa]

“ But [you]208-ruby fly low and slow ; that ’s good for tracking . ”[176-otulissa]

“ But [I]208-ruby ’ve never flown through a forest fire . And [I]208-ruby ca n’t wait until weather interpretation — a hurricane ! Just imagine flying through that . Life in [that ground nest]1777-that ground nest was boring . [We]1778-we were out there in [the grasslands]1779-the grasslands — every day just the same . The sound of the wind in the grass just the same , the way the grass moved just the same . Oh , yes . Sometimes it moved slower or faster , depending on the wind . But there was a terrible sameness . [I]208-ruby ca n’t believe how lucky [I]208-ruby am to be double chawed . ”[208-ruby] [Ruby]208-ruby sighed with pleasure .

[Soren]122-soren blinked . [He]122-soren wished [he]122-soren felt this way . [He]122-soren wanted to ask [Ruby]208-ruby if [she]208-ruby was nervous about [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , but at the same time [he]122-soren did n’t want to admit that [he]122-soren was . [Ruby]208-ruby was [a very tough little owl]956-a very tough little owl . [She]208-ruby had been brought in by search - and - rescue shortly after [Soren]122-soren had arrived . [She]208-ruby had not fallen from a nest , for indeed to fall out of a ground nest was virtually impossible . But something had scared [her]208-ruby so bad when [[her]208-ruby parents]1570-her parents were out hunting , [she]208-ruby had actually flown before [her]208-ruby primaries were fledged . [No one]880-no one was quite sure what had scared [her]208-ruby . [She]208-ruby had been found exhausted but perched in one of the few trees in [the grasslands]1779-the grasslands , declaring , “ [They]961-they ’ll never find [me]208-ruby here ! [They]961-they ’ll never believe that [an immature Short - eared]1780-an immature short - eared made it to here ! ”[208-ruby] But [no one]880-no one knew who [they]961-they were . And [Ruby]208-ruby never said .

Finally , chaw practice was over . [Soren]122-soren dreaded teatime . If it was like yesterday , [Twilight]123-twilight would be bragging about [his]123-twilight power dives and reverse spiral twists . [Gylfie]125-gylfie and [Digger]126-digger would both be talking about how exciting [their]961-they practices were , and [he]122-soren , [Soren]122-soren , would have nothing to say . Maybe [he]122-soren would skip tea . Just as [he]122-soren was having this thought , [Bubo]197-bubo waddled over to [him]122-soren .

“ It gets better , [Soren]122-soren . It really does . [I]197-bubo know this is tough for [you]122-soren . It was n’t the chaw that [you]122-soren wanted , but it ’s really an honor — double chawed and all . [I]197-bubo think [you]122-soren ’re the first Barn Owl ever to be . Come on now , [lad]1781-lad . Come with [me]197-bubo . Take tea in [the forge]802-the forge . [I]197-bubo got some fresh moles , [you]122-soren can have them raw or smoked — whatever takes [your]122-soren fancy , and [Cook]177-cook made a nice milkberry tart . ”[197-bubo]

So [Soren]122-soren followed [Bubo]197-bubo into a cave not far from [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]50-the great ga’hoole tree , which served as both [[Bubo]197-bubo ’s forge]962-bubo ’s forge and [home]1490-home . [Soren]122-soren had never been in [[Bubo]197-bubo ’s cave]964-bubo ’s cave before and , once one went deep enough into [the cave]432-the cave to escape the heat , it was quite comfortable — all fitted up with moleskin rugs and a surprising number of books . [Soren]122-soren had never taken [Bubo]197-bubo for a bookish sort of owl .

[He]122-soren could not help but think of [the dying Barred [Owl]155-owl ’s cave]966-the dying barred owl ’s cave and wondered if [that owl]967-that owl had been [a blacksmith]953-a blacksmith . But [a blacksmith]953-a blacksmith for what ? That owl had lived completely alone in [those woods]970-those woods . Somehow [Soren]122-soren did n’t feel comfortable talking to [Bubo]197-bubo about [the Barred Owl]463-the barred owl because it made [him]122-soren think of “ [you]197-bubo only wish . ”[953-a blacksmith]

“ What ’s this ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said as [he]122-soren spotted a contraption dangling from the ceiling of [the cave]432-the cave . It had bright - colored things swirling about , catching the reflections of the many lit candles . As the bright bits swirled , they cast spots of color all over [the cave]432-the cave .

“ Ah , [me]122-soren whirlyglass . [Plonk]183-madame plonk helped put it together for [me]122-soren . ”[122-soren]

“ [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren could n’t keep the surprise out of [his]122-soren voice . [He]122-soren had never heard [anyone]394-anyone refer to [her]975-her as simply “ [Plonk]183-madame plonk . ”[394-anyone]

“ Oh , yeah , [Plonk]183-madame plonk and [me]122-soren go back — way back . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren winked [his]122-soren eye . [He]191-ezylryb likes [you]122-soren to eat it raw with the fur on it . “ Oh , ”[122-soren] said [Soren]122-soren . “ But who ’s [Mags]122-soren ? ”[122-soren]

“ Oh , dear [me]122-soren , ai n’t [you]122-soren never heard of [Trader Mags]122-soren ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren shook [his]122-soren head . “ [I]122-soren forget , [you]122-soren only just got [here]1419-here a bit ago , did n’t [you]122-soren , and [Mags]122-soren , [I]122-soren guess , [she]1784-she has n’t been [here]1419-here since summer . ”[122-soren]

[Bubo]197-bubo pointed a talon at the whirlyglass . “ Those bright pieces came from what was called a window in something called [a church]1786-a church . ”[197-bubo]

“ [Castles]1792-castles — what ’s [a castle]1794-a castle ? ”[122-soren]

“ Well , it ai n’t [a church]1786-a church and it ai n’t [a barn]1796-a barn , but it ’s a big old fancy thing made from big stones , towers , walls , one of them things that [the Others]344-the others made . ”[197-bubo]

[Soren]122-soren had heard of [the Others]210-the others but [he]122-soren was never exactly sure what [the Others]344-the others were , except that [they]344-the others definitely were not owls , or birds , or really any other living thing that [he]122-soren had ever seen . “ Castles , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said dreamily . “ Sounds exciting , beautiful — very grand . ”[122-soren]

“ But [you]122-soren live in [a cave]1802-a cave . ”[122-soren]

“ That ’s different . ”[122-soren]

“ [I]122-soren do n’t see why . ”[122-soren]

[Plonkie]211-plonkie ! [Soren]122-soren thought , [They]978-they must have been close !

“ [Plonkie]211-plonkie has a weakness for all these colored bits and things . It did brighten it up , but [Soren]122-soren could n’t help but ask another question . “ Do n’t [you]122-soren miss living in a tree ? [I]122-soren mean , it ’s not like [you]122-soren were born [a Burrowing Owl]1400-a burrowing owl used to living in holes . Do n’t [you]122-soren miss the sky ? ”[122-soren]

[Soren]122-soren thought of [[his]122-soren own hollow]690-his own hollow that [he]122-soren shared with [Gylfie]125-gylfie and [Twilight]123-twilight and [Digger]126-digger . There was an opening just the shape of an owl ’s beak through which [they]981-they could glimpse the sky . So during the day there was always a pretty slice of blue in [[their]981-they hollow]655-their hollow and when [they]981-they came back from night flights before the dawn rose , it perfectly framed the last of the evening stars . [They]981-they could feel the wind and hear the stirring of the milkberry vines . [Soren]122-soren did not think [he]122-soren would like living in [a cave]1802-a cave .

“ [I]122-soren warn’t born [a Burrowing Owl]1400-a burrowing owl , that ’s the truth . [I]122-soren be a Great Horned , and it ai n’t customary for [any Great Horned]1815-any great horned to go about life in [a cave]1802-a cave . But [you]1817-you see , [I]122-soren be [a smith]1818-a smith . It ’s in [[my]122-soren gizzard]1416-my gizzard , this feeling for the metals . ”[122-soren] [He]122-soren gestured toward [his]122-soren bookshelf that indeed had many books about metals and forging . “ And [we]1818-a smith smiths , no matter if [we]1818-a smith ’re Great Grays or [Great Horneds]212-great horneds or [Snowies]213-snowies or [Spotted Owls]72-spotted owls , get these special feelings in [the old gizzard]1820-the old gizzard , [you]1817-you know . [We]1818-a smith fly , yes , [we]1818-a smith love the sky , but [we]1818-a smith is drawn to [the earth]253-the earth as well — not like [the Burrowing Owls]214-the burrowing owls , not the same thing at all . It be a strange and most peculiar force . It ’s as if all these years working with the iron , [we]1818-a smith get a bit of the magnet in [us]1818-a smith , [you]1817-you know . Like them special metals , [you]1817-you know , iron . It ’s got what [we]1818-a smith call a field . Well , [you]1817-you ’ll be learning this in metals class , in higher magnetics , where all the unseeable parts are lined up . It makes this force that draws [you]1817-you — same thing with [me]122-soren — [I]122-soren get drawn to the very earth from which them little flecks of iron come from . ”[122-soren]

“ Flecks ! ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren nearly screamed . [Flecks]215-flecks were part of [Soren]122-soren ’s worst memories from [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s .

“ What ’s a matter , [boy]1346-boy ? [You]1346-boy got ta yarp ? Go right ahead . [We]1818-a smith ai n’t formal around here . ”[122-soren]

“ At [St. Aggie ’s]124-st. aggie , [they]124-st. aggie made [us]1818-a smith pick apart pellets for bones and things and then something [they]124-st. aggie called ‘ flecks . ’ [Only first - degree pickers]1823-only first - degree pickers could pick for flecks . ”[122-soren]

“ [You]1346-boy do n’t say ? ”[122-soren] [Bubo]197-bubo blinked [his]197-bubo eyes .

“ But Gylfie and [I]122-soren never knew what flecks were . And , of course , [we]1818-a smith could never ask . But [we]1818-a smith did know they were kept in [the library]599-the library . ”[122-soren]

“ Odd place to keep iron . ”[122-soren]

“ Is that what flecks are — iron ? ”[122-soren]

“ Yes , in [their]124-st. aggie smallest bits , but better if [you]1346-boy can find a nice big hunk of iron ore , just like if [you]1346-boy can find a nice hunk of silver or gold in [a creek]386-a creek . The metals chaw brought [me]197-bubo back a very handsome piece of gold the other day . [You]1346-boy better fly on up to [[your]1346-boy hollow]1583-your hollow . A lot to do tomorrow . [Elvan]205-elvan thinks [you]1346-boy ’ll be ready to fly with the coals . [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran must think [you]1346-boy got something special . And [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , too . ”[197-bubo]

“ But why [me]197-bubo ? [I]197-bubo do n’t get it . [I]197-bubo ’m not that special . ”[197-bubo]

“ Oh , but [you]1346-boy are . [You]1346-boy had the mark on [you]1346-boy . ”[197-bubo]

“ The mark on [me]197-bubo ? What are [you]197-bubo talking about ? ”[197-bubo]

“ [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb spotted it . [None of the rest of [us]1831-us]1830-none of the rest of us could see it , of course . Ai n’t nothing to be ashamed of . Good Glaux , no ! Flew with one , maybe ? ”[197-bubo] [Bubo]197-bubo cocked [his]197-bubo head and looked quizzically at [Soren]122-soren .

“ [I]197-bubo did , but [I]197-bubo washed off the smudge . ”[197-bubo]

“ Ah , but [you]1346-boy still be marked . Only [none else]1833-none else can see it , except [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . [He]191-ezylryb ’s [a tough one]1834-a tough one , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . And smart ! Smartest owl in [the whole place]1835-the whole place . [He]191-ezylryb would n’t just choose any old owl . [He]191-ezylryb wanted [you]122-soren , mark or no mark . So [you]122-soren be all [you]122-soren can be , [Soren]122-soren . ”[197-bubo]

Be all [you]122-soren can be . What exactly did that mean ? Especially when [he]122-soren was n’t even sure what [he]122-soren wanted to be , except not in a double chaw with [Otulissa]176-otulissa and have [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb as [his]122-soren ryb . [Soren]122-soren kept thinking of [Bubo]197-bubo ’s words long after [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk ’s song had ended , and [Twilight]123-twilight and [Gylfie]125-gylfie and [Digger]126-digger were asleep . Or at least [he]122-soren thought so . But just then [he]122-soren heard the slightly raspy voice of [Digger]126-digger curling through the milky light that slipped in through the opening of [their]984-their hollow .

“ [Soren]122-soren , are [you]122-soren all right ? ”[126-digger]

“ Yeah , why ? ”[126-digger]

“ [I]126-digger ’m just worried about [you]122-soren . [I]126-digger mean , [you]122-soren ’ve been so quiet since the tapping , and [you]122-soren did n’t come to tea , and all . ”[126-digger]

“ Well , do n’t worry , [Digger]126-digger , it ’s not [your]122-soren problem . ”[126-digger]

“ But it is . ”[126-digger]

“ No , it ’s not , [Digger]126-digger . [You]122-soren worry too much . [You]122-soren just need to worry about [yourself]122-soren . Not [me]126-digger . That ’s not [your]122-soren job . ”[126-digger]

“ It ’s not a job , [Soren]122-soren , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said with a slight edge in [his]126-digger voice . “ It is what [I]126-digger am . ”[126-digger]

“ Now what do [you]122-soren mean by that ? ”[126-digger]

“ Well , [you]122-soren might think [I]126-digger ’m only [a Burrowing Owl]1400-a burrowing owl , [you]122-soren know , perfect for tracking with [my]126-digger long strong legs , but [I]126-digger am more than just this bunch of feathers and bare legs . [I]126-digger ca n’t explain it . [I]126-digger just feel things . And right now [I]126-digger am feeling very sorry , very bad for [you]122-soren . ”[126-digger]

[Soren]122-soren blinked . [He]122-soren thought about what [Digger]126-digger had just said . It made [him]122-soren think of [his]122-soren conversation with [Bubo]197-bubo , who had , in a sense , said the same thing . When [he]122-soren asked [Bubo]197-bubo why [he]197-bubo lived in [a cave]1802-a cave , [he]197-bubo said that [he]197-bubo was not simply [a Great Horned Owl]986-a great horned owl . In other words , [Bubo]197-bubo , like [Digger]126-digger , was not just a bunch of feathers on a pair of legs , weak or strong , with a pair of wings . [He]197-bubo was something more , and it was this that had drawn [him]197-bubo to [a cave in [the earth to live]988-the earth to live]987-a cave in the earth to live , closer to [the metals [he]197-bubo knew and worked with]989-the metals he knew and worked with . Maybe this was what [Bubo]197-bubo had meant when [he]197-bubo told [Soren]122-soren to be all [he]197-bubo could be . Maybe it had something to do with [an owl]295-an owl ’s true nature that went beyond [his]991-his or [her]992-her species as a Barn Owl or [a Burrowing Owl]1400-a burrowing owl . [Soren]122-soren ’s head swirled with these confusing thoughts .

Then [Digger]126-digger asked a truly astounding question . “ [Soren]122-soren , what do [you]122-soren think it means to be [an owl]295-an owl ? ”[126-digger]

“ [I]126-digger do n’t know . [I]126-digger mean , [I]126-digger ’m not sure what [you]126-digger mean . ”[126-digger]

“ [I]126-digger ’m not sure , either , ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger said . “ But it ’s just as if it is so easy to describe [us]1838-we . [You]122-soren know , there are so many things that [we]1838-we have that are different from other birds , but do [you]122-soren really think that is the meaning of being [an owl]295-an owl ? Just because [our]1838-we heads can spin nearly all the way around , that [we]1838-we can see what other birds can not at night , that [we]1838-we fly slow and silent — is it just these differences that make [us]1838-we owls ? ”[126-digger]

“ [Digger]126-digger , why do [you]126-digger ask these questions ? They ’re impossible to answer . ”[126-digger]

“ Maybe that ’s why [I]126-digger ask [them]1840-them — because they are impossible to answer . It ’s kind of exciting . [You]122-soren see — that is why [I]126-digger know [I]126-digger am much more than strong legs and weak wings . And [you]122-soren are , too , [Soren]122-soren — [you]122-soren are more than [your]122-soren lovely white face and [your]122-soren sharp ears that can hear anything and [your]122-soren strange black eyes . ”[126-digger]

[Digger]126-digger was [a curious owl]994-a curious owl . There was certainly no doubt about it . [Soren]122-soren looked out the opening into the last of the morning as it began to blare into the lightness of midday . If , indeed , what [Digger]126-digger said was true — that there were unexpected truths and meanings to be found , [Soren]122-soren wondered what that might mean for [him]122-soren . [He]122-soren looked at [[his]122-soren friends]661-his friends sleeping peacefully now : [Twilight]123-twilight , huge , a luminous silvery gray in the morning light ; [Gylfie]125-gylfie , like a little dusty smudge not much longer than one of [Twilight]123-twilight ’s talons ; and [Digger]126-digger , [his]126-digger peculiar , featherless legs , long and sinewy , [his]126-digger stubby tail , and [his]126-digger rather flattish head .

[Soren]122-soren remembered when , in anticipation of going to [the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]259-the great ga’hoole tree , [he]122-soren and [Gylfie]125-gylfie imagined it as just the opposite of [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s , but it was really much more . And maybe [he]122-soren could become more , too . The beak - shaped opening in [the hollow]372-the hollow flared white in the noonday sun as [Soren]122-soren finally fell asleep .

CHAPTER SEVENTEEN

Weather Chaw

A sliver of wet ice hit [Soren]122-soren ’s face and woke [him]122-soren up abruptly . Outside [the hollow]372-the hollow , the wind shrieked and a gale raged .

“ [Great Glaux]131-glaux , it ’s a mess out there , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight muttered .

“ It ’s cold , too , ”[125-gylfie] said [Gylfie]125-gylfie , [her]125-gylfie tiny body shivering .

“ Hop under here , ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said , and spread one of [his]123-twilight enormous wings so that it touched the other side of [the hollow]372-the hollow and knocked [Digger]126-digger from [his]126-digger bed .

“ [Twilight]123-twilight ! ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger complained . “ Watch it with that wing . ”[126-digger]

“ [Gylf]184-gylf is cold . ”[125-gylfie]

“ [I]125-gylfie sure hope [they]455-the owls will serve something hot for breakfast , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said through [her]125-gylfie clattering beak .

“ [Me]123-twilight , too , ”[123-twilight] said [Twilight]123-twilight .

[The owls]455-the owls got up and crept from [their]455-the owls hollow out onto a madly shaking branch and took off for [the dining hollow]810-the dining hollow . There was acorn porridge and steaming cups of milkberry tea , roasted tree slugs and braised mice . But as [Soren]122-soren headed for [[his]122-soren place at [Mrs. Plithiver ’s]120-mrs. plithiver]1021-his place at mrs. plithiver ’s , a voice scratched the air .

“ Over here , [boy]1346-boy . [Weather chaw]1896-weather chaw eats it raw with the hair on . ”[191-ezylryb] It was the unmistakable voice of [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb .

“ What ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren beaked the word in disbelief .

“ [You]176-otulissa mean [you]176-otulissa have n’t heard ? ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa was suddenly beside [him]122-soren .

“ Heard what ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said , not sure if [he]122-soren really wanted to know .

“ [We]455-the owls ’re having [our]455-the owls first weather interpretation chaw tonight . ”[122-soren]

“ [You]176-otulissa have to be kidding , [Otulissa]176-otulissa . [We]455-the owls are n’t going out in this gale . ”[122-soren]

“ Oh , but [we]455-the owls are , ”[176-otulissa] [she]176-otulissa said . “ And [I]176-otulissa think it ’s outrageous . [I]176-otulissa ’m going to have a word with [Strix Struma]187-strix struma . [I]176-otulissa ’ll go right up to [Barran]172-barran if [I]176-otulissa have to . This is reckless . This is endangering [our]455-the owls lives . ”[176-otulissa]

“ Oh , hush up , [dearie]1666-dearie . Sit down and eat [your]1666-dearie mouse — and all the hair , mind [you]1666-dearie , and that goes for [every one of [you]1666-dearie]1898-every one of you . ”[122-soren] It was the fat old blind snake named [Octavia]218-octavia , who had served as [the weather chaw table]1022-the weather chaw table for years . Unlike the other blind snakes whose scales were colors varying from rose to pink to a deep coral , [Octavia]218-octavia was a pale greenish - blue . [Soren]122-soren sat next to [Martin]209-martin , [the smart little Northern Saw - whet who had asked the question in colliering practice about the need for fresh coals]1023-the smart little northern saw - whet who had asked the question in colliering practice about the need for fresh coals . Indeed , [Soren]122-soren realized suddenly that there was more room at the table than [he]122-soren was accustomed to and as [he]122-soren looked about [he]122-soren knew it was because all of the young owls in the weather chaw seemed to have diminished in size . [Their]1024-their feathers were pulled , in tightly indications that the owls were very nervous about [their]1024-their first weather flight . When relaxed , [an owl]295-an owl ’s plumage is loose and fluffy . When angered , [owls]1480-owls can puff up [their]1480-owls feathers until they appear much , much larger . But now it was as if [they]1480-owls had all become suddenly slim . The tension hovered in the air .

[Ezylryb]191-ezylryb fixed the young owls in the amber light of [his]191-ezylryb squinted eye . “ Eat up , [maties]1899-maties … every single little hair . [You]1666-dearie ’ve forgotten what raw meat tastes like with the fur , as [you]1666-dearie call it . [Poot]219-poot here is [[my]191-ezylryb first mate]1900-my first mate . [He]1900-my first mate ’ll tell [you]1666-dearie what it ’s like to fly with no ballast in [your]1666-dearie gizzard . ”[191-ezylryb]

“ [I]219-poot remember that time before [I]219-poot had acquired the taste for hair and thought [I]219-poot could go through that hurricane . Last time [I]219-poot ever tried that . Nearly got caught in the rim of the eye , [I]219-poot did . Now , [you]1666-dearie do n’t want to do that , [young’uns]1365-young’uns . ”[219-poot] [Poot]219-poot was [a Boreal [Owl]155-owl like [Soren]122-soren and [[Gylfie]125-gylfie ’s old friend]1028-gylfie ’s old friend [Grimble]154-grimble]1027-a boreal owl like soren and gylfie ’s old friend grimble .

“ What happens if [you]1666-dearie get caught in the rim of the eye of a hurricane ? ”[220-rudy] asked [Rudy]220-rudy .

“ Oh , [you]1666-dearie spin around till [you]1666-dearie ’re dead . Just around and around and around . Awful nasty way to go . Usually get [your]1666-dearie wings torn off in the process , ”[219-poot] said [Poot]219-poot .

“ Now , do n’t go scaring [them]1029-we , [Poot]219-poot , ”[218-octavia] [Octavia]218-octavia said and gave a ripple so that all [their]1029-we plates clattered a bit . “ And please , [young’uns]1365-young’uns , do n’t try that trick of slipping the fur under the table . Remember , [I]218-octavia am the table and it itches something fierce . ”[218-octavia]

It was not even dark yet , but the weather chaw owls were already on the takeoff limb . It was all [they]1029-we could do to hang on as the gale lashed about [them]1029-we and the limb bucked in the turbulent wind . Shards of ice flew through the air .

“ [We]1029-we take off upwind , naturally . ”[191-ezylryb] Although [Soren]122-soren was not sure in this gale which way upwind even was . “ [We]1029-we ’re going to fly straight out over [the Sea of Hoolemere]33-the sea of hoolemere . Try to find the main part of the gale . ”[191-ezylryb] [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb spoke in short snappish sentences . “ Now listen up . Here ’s what [you]1666-dearie need to know about a gale , or any storm , really — except for hurricanes — [they]1903-they be a little different with [their]1903-they eyes and all . But what [you]1666-dearie got in a gale , or storm , is [you]1666-dearie got [your]1666-dearie gutter . That ’s what [we]1029-we call the main trough where the wind runs its punch through . It ’s at the center . It not be like the eye in a hurricane . Not nearly so dangerous . Then on either side of the gutter [you]1666-dearie ’ve got the scuppers . That ’s where the edge of the winds from the gutters spills over . Then at the very outside edge of [the scuppers]1904-the scuppers [you]1666-dearie got [your]1666-dearie swillages — more about them later . [I]191-ezylryb fly point . [Poot]219-poot flies what [we]1029-we call [upwind scupper]77-upwind scupper . [You]1666-dearie just follow behind . Do what [you]1666-dearie ’re told . Any questions ? ”[191-ezylryb]

[Otulissa]176-otulissa raised [her]176-otulissa talon . “ [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , [sir]1421-sir , with all due respect , [I]176-otulissa have to say that [I]176-otulissa am surprised that [we]1029-we are going out before it is completely dark . Is n’t there a very real danger that in this light [we]1029-we could be mobbed by crows ? ”[176-otulissa]

[Ezylryb]191-ezylryb began to laugh and then said , “ With all due respect , [Otulissa]176-otulissa , [no one else]1906-no one else is yoicks enough to be out on a day like this ! ”[191-ezylryb]

[Soren]122-soren could n’t help but laugh . But how could [he]122-soren be laughing when [he]122-soren was scared to death ? Then again , how could [he]122-soren have been bored in colliering chaw when [he]122-soren was also scared ? If this was being all one could be , as [Bubo]197-bubo had told [him]122-soren , [he]122-soren certainly had a lot of confusing feelings .

And then , suddenly , with an enormous scream , [the old Whiskered Screech Owl]188-the whiskered screech spread [his]188-the whiskered screech wings and lifted into the ice - spun twilight .

[They]1030-they flew straight out over [the Sea of [Hoolemere]23-hoolemere]254-the sea of hoolemere . The storm was so fierce and the torrents of sleeting rain so thick [they]1030-they could barely see the water , but [they]1030-they did hear the crashing waves . [Otulissa]176-otulissa was flying near [Soren]122-soren .

“ [I]176-otulissa have never heard of [a ryb who used such poor judgment]1907-a ryb who used such poor judgment . This is so irresponsible . [I]176-otulissa am going to have to speak with [Boron]171-boron and [Barran]172-barran . [I]176-otulissa can not believe that [they]1030-they would approve of this . ”[176-otulissa]

[Soren]122-soren , meanwhile , could not believe that [Otulissa]176-otulissa could fly through this mess and still keep talking . It took all of [his]122-soren concentration just to fly . The winds seemed to come from every direction . [They]1030-they were constantly buffeted by confused drafts . [Martin]209-martin , the little Saw - whet , was a tumbling blur ahead of [him]122-soren . [He]209-martin had been instructed , as [the smallest]1032-the smallest , to begin flying in [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb ’s wake for better control .

One minute the owls might be buoyed up several hundred feet and the next [they]1030-they might fly into a dead fall , a kind of hole in the wind , and drop . And , of course , there was the ice and rain . Constantly , [Soren]122-soren was having to use the transparent eyelid , the third eyelid that all owls have , to clear out the debris . [Great Glaux]131-glaux , [he]122-soren hoped [his]122-soren third lid did n’t simply wear out under these conditions . No wonder [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb squinted . A lifetime of flying into this stuff would be enough to shred any owl ’s eyelid .

“ Oh , for [Glaux]131-glaux ’s sake , ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa hissed .

“ What now ? ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said , trying to anticipate the next dead fall , almost hoping for it , to get away from [Otulissa]176-otulissa .

“ [He]191-ezylryb is speaking with seagulls ! ”[122-soren]

“ So ? ”[122-soren]

“ So ? How can [you]122-soren say ‘ so , ’ [Soren]122-soren ? [I]122-soren know [you]122-soren come from [a very fine family]1908-a very fine family . [I]122-soren can see that [you]122-soren have been well brought up . [You]122-soren must know that seagulls are the absolute worst kind of bird . [They]1909-them are , pardon the coarseness of [my]122-soren language , the scum of [the avian world]1910-the avian world . Trashy , loud . [You]122-soren want nothing to do with [them]1909-them . And look , there [he]191-ezylryb is talking — laughing with [them]1909-them . ”[122-soren]

“ Maybe [he]191-ezylryb ’s getting weather information from [them]1909-them , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said .

“ Oh , now that ’s a thought , ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa said and was quiet for several seconds , an amazing occurrence in and of itself . “ [I]176-otulissa think [I]176-otulissa ’ll fly up and ask [him]191-ezylryb . ”[176-otulissa]

“ Do n’t bother [him]191-ezylryb , [Otulissa]176-otulissa . ”[122-soren]

“ No , [you]122-soren heard [him]191-ezylryb say if [we]1911-we had any questions [we]1911-we should ask . ”[176-otulissa] So off [she]176-otulissa flew .

“ Pardon [me]122-soren , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . [I]122-soren am most curious to know why [you]191-ezylryb were — how shall [I]122-soren put it — consorting with seagulls ? [I]122-soren thought perhaps it was to gain weather information . ”[122-soren]

“ [Seagulls]221-seagulls ? Oh , no , [darlin ’]1912-darlin ’ . [They]221-seagulls are the dumbest birds on [earth]370-earth and the laziest . ”[122-soren]

“ Well , then why would [you]191-ezylryb even consort with [them]221-seagulls ? ”[122-soren]

“ [I]122-soren was n’t consorting . [I]122-soren was telling dirty jokes . ”[122-soren]

“ What ? ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa gasped .

“ Yes , [they]221-seagulls love wet poop jokes even though they are the wettest of all poopers . ‘ Oh , tell [us]1911-we another one [Ezyl]202-ezyl - ryb , ’ [they]221-seagulls always say ! And , [I]176-otulissa must admit , [I]176-otulissa get a few from [them]221-seagulls . But the blasted birds are so dumb , half the time [they]221-seagulls ca n’t remember the punch lines . “ Well , [I]176-otulissa never ! ”[176-otulissa]

“ The jokes were really funny , [Otulissa]176-otulissa , ”[176-otulissa] [Martin]209-martin , [the Northern Saw - whet]1033-the northern saw - whet , piped up .

“ Now , do n’t go getting [your]176-otulissa feathers in a twist , [darlin ’]1912-darlin ’ . [You]176-otulissa just mind [your]176-otulissa own business . Get back into position . [We]1915-we ’re getting near the gutter now . And this is when the fun begins . ”[176-otulissa]

“ Hoooh - hah ! ”[219-poot] [Poot]219-poot let out an enormous , raucous hoot . “ Here [we]1915-we go , [mates]1393-mates . Climbing the baggywrinkles and then straight into the gutter . Follow [us]1915-we ! ”[219-poot] The baggywrinkles were the shredded air currents that lay between the scuppers and the gutter . A power thrust was required to get over them . [Soren]122-soren banked and followed [the veteran owl]1034-the veteran owl , [Poot]219-poot . [Martin]209-martin was in between [the two]1035-the two . [The tiny owl]1036-the tiny owl would get a boost from [Poot]219-poot ’s speed , as a vacuum would be created , through which [he]1034-the veteran owl could be sucked up and over the baggywrinkles right into the gutter . [Ruby]208-ruby was just ahead of [him]1034-the veteran owl . [She]208-ruby let escape a small joyous hoot . And then , suddenly , [Soren]122-soren knew why . Here , at the center of the gale , in the gutter , the winds all seemed to flow like [one great turbulent river]1037-one great turbulent river . And if one let [one]613-one ’s wings sweep slightly forward , just as [Ruby]208-ruby was doing , and angled the tail — well , it was a wonderful sensation , a cross between soaring and gliding — no effort at all . And in the gutter , the ice shards seemed to melt away .

“ Oh , tickle [me]191-ezylryb hollow bones . Ai n’t this the life ! ”[191-ezylryb] It was [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , who had dropped back from the point position and now flew between [Soren]122-soren and [Otulissa]176-otulissa . [He]191-ezylryb yarped a pellet into the river of wind that flowed about [them]1035-the two . “ Now follow [me]191-ezylryb to the edge of the scuppers , [maties]1899-maties , and [I]191-ezylryb ’ll show [you]122-soren the hurly - burly . And then [we]1035-the two ’ll climb the baggywrinkles and dump right into the scuppers for the ride of [your]122-soren life . ”[191-ezylryb]

“ What is [he]191-ezylryb talking about ? ”[176-otulissa] huffed [Otulissa]176-otulissa . “ [He]191-ezylryb should have given [us]1035-the two a vocabulary list . [He]191-ezylryb ’s very disorganized as [a teacher]1918-a teacher . ”[176-otulissa]

Why would a vocabulary list matter ? [Soren]122-soren thought . What was the use of a word if one could not feel the action in [his]1039-his gizzard ? And right now [Soren]122-soren ’s gizzard was in a fantastic quiver of excitement . This was flying as [he]122-soren had never known it .

“ Here [we]1035-the two go ! ”[191-ezylryb] cried [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . “ Now [I]191-ezylryb want to see [you]122-soren punch the wind and then [we]1035-the two pop the scuppers and it ’s tail over talons . ”[191-ezylryb]

“ Oh , [my]176-otulissa heavens ! ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa shrieked and [Soren]122-soren gasped as [he]122-soren saw the distinctive three - taloned foot of [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb scratch the moon - smudged sky . [He]191-ezylryb was flying on [his]191-ezylryb back ! Then right side up and in the scuppers .

Suddenly , [Soren]122-soren saw a red blur as [Ruby]208-ruby did a talons - over - tail somersault and popped the scuppers to join [him]122-soren . “ Oh , come on ! ”[208-ruby] [she]208-ruby cried . “ There ’s nothing to it . ”[208-ruby]

“ Nothing to it . Who ’s ever heard of an owl flying upside down ? [I]176-otulissa think there ’s something most unsavory about it ! ”[176-otulissa] [Otulissa]176-otulissa gasped . “ It ’s reckless , unsafe — yes , unsavory , unsafe , un - owl . ”[176-otulissa]

Oh , shut up ! [Soren]122-soren thought and punched the wind just as [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb said , and in a flash [he]191-ezylryb was arcing up toward the sky that spun with dark clouds and was splattered with sheets of icy rain , and then [he]191-ezylryb was right side up in the scuppers next to [Ruby]208-ruby .

“ Push forward a bit with [your]122-soren talons and keep angling [your]122-soren tail . It gives [you]122-soren a lot of control and [you]122-soren can ride the waves , ”[191-ezylryb] [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb called back .

Finally , [Otulissa]176-otulissa arrived , sputtering with rage and talking about a report that [she]176-otulissa was going to make about “ this outrageous activity . ”[176-otulissa]

“ Oh , shut [your]122-soren beak ! ”[219-poot] [Poot]219-poot screeched at [her]176-otulissa . And then [they]1040-they skidded and spun , doing what was called the hurly - burly . In the scuppers , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb began to squawk a raucous ditty into the teeth of the gale .

[We]1041-we are the owls of the weather chaw .

[We]1041-we take it blistering ,

[We]1041-we take it all .

Roiling boiling gusts ,

[We]1041-we ’re the owls with the guts .

For blizzards [our]1041-we gizzards

Do tremble with joy .

An ice storm , a gale , how [we]1041-we love blinding hail .

[We]1041-we fly forward and backward ,

Upside down and flat .

Do [we]1041-we flinch ? Do [we]1041-we wail ?

Do [we]1041-we skitter or scutter ?

No , [we]1041-we yarp one more pellet

And fly straight for the gutter !

Do [we]1041-we screech ? Do [we]1041-we scream ?

Do [we]1041-we gurgle ? Take pause ?

Not on [your]1042-you life !

For [we]1041-we are the best

Of the best of the chaws !

CHAPTER EIGHTEEN

Mrs. Plithiver ’s Dilemma

Flying upside down ! ” [Primrose]181-primrose gasped . “[1043-you] How do [you]1043-you do that ? It ’s impossible . ”[1043-you]

“ It ’s not as hard as [you]1043-you think , ”[122-soren] [Soren]122-soren said excitedly . “ It really does n’t take that much skill . It ’s kind of like when [you]1042-you first start to fly . [You]1042-you have to just sort of believe [you]1042-you can do it . ”[122-soren]

“ But upside down ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said .

“ Do [you]1043-you think [a big burly Gray like [me]123-twilight]1919-a big burly gray like me could do it ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said .

“ Sure , if the conditions are right . See , that ’s the problem — [you]1042-you ca n’t try it until [you]1042-you ’re in the gutter of a gale . ”[123-twilight]

“ Gutter of a gale ? ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight said . “ [You]1043-you telling [me]123-twilight [a gale]1920-a gale has a gutter ? Now , [I]123-twilight ’ve seen a lot but … ”[123-twilight] It was hard for [Twilight]123-twilight to admit that [anyone]394-anyone had seen or experienced something [he]123-twilight had not .

[Gylfie]125-gylfie and [Soren]122-soren looked at [each other]291-each other and blinked in amazement . [Twilight]123-twilight did brag , but [he]123-twilight did not have that obnoxious sense of superiority that [Otulissa]176-otulissa had . Still , [he]123-twilight was constantly getting reprimanded in [his]123-twilight chaw practices for challenging [the rybs]781-the rybs . Sometimes [he]123-twilight could be annoying but , in spite of this , [he]123-twilight was [a “ good soul]1921-a “ good soul , ”[128-mrs. p.] as [Mrs. P.]128-mrs. p. would put it . There was never an owl more fiercely loyal than [Twilight]123-twilight . As [Digger]126-digger often said , “ [He]123-twilight makes [the best friend]1922-the best friend and the worst enemy . ”[126-digger]

“ [You]123-twilight might not have seen the gutter of a gale , ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie said , trying to restrain the peevish note in [her]125-gylfie voice . “ [I]125-gylfie know [you]123-twilight ’ve seen a lot , [Twilight]123-twilight , but it is possible that [you]123-twilight have not penetrated a gale in the same manner [Soren]122-soren did , under the instruction of [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Oh , [I]125-gylfie ’ve flown into the teeth of many a gale , [Gylf]184-gylf . [I]125-gylfie might have been in the gutter and not known [I]125-gylfie was there . That [I]125-gylfie admit . [Soren]122-soren here , talking about all this structure of a gale business — just words , [you]123-twilight know . No offense , mind [you]123-twilight , [Soren]122-soren . But [you]123-twilight can fly through something and not know what it ’s called . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Yes , [I]125-gylfie think [you]123-twilight ’re right . [Otulissa]176-otulissa was making a big fuss about how [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb should have given [us]1923-we a vocabulary list before [we]1923-we took off last night . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Oh , honestly , ”[181-primrose] [Primrose]181-primrose muttered , “ was there ever a duller owl ? ”[181-primrose]

“ Well , [I]125-gylfie am going to [the library]599-the library because that ’s part of [our]1923-we assignment now — to read up on the structure of gales and blizzards and hurricanes . But [I]125-gylfie ’m glad [we]1923-we flew it first . [I]125-gylfie think it will have more meaning . [We]1923-we ’re supposed to have a test soon . ”[125-gylfie]

“ A flying test or a book test ? ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie asked .

“ Book test . [I]125-gylfie promised to help [Ruby]208-ruby . [She]208-ruby ’s a fantastic flier but [she]208-ruby has a hard time with book things — reading and writing . ”[125-gylfie]

“ Believe [me]123-twilight , as long as [she]208-ruby can fly that ’s what counts . ”[123-twilight] [Twilight]123-twilight nodded .

“ [The grand old sage of [the Orphan School of Tough Learning]408-the orphan school of tough learning]1925-the grand old sage of the orphan school of tough learning ! ”[125-gylfie] [Gylfie]125-gylfie muttered .

[Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver gave a slight flinch as [she]120-mrs. plithiver often did when [she]120-mrs. plithiver heard an unkind remark at [her]120-mrs. plithiver tea table . It was then that [Soren]122-soren realized that [Mrs. Plithiver]120-mrs. plithiver had barely said a word during the entire teatime . This was most unusual , especially since [he]122-soren had come back so excited from weather chaw . Normally , [she]120-mrs. plithiver would have been thrilled over [Soren]122-soren ’s enthusiasm . [He]122-soren hoped nothing was the matter . If there was time before good light , after [he]122-soren went to [the library]599-the library , [he]122-soren would go visit [her]120-mrs. plithiver .

[Soren]122-soren flew up to [the library]599-the library humming happily the last verse of the weather chaw song . How quickly life changes , [he]122-soren thought . It was only yesterday that [he]122-soren had returned from walking around with a live coal in [his]122-soren beak , thinking that life could not be much worse — unless , of course , [he]122-soren was in [St. Aggie]124-st. aggie ’s picking pellets in the pelletorium . And now [he]122-soren was [a member of the best of the best of the chaws]1049-a member of the best of the best of the chaws .

When [he]122-soren entered [the library]599-the library [he]122-soren saw [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb in [his]191-ezylryb usual spot with a pile of dried caterpillars . [He]122-soren trotted up to [him]191-ezylryb . “ Hello , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb . It was a wonderful chaw . Do [you]191-ezylryb think there ’s any chance of another gale coming through soon — or maybe a tornado ? [Poot]219-poot says tornadoes are fantastic to fly . ”[122-soren]

But [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb barely looked up from [his]191-ezylryb book and growled in that unfriendly way [he]191-ezylryb had . [Soren]122-soren took a step back . [He]122-soren was confused . How could [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb be so different now than [he]122-soren had been when [they]1051-they were flying ? During weather chaw , [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb had been loud and boisterous and cracking wet poop jokes and singing raucously , and now [he]191-ezylryb was just [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb , [a distant , gruff old scholar with [his]191-ezylryb beak buried in a book]1052-a distant , gruff old scholar with his beak buried in a book . “ Better study for [your]122-soren test . And [Ruby]208-ruby over there needs some help . Flies like a dream but ca n’t spell worth a pellet . ”[191-ezylryb]

[Soren]122-soren backed away and then turned to [Ruby]208-ruby , who was hunched over the book Weather Systems and [Their]1053-them Structure : How to Fly Them , Analyze [Them]1053-them , and Survive [Them]1053-them , by [Ezekiel Ezylryb]191-ezylryb .

“ This is sooo hard , [Soren]122-soren ! [I]208-ruby ’ll never pass the test . ”[208-ruby]

CHAPTER NINETEEN

A Visit to [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk

[You]183-madame plonk see , [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk , [I]0-i know that perhaps this is not proper — [me]0-i coming to [you]183-madame plonk this way . ” [Soren]122-soren could hardly keep [his]122-soren mind on what [he]0-i was saying , as [he]122-soren had never in [his]122-soren life seen a hollow like this one . There were several openings through which light poured . There were pieces of cloth embroidered with beautiful designs and one little niche spilled over with strands of luminous beads . Indeed , the hollow seemed to swirl with color . And in the middle of all this color there was a dazzling whiteness — [Madame Plonk]183-madame plonk .[0-i]

[CHAPTER TWENTY

Fire]78-chapter twenty fire !

[Ezylryb]191-ezylryb perched on a limb at [the very top of the Great Ga’Hoole Tree]1069-the very top of the great ga’hoole tree and squinted into the blueness of the early summer day . By the time [Soren]122-soren got to the top limb , [the others]344-the others had assembled — albeit sleepily . “ Put a mouse in it , [Otulissa]176-otulissa , ”[197-bubo] [Bubo]197-bubo growled and delivered a field mouse headfirst into the talkative owl ’s beak .

“ Thank [you]122-soren , [Bubo]197-bubo , ”[191-ezylryb] [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb said in a low growl and blinked .

“ Do n’t worry , ”[191-ezylryb] [Ezylryb]191-ezylryb said . “ [We]1077-the three rybs ’re not flying yet . Not until later .
