THE GUARDIANS of GA’HOOLE

Book Three]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three : The Rescue

The dawn bled into night , faying the darkness , turning the black red , and [Soren]122-soren , with [Digger]126-digger by [his]122-soren side , flew through it .

“ Strange is n’t it , [Soren]122-soren , how even at night the comet makes this color ? ”[1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three]

“ [I]126-digger know . And look at those sparks from the tail just below the moon . [Great Glaux]131-glaux , even the moon is beginning to look red . ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger ’s voice was quavery with worry .

“ [I]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three told [you]122-soren about [Octavia]218-octavia . How [she]218-octavia thinks it ’s an omen , or at least [I]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three think [she]218-octavia thinks it is , even though [she]218-octavia wo n’t really admit it . ”[1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three]

“ Why wo n’t [she]218-octavia admit it ? ”[126-digger] [Digger]126-digger asked .

“ [I]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three think [she]218-octavia ’s sensitive about coming from [the great North Waters]81-north waters . [She]218-octavia says [everyone there]2045-everyone there is very superstitious , but [I]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three do n’t know , [I]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three guess [she]218-octavia just thinks the owls here will laugh at [her]218-octavia or something . [I]1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three ’m not sure . ”[1325-the great ga’hoole tree a peek at the guardians of ga’hoole book three]

Suddenly , [Soren]122-soren was experiencing a tight , uncomfortable feeling as [he]122-soren flew . [He]122-soren had never felt uncomfortable flying , even when [he]122-soren was diving into [the fringes of forest fires]1326-the fringes of forest fires to gather coals on colliering missions . But , indeed , [he]122-soren could almost feel the sparks from that comet ’s tail . It was as if they were hot sizzling points pinging off [his]122-soren wings , singeing [his]122-soren flight feathers as the infernos of burning forests never had . [He]122-soren carved a great downward arc in the night to try to escape it . Was [he]122-soren becoming like [Octavia]218-octavia ? Could [he]122-soren actually feel the comet ? Impossible ! The comet was hundreds of thousands , millions of leagues away . Now , suddenly , those sparks were turning to glints , sparkling silvery - gray glints . “ Flecks ! Flecks ! Flecks ! ”[122-soren] [he]122-soren screeched .

Lost Tales of Ga’Hoole

About the Author]1330-the great tree lost tales of ga’hoole about the author

[Kathryn Lasky]118-kathryn lasky has had a long fascination with owls . Several years ago , [she]118-kathryn lasky began doing extensive research about these birds and [their]1331-their behaviors . [She]118-kathryn lasky thought that [she]118-kathryn lasky would someday write a nonfiction book about owls illustrated with photographs by [[her]118-kathryn lasky husband]1332-her husband , [Christopher Knight]238-christopher knight . [She]118-kathryn lasky realized , though , that this would indeed be difficult since owls are shy , nocturnal creatures . So [she]118-kathryn lasky decided to write a fantasy about a world of owls . Even though it is an imaginary world in which owls can speak , think , and dream , [she]118-kathryn lasky wanted to include as much of [their]1331-their natural history as [she]118-kathryn lasky could .

[Kathryn Lasky]118-kathryn lasky has written many books , both fiction and nonfiction , including Sugaring Time , for which [she]118-kathryn lasky won a Newbery Honor . Among [her]118-kathryn lasky fiction books are The Night Journey , a winner of the National Jewish Book Award , and Beyond the Burning Time , an ALA Best Book for [Young Adults]1333-young adults , as well as [the Daughters of [the Sea]111-the sea]1334-the daughters of the sea and [Wolves of the Beyond series]1335-wolves of the beyond series . [She]118-kathryn lasky has also received the [Boston]112-boston Globe - Horn Book Award and the [Washington]113-washington Post Children ’s Book Guild Award for [her]118-kathryn lasky contribution to nonfiction .

[Lasky]118-kathryn lasky and [[her]118-kathryn lasky husband]1332-her husband live in [Cambridge]114-cambridge , [Massachusetts]115-massachusetts .
